name: Dance Floor Construction
description_book: Come out and help us set up the fabulous floor in the European Dance Pavilion!

name: Chirurgeon Orientation
description_book: Orientation for those wishing to volunteer at First Aid Point at Pennsic.

name: Travel and Trade in Anglo-Saxon England
description_book: Where did the Anglo-Saxons travel, how and why?
description_web: What forms of transportation were used during the Anglo-Saxon period? Where did they go? Why? How? How far? The Crusades were in part to protect pilgrimage routes. When did they start to go to the Holy Land, and where else did they go?

name: Basic 14th-Century Tablet-Woven Edge
description_book: How to work a basic tablet-woven braid directly onto a garment edge (gown center-front, buttoned sleeve, etc.).
description_web: One method of finishing edges, particularly load-bearing ones, in the 14th century was to tablet-weave a cord and sew it onto the piece as you worked. This sounds far more intimidating than it really is, even if you haven't picked up a set of tablets heretofore. (Demonstration, not hands-on.)

name: Beginning Tatting, Part 1
description_book: Tatting is a form of lacemaking. Supplies can be found at craft stores. Learn a craft that fits in a Ziplock bag, can be done in the car, or at court!
fee_itemization: I provide prewound shuttles and a handout with directions and projects.

name: A Period Basket. Really.
description_book: This year we will be constructing a triangular seed basket as pictured in several period illuminations.

name: Beginning Kumihimo
description_book: Part 1: Learn the basics of Japanese braiding using the modern foam disk. Students will learn a round, square and flat braid.
description_web: Part 1: Learn the basics of Japanese braiding using the modern foam disk. Students will learn a round, square and flat braid. Uses for, history and names of braids will be discussed. Students may bring own equipment if desired.
fee_itemization: total class is 10.00 if just handout 3.00

name: Ninja: Truth from Shadows
description_book: Dare you look into the shadows of history to find the truth? Come to discover both the legends and real history of Japan's famed assassins.
description_web: Dare you look into the shadows of history to find the truth? Come to discuss and discover the legends and real history of Japan's famed spies and assassins. This class will deconstruct the romanticized image of the Ninja and discuss the actual history of the world's most famous spies.

name: Really Long Fingerloop Braids
description_book: How to fingerloop braid a *really* long braid with a new modern trick that requires no special equipment beyond a bit of medical tape.
description_web: How to fingerloop braid a **really** long braid with a new modern trick that requires no special equipment beyond a bit of medical tape. A simple method for intermittent braiding using colored poster board will also be taught. Use this simple method for those really long bodice-lacing braids. Produce long-enough narrow trim very simply. It is helpful if students can already braid a finger loop braid. If you can't, class will try to get you going, class size permitting.

name: Intro to *Temari* - Japanese Embroidery Balls
description_book: Temari balls are wrapped, stitched, and woven into beautiful, colorful patterns that are impressive out of all proportion with how easy they are.
description_web: *Temari* dates to about 800 CE. They are based on simple geometry (almost no math needed) and wrapped, stitched, or woven to form patterns over the whole ball. This is a great art for the impatient, as each stitch visibly develops the pattern, and you can easily pick it up or put it down at any time. Best of all, they are impressive out of all proportion with how easy they are! The class will cover basic construction and marking and students will leave with one ball well underway.
fee_itemization: materials to complete one ball, plus enough to begin several more

name: Beginner Beadwork
description_book: Beginner class on how to put beads on fabric through the SCA time periods.
fee_itemization:
Handout printing costs
Bead, thread & Needle costs

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching.
description_web: During this ten-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and mundanely. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: Heraldry for Scribes
description_book: Beginning course for scribes who want to understand herald-speak.
description_web: What do heralds mean when they describe someone's device? Where can I find illustrations to their particular way of talking? Who can explain heraldese to me? This and many other questions that scribes have can be answered with this class. Class includes handouts and a brief slide show.
fee_itemization: Fee is for color handouts or students may request copies sent through the e-mail.

name: Pennsic Runestone Memorial Discussion
description_book: A discussion of the Pennsic Runestone Memorial Community Project - the concept, design, location and efforts needed to bring this project to light.
description_web: A discussion of the Pennsic Runestone Community Project - We will be discussing the concept behind this 9-ton memorial stone that will be carved by you. Most importantly, we will be discussing the funds and what all is needed to bring this project to completion. Those interested in the project as a curiosity are welcome as well as volunteers, donors and anyone who feels moved to be involved. We will discuss the design and the location of this memorial and the park that will evolve around it for memorial services, contemplation or a quiet read.  At the end of the discussion we will take a walk up to the area that has been granted us by the Coopers to carve and erect this memorial stone.

name: Beginning *Naalbinding*, and How to Make a Mitten
description_book: Learn how to do the basic Oslo stitch, increasing and decreasing stitches. Then put it all together and learn to make a mitten.
description_web: There are many different *naalbinding* stitches. The Oslo stitch is a common one used to make mittens. Come learn to do the stitch, and then put it all together and make a mitten.
fee_itemization: The handout is 10 pages, and includes some color pictures. The kit includes a naalbinding needle and wool yarn ball.

name: Waste-Free Garment Cutting
description_book: Twice the clothes from half the fabric...or at least, better clothes from less fabric. Come prepared to take notes.
description_web: Hand-spun, hand-woven, hand-finished...they never waste a single thread. You don't have to! An overview of the thriftiest cutting and sewing tricks used in the SCA's target centuries. We cover only pre-17th century Western European clothing.

name: Beginning Tatting, Part 2
description_book: Tatting is a type of lacemaking. Supplies can be found at craft stores. Learn a craft that fits in a Ziplock bag. Do it the car or at court!
fee_itemization: I provide a prewound shuttle, a handout with directions & projects.

name: Harp Tuning by Ear
description_book: A harp in tune is a beautiful thing. Learn to tune your harp by ear, starting from A-440 and listening for intervals.
description_web: A harp in tune is a beautiful thing. Learn to tune your harp by ear, starting from A-440 and listening for intervals.

name: Thomas Aquinas: The Dumb Ox, The Angelic Doctor
description_book: Aquinas sought to reconcile Aristotle and church doctrine, including the relationship between reason and faith, and the concept of the just war.
description_web: In the 13th century Thomas Aquinas sought to reconcile the writings of Aristotle with the doctrines of the church, carrying scholasticism to its ultimate conclusions. His ideas continue to influence both philosophy and theology to this day. We will review the events of his life and briefly explore some of his most important ideas, including his arguments for the existence of God, the relationship between reason and faith, and the concept of the just war.

name: Dancing for Children: Circles and Chases
description_book: It's never too early to learn to dance! Come learn dances fun for all. All youth in attendance require a responsible adult to be present. Ages 4 & up.
description_web: While open to all ages, the class will be geared towards fun and frolicking rather than perfecting steps and is suitable for ages 4 and up. All youth in attendance require a responsible adult to be present. After learning some basic steps, the class will cover a variety of circle dances before turning to the controlled chaos of chasing and "follow the leader" dances.

location: Silver Horde (Corner of Dragon Trace & Sedalia)
name: Pork and Garlic Chive Dumplings: *Jiu cai jiao zi*
description_book: Chinese pork and garlic chive dumplings. http://oriquilt.blogspot.com/2010/08/pennsic-recipes-1-pork-and-chive.html
description_web: Chinese pork and garlic chive dumplings. http://oriquilt.blogspot.com/2010/08/pennsic-recipes-1-pork-and-chive.html
fee_itemization: flour, ground pork, napa cabbage, garlic chives, dried shitake mushrooms, bean vermcelli, soy sauce, sesame oil, rice wine, dried shrimp, scallions, fresh ginger

name: Beginning *Pysanky*
description_book: Students will learn the history of the *pysanka*, and have the opportunity to create one of their own.
description_web: Students will learn the history of the *pysanka*, as well as the techniques involved, and have the opportunity to create one of their own. The class is listed as 3 hours to allow plenty of time for writing the shells; it doesn't usually take that long.
fee_itemization: $5 overall, $2 if you just want the handout (but it IS a hands-on class ...)

name: Intoduction to Labyrinths
description_book: Labyrinths wend through all of period. Learn the basic types and how to draw them. Explore their change over time. Taught by ”The Chalk Labyrinth Guy”
description_web: It matters not if you are Tudor or Turk, Norseman or Nepalese, Breton or Borgia, labyrinths are a part of your world. Topics covered are "What *is* a labyrinth?" ; categories and types; how to draw one; and a whirlwind tour of labyrinths in period. From storytelling devices to dancing floors, from monster trap to heavenly road the labyrinth has meant many things to many peoples. Brought to you by "That Chalk Labyrinth Guy."

name: History of Drinking: Common Medieval Drinks
description_book: History of drinks and how they affected society & culture. Includes samples & recipes of common drinks found in the Middle Age & SCA. Over 21 only.
description_web: A look at the history of drinks, especially those in the between 3rd-16th centuries and how they affected society and culture. Class will include samples (and recipes) of the most common drinks found in the Middle Ages (and in the SCA). No instruction on brewing provided. Over 21 only.

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Performing Arts Pavilion on Thursday afternoon of War Week. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.”

name: Heavenly Dancing
description_book: Learn two dances by Caroso, titled about celestial objects: *Ardente Sole* (Burning Sun) & *Fulgente Stella* (Shining Star). For all dance levels.
description_web: Come learn two dances by Caroso, titled about celestial objects: *Ardente Sole* (Burning Sun) and *Fulgente Stella* (Shining Star). Dancers of all levels welcome.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* & Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Persian Plants
description_book: Find out what plants grew in ancient Iran. Good for those interested in cooking, gardening, herbalism, or illumination.
description_web: Want to know what to plant in your Persian garden? Find out what plants grew in ancient Iran. Good for those interested in cooking, gardening, herbalism, miniature painting, or envisioning the period landscape. The class will draw from modern taxonomy, period illustrations, and period cooking. In addition, the class will cover which plants are available to plant in your garden, and which ones should be avoided.
fee_itemization: Two dollars covers a color handout.

name: White Work Embroidery
description_book: A brief history, a few stitches, a work in progress. Create a sampler of a few beginning stitches.

name: Livery Collars
description_book: An exploration of this elite accessory, with a focus on earlier examples and historical significance, plus a discussion of how to adapt to SCA use.

name: 11th-13th-Century Aquitainian Polyphony
description_book: Perhaps the earliest extant part-music we have is from monasteries in Eleanor of Aquitaine's backyard. Before the Notre-Dame school. Handout included.
description_web: Perhaps the earliest extant part-music we have is from monasteries in Eleanor of Aquitaine's backyard. We'll discuss the early evolution of written music, and the difficulties of reading it. This music pre-dates the Notre-Dame school of Leonin and Perotin. Handout with musical examples included.

name: Hand-Sewing 101
description_book: A discussion and hands-on of hand-sewing of garb, etc. This is not embroidery but useful stitches. Please bring needle, thread and light cloth.

name: Beginners' Inns of Courts
description_book: Middle class English dances from the Inns of Courts, simple enough for everyone to do. Very low impact. "Cheat notes" provided.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Court, Improv, and a Deck of Cards
description_book: Baronial or Royal Court as improv theatre; using a deck of index cards and some preparation to make it all run smoothly.
description_web: Court is both a planned experience and improv theatre all at once. This class will discuss one method of putting together Court - either Baronial or Royal - from an Eastern point of view, using a deck of index cards and a bit of preparation. We will discuss how to address the needs of your nobles, the protocol of who stands where in the Procession, how to move people around the stage, ways to lay out the court docket, and how to adapt to changes in the middle of Court..

name: Ditch that Dome!
description_book: How to shop for a period pavilion: practical considerations and planning tips. Spend your money wisely & end up a happy camper.
description_web: Tired of hiding your home-away-from-home behind decorative walls or other peoples' pavilions? Ready to move up to canvas and wood, or looking to downsize from that polefarm? Before you plunk down your cash or invest copious hours in project time, let one OCD tent-shopper share what she learned after making her first tent and buying her second tent. Practical considerations and planning tips covering types of tents, ease of transport and assembly, make-vs-buy, what you'll use it for, and how big your tent should be. Tents appropriate for your persona will be very briefly touched on, but this is mostly a nuts & bolts brain dump of assessing options and determining feasibility of portable structures.

name: Interrogating Your Museum
description_book: It's time to get more out of your museum. Find out what to ask, who to ask, and what to do with the answers once you have them.

name: Event Decorating on a Shoestring
description_book: Learn how to cut heraldic forms for centerpieces or wall decorations out of paper to decorate feast halls or event sites. Class materials supplied.
description_web: Learn how to cut heraldic forms for centerpieces or wall decorations out of paper to decorate feast halls or event sites. Applications for metalwork, leather work, stained glass or clothing decorations. Ages 12 & up. Class materials supplied. Pattern book available for $20.

name: 16th-Century Spanish Sleeves
description_book: A look at 16th-century Spanish sleeves - undersleeves, hanging sleeves, shoulder caps, split sleeves, and oversized sleeves.
description_web: A review of sleeves on men and women's garb in 16th-century Spain. After perusing pictures of undersleeves, hanging sleeves, shoulder caps, split sleeves and oversized sleeves, there will be discussion of how they likely were made.

name: Beginner Dance: 16th-Century Italian Dance
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class starts with basic steps and patterns, then teaches simple, late 16th-C Italian dances.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class starts with basic steps and patterns, then teaches simple, late 16th-C. Italian dances. *La Castellana* will be taught.

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Warp a loom, weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own.

name: Heraldic Flag Design
description_book: Learn about the various types of heraldic flags that existed in period, their design and application. Then design your own!
description_web: What does one do with those fantastic animals, interesting designs and brilliant colors needed for a good heraldic design? And where does one apply said design? Before heraldry ever appeared on shield and surcoat, those heraldic designs fluttered over the heads of kings and peasants, like majestic birds, in the form of banners, pennons, standards and gonfalons. Learn about the various types of heraldic flags that existed in period, their design and application. Then design your own!

name: Eight Essential Knots for the SCA Camper
description_book: Hands-on class on how to tie eight basic and important knots that can make your camping life easier and safer.
description_web: Hands-on class on how to tie eight basic and important knots that can make your camping life easier and safer.

name: The Peplos Dress: It's *Not* a Baggy Bog Dress
description_book: The peplos: History during the times and cultures covered by the SCA, how to make one, and how to wear it.

name: Beyond the T-tunic: The Bocksten Cote and Hood
description_book: Covers the history, cut, fitting, and trims and fabrics to use for the Bocksten Cote & Hood. Each student *should bring a tape measure*.
description_web: The one-piece cut for the t-tunic that we so often introduce newcomers to cannot be easily documented, either in the archaeological finds, or in the artistic remains from the Dark Ages. One cut that was commonly found, however, is typified by the Bocksten Bog find in Sweden. This class covers the history, cut, fitting, and appropriate trims and fabrics to use for this garment. Each student will leave with a pattern for a Bocksten Cote that has been individually adapted to their measurements. Also included is a discussion of the hood found nearby, and a reconstruction of a hood pattern possibly in use at that time. Students *should bring a tape measure* to class.

name: Introduction to All-Grain Brewing
description_book: For kit/extract brewers wishing to move up to making beer from all-grain recipes. Hands-on, 2-hr. class covering equipment and methods. Over 21 only.
description_web: For kit/extract brewers who wish to move up to making beer from all-grain recipes. Taught as a 2-hour, hands-on class covering equipment and methods, insights to period practices and recipes. Tips on brewing at Pennsic for Pennsic. (Students are invited to stop by instructor's camp in second week to taste the short ale made during the class.) Over 21 only.

name: Beginner Dance: English Country Dance
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then teach simple English Country Dance.

name: Advanced *Repoussé* & Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block working, forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block working, forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.

name: Building Scrolls Without a Book of Hours
description_book: What? No Book of Hours? Yes! Learn how to use period artwork to build scrolls and break into a new area of creativity.

name: Basic Ka-Kha-Ga-Gha
description_book: Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *devanagari* script used by Hindi, Sanskrit and other Indic languages.
description_web:
Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *devanagari* script used by Hindi and other North Indic languages (including Sanskrit, post-period). While the focus of this class is on Hindi usage, the characters and pronunciation are nearly identical for the others. There will be examples in Hindi. Please bring a writing utensil which makes a dark, easily-visible line. This is not a calligraphy class.
1st hour: Basic characters and pronunciation
2nd hour:  Vowel and half-letters forms; more if time and student interest allow.

name: Gresley Dances: Troublesome Tribus
description_book: These 15th-C English dances are for groups of three and are slightly more challenging.
description_web: These 15th-C English dances are for groups of three and are slightly more challenging.

name: Quick & Easy Handmade Largess
description_book: A discussion about largess - why we should give it, why you should make it, and what options are out there. We will make two to three examples.
description_web: A discussion about largess - why we should give it, why you should make it, and what options are out there. We will make two to three examples.

name: Song of the Valkyrie
description_book: A look at the *Darradarljod*, a Norse poem which compares battle to weaving; includes an account of the Battle of Clontarf (north of Dublin-1014 CE).
description_web: A look at the *Darradarljod*, a Norse poem which compares battle to weaving; including an account of the Battle of Clontarf (north of Dublin - 1014 CE).

name: Open Dancing
description_book: Join us all evening for dancing by request.

name: Morris Games
description_book: We will teach Nine Man's Morris and other games of that family (which include the modern tic tac toe).
description_web: We will teach Nine Man's Morris and other games of that family (which include the modern tic tac toe).

name: Scribal Efficiency
description_book: Tips, tricks, and esoteric ways to become more efficient in the scribal arts. A general working knowledge about the scribal arts is recommended.
description_web: Taught by a professional stained glass artist by day, scribal geek by night.  Come learn some new tips, tricks, and esoteric bits on how to become a more efficient scribe. This class is geared towards folks with a general working knowledge about the role that the scribe plays in the SCA, and is suitable for both calligraphers and illuminators.  Calligraphers should bring a ruler and pencil.
fee_itemization: pay for printing costs of handout.

name: Blackwork Embroidery: Make-and-Take Needlebook
description_book: Learn basic blackwork embroidery stitches while creating a needlebook. Bring scissors.
description_web: Ever been curious about the stunningly detailed blackwork embroidery popular during the later periods? In this class you will learn the basic techniques of blackwork, including the Holbein (double running) stitch and backstitch. Learn tips on preparing your ground cloth, starting and stopping stitches, and using beeswax to strengthen and aid stitching. No embroidery experience necessary! Participants will receive a “make-and-take” blackwork kit that includes everything you need to make a small needlebook with a blackworked embroidery cover (thread, needle, cloth, wax, and instructional booklet). Please bring a pair of scissors and magnifying glasses if you have any difficulties seeing up close. (I will have a couple of these on hand if necessary, too.)
fee_itemization:
Small box - $2
Cloth - $1
Silk thread - $1
Wax - .50
Needle - .50

name: Beginning Knitting
description_book: This is a beginning class.  Learn how to cast on, knit, purl, and cast off.  You may bring your own materials.
description_web: This is a beginning class.  Learn how to cast on, knit, purl, and cast off.  You may bring your own materials.

instructor: Lady Angharad verch Glyndwr O Llang
name: Basic Bookbinding
description_book: Basic binding of books, history, hands-on, practical application. Learn different stitches and page attachment; leave with a small bound book.
description_web: Basic binding of books, a bit of history, hands-on, and practical application. Participants will learn different types of stitching and page attachment, plus covers, and will leave with a small bound book and/or a girdlebook cover.

name: Baby Carrier Survival Guide
description_book: Babywearing 101 to advanced. Help in using any carrier, history, safety and more. Lots of hands-on & trouble-shooting. Bring baby. Latecomers welcome.
description_web: Babywearing 101 to advanced. Do you want to use a carrier at Pennsic but just can't "get" it? We have learned over time that holding your baby is good for them - and you. We have also experienced a baby that wants to be in arms most of the time. A quality carrier or a simple piece of cloth can give you that extra pair of hands you always think about. We will talk about historical carriers, extreme temperature baby-wearing, and how women managed in the hot fields world-wide and wore their baby. Expect lots of hands-on. You will learn new baby-wearing skills. Bring your carrier. I will be able to trouble shoot with you and show you how to be more comfortable with it. If your baby is fussy in a carrier, we can work together and see if there is a way he/she DOES like to be worn. While I will discuss historical carriers, trouble-shooting and getting everyone comfortable with a carrier is the focus of this class.This class was slotted for 2 hours, you can come any time even if the class is going on. Bring a flash drive to download my information.

name: Beginning Illumination: Loving the Dot
description_book: Let me show you that illumination doesn't have to be a daunting as it seems. Learn about layout, design elements and, yes, dots, Dots, *DOTS*!
description_web: So you've seen those beautiful manuscripts and thought you'd love to learn how to create one on your own, but surely they are too daunting! Well, I'd like to show you how to visually break down complicated scroll designs into more manageable and doable elements. You'll even try your hand at a few of them! Materials available for the fee, or bring your own.
fee_itemization: Unless you bring your own painting materials, you can get a kit with brushes, paper, and a small bit of gouache.  If you don't use the kit, a few dollars donation for the paper and paint you will use would be helpful.

name: Wool Spinning with Spindle Stick and Distaff
description_book: Wool spinning using a long spindle stick (provided) rotated in the palm of the hand. Distaff mounting technique of wool fiber included.
description_web: The long spindle stick, rotated when held in the palm, is probably a very ancient technique which has survived in Portugal and Eastern Europe up to modern times. The spindle stick, approx 18-19 inches long, is tapered at both ends. It is held horizontally and the wool fiber is twisted off one end, using a distaff to hold the fibers. The yarn created is wound around the center of the spindle stick. A limited number of spindle sticks and simple distaffs will be available. Students should wear a belt.
fee_itemization:
copy cost for paper printing.
Cost of wood and shaping for spindles.

name: Fruit dishes from *Scappi*
description_book: This class covers the use of fruit in 16th-century Italian menus and recipes from *Scappi*, the ultimate 16th-century Italian cookbook.
description_web: Over the years I have taught salads, vegetables, meats, fish, pastries, and more from *Scappi* but never fruit. In this class we will cover the role of fruit in the menus given by *Scappi* and give a few of the fruit recipes from all chapters.

name: Siege Fighting for Women and Anyone Else
description_book: This class has been created to give you a place to start if you are interested in participating in fighting with Siege Weapons.
description_web: This class has been created to give you a place to start if you are interested in participating in fighting with Siege Weapons.

name: Throw Away Your Wristwatch: Basic and Advanced
description_book: Period methods of timekeeping. First 10 minutes teaches several ways to tell time. Last 50 minutes teaches you how to tell time anywhere, anytime.
description_web: Learn period methods of timekeeping to tell time day and night at Pennsic. Basic course (first 10 minutes) teaches several ways to tell time. Advanced course delves into the science and teaches more ways to tell time so you can tell time anywhere, anytime.

name: Intermediate Kumihimo
description_book: Part 2: Students will continue to learn more braids on foam disk. There will be four new braids taught in this class.
description_web: Part 2: Students will continue to learn more braids on foam disk. There will be four new braids taught in this class. Students will also learn how to finish braids in many different styles.
fee_itemization:
10.00 for materials & handout
3.00 for handout only

name: 16th-Century Tuscan Women's Hairstyles
description_book: Learn some techniques to replicate 16th-C hairstyles. A focus on Italian fashions, but applicable to most of Europe. Options for short hair, too!

name: *RunValdr*
description_book: System for using runes for healing and "magic."
description_web: In period runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to heal even at distance, to awaken inanimate objects, to stop migraines, and more.

name: The Two-Beam Vertical Loom: Part 1
description_book: Warping and weaving on a two-beam vertical loom. This is part 1 of a two-part, hands-on class. We will be warping the loom.

name: Food to Feast
description_book: Hands-on cooking in private camp. Make SCA-period dishes with period techniques and dine on the results.
description_web: This class is a hands-on cooking class using SCA-period recipes and cooking techniques including grilling, baking in wood-burning oven, and use of a brazier. Instructions on making cook fires and chopping wood also included. Learn how to schedule, prep, and cook a meal for 12. Students will lunch on the results of their efforts.
fee_itemization: We will be preparing a meal that the students get to eat. Material fee to cover the cost of the food.

name: Henna History and Application
description_book: Learn how and why henna was used in period, and how you can use it yourself. We will mix some henna in class and everyone gets some to try.
fee_itemization: One cone of fresh henna paste. You may also take the class without this, or bring your own.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching.
description_web: During this ten-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and mundanely. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Calligraphy 101
description_book: Learn the basics of calligraphy; practice techniques of beginning alphabets using Speedball dip pens and India ink. For beginners

name: Heralding Equestrian Events
description_book: Learn about equestrian contests, explaining them to the populace and announcing the riders and horses.
description_web: There's nothing like the pageantry of an equestrian emprise. This class will teach you about equestrian contests, explaining them to the populace and announcing the riders and horses.

name: Pogroms and Persona
description_book: Discussion of how one's persona thinks about brutal medieval events. The Vienna *Gesera* of 1421 is a case study.
description_web: Discussion of how one's persona thinks about brutal medieval events. The Vienna *Gesera* of 1421 is a case study.

instructor: Lady Angharad verch Glyndwr O Llang
name: Basic Jewelry-Making, or How to Float a Pearl
description_book: Basics on design/recreation of jewelry including closures, spacing, double/triple strands, scalloping, extra adornments, fixing broken items.
description_web: Basics on design or recreation of jewelry including closures, spacing, double/triple strands, achieving scalloping, adding extra adornments, fixing a broken item, making a floating bead necklace, dropping a knot where you want it.
fee_itemization: handout, kit with wire, string, beads, trinkets, closures

name: Simply Plaited: 14th-Century Women's Hair
description_book: Theorized period methods of achieving three 14th-C hairstyles popular in England and France with archaeological and artistic examples. Instructional.
description_web: Theorized  period methods of achieving three 14th-century hairstyles popular in England and France. Period archaeological and artistic examples will be shown/demonstrated. Discussion of the use of modern materials also included.

name: Viking Navigation
description_book: This class will present at least two of the methods of direction-finding seen in the Viking TV series.
description_web: The methods of navigation employed by the Viking navigators are currently unverifiable by archeological evidence. However, the search for answers goes on. This class will present the arguments for at least two methods of direction-finding by experts in the field. The published findings of Soren Thirslund from the Danish National Maritime Museum and Leif Karlsen, a retired merchant marine navigator will be presented. Both of these gentlemen’s published findings are internationally recognized and available from the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde Denmark. Hands-on demonstrations and primary source documentation of these authors’ navigation theories.

name: Dressing a Distaff with Flax
description_book: Learn about different styles of distaff and how to use them.
description_web: Flax-spinning cultures developed a variety of distaff styles. I'll show you a few different types and demonstrate how to dress them.

name: Introduction to Spinning Poi
description_book: In this one-hour workshop you will learn some of the basic poi movements and terminology necessary to get you started.
description_web: In this one-hour workshop you will learn some of the basic poi movements and terminology necessary to get you started. Poi spinning is a great low-impact workout that will help you to improve your coordination and give your fitness routine some "flare"! After paying for their first class, students are welcome to return to subsequent classes free of charge!
fee_itemization: $20.00 Material Fee covers handout, poi, and refreshments

name: Armor Extrication
description_book: Learn how to remove armor without injuring yourself, the fighter, or their armor and when to use it (splinting/support).
description_web: Learn how to remove armor without injuring yourself, the fighter, or their armor and when to use it (splinting/support). Covers the assorted types of armor used in all adult and youth SCA martial activities. While the class is directed toward first aid providers, it is useful knowledge for anyone who may be assisting armored individuals. The logic presented here can also be applied to complex garb. This class will be part class room and part walking tour of the combat areas. Volunteers will provide you the opportunity get hands-on practice during the class.

name: Dancing for Children: Bransles
description_book: It's never too early to learn to dance! Learn dances (bransles) fun for all ages. All youth in attendance require a responsible adult to be present.

name: Simple Board Games
description_book: Many were tavern games but are great fun for young folks without the adult context. Parents must accompany children.
description_web: Simple board games for our younger members such as Morris and Goose will be taught. All are welcome as many of these games are known from their tavern versions. This is an introductory class and lots of time to play will be included.

name: Yes, Virginia, You CAN Build a Yurt
description_book: Yurts are 18 shades of groovy, but quite expensive. The charming and talented Majester Alchamar will teach you how to build your own. You can do this.
description_web: If you're reading this, you probably already know what a yurt is: round, Mongolian-based tents that have no poles, guy lines, and no corners. But in addition to being 18 different shades of groovy, they cost a fair penny to buy. What if I told you that you could trade a bunch of the cash outlay for elbow grease instead? It's true, and I invite to join the class to see how it's done. We'll touch on tools, materials, and techniques, using advanced technical terms like "... and remember, don't bleed on the saw". With a decade-and-a-half of yurt-building experience, I'll be your instructor and comic relief. I'm charming, talented, and incredibly handsome. And humble. But seriously, c'mon down, we'll have some fun expanding our list of Things We Can Do.
fee_itemization: The hand-out is just over 20 pages. It costs at least that much to print the things. It might have gone up since last year. But I plan to make free e-mail copies available to those who'd prefer it.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Traditional Norwegian Brewing
description_book: Ale and beer...the joy of life! We will trace the evolution and brewing techniques used in rural Norway from the earliest records. Recipes included.
description_web: Ale and beer: the joy of life! If one has bread, one also has beer, rich in vitamin B. We will explore the entire process from malting the grain to taking the first sip. Recipes, folklore, the tools used, brewing charms, and more will also be presented.

name: In Search of the French Hood
description_book: Come see where this headdress was worn and how it evolved from a simple veil in the late 15th century to the layered "hood" of the 16th century.
description_web: The French Hood is usually thought of as a 16th-century English headdress. However, forms of this headdress were worn in several countries. In this class, we'll see where this headdress was worn as well as how it evolved from a simple veil in the late 15th century to the more elaborate layered "hood" of the mid- to late 16th century.

name: Advanced Kumihimo
description_book: Part 3: New foam loom is taught with new braid structures. Square loom used.
description_web: Part 3: New foam loom is taught with new braid structures. Square loom used.

name: Spinning Flax on a Wheel
description_book: Spinning flax is fun! Learn to spin flax on a wheel from a distaff.
description_web: Spinning flax is fun! It's frustrating! It's a unique spinning experience! With the fibers measuring from 24-36 inches, it's a completely different experience than spinning even the longest staple wool. We'll talk about using a distaff, and other ways to support the fibers. I'll show you how I dress my tree-branch distaff, and those interested may spin at my wheel. You may also bring your own if you like. I find that I prefer my double-drive wheel with attached distaff for flax spinning, but plenty of folks use their Scotch tension wheels quite successfully. This class is an advanced-level spinning class though all are welcome to come listen and watch.

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Performing Arts Pavilion on Thursday afternoon of War Week. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.”

name: Basic Tablet Weaving
description_book: Learn to warp the loom and weave a basic pattern. Limited number of small looms should be available for use and/or purchase.

name: *Contentezza D'Amore*
description_book: Come learn *Contentezza D'Amore*, one of the most beautiful of the 16th-C Balli! Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.
description_web: Come learn *Contentezza D'Amore*, one of the most beautiful of the 16th-century Balli! Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* & Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: I Just Want to Bellydance
description_book: Want to dance at the numerous drum circles at Pennsic? Learn to listen to the music and practice some traditional movements. Fun is emphasized.
description_web: Want to dance at the numerous drum circles at Pennsic? This class introduces you to basic movements & listening to the music to find your personal style. Posture, attitude, stretching & fun are emphasized. Learn how to use mental cues and "pods" of movement to extend your dancing time.

name: Medieval Pottery Kiln Building
description_book: Build a medieval English-style kiln from scratch using local clay & straw, with discussion of principles and precedents. Partial attendance OK. Muddy!
description_web:
We will build a medieval English-style kiln from scratch using local clay & straw, with discussion of principles and precedents. Partial attendance OK. Potters, ask to use my wheel (Okewode Hall, #160 Battle Rd) or hand-build pots to fire when dry.
Kiln site: Long Way, between North Gate & Shadowclans Cathedral.

name: Choosing An SCA Registerable Name
description_book: What will work and what likely won't when choosing an SCA name the College will register.
description_web: Names are important. They are often the first thing other people have to form an opinion of us. We can invest a lot of time and emotion in coming up with a name. However, if it doesn't follow reasonable historical practice or general SCA standards, it won't be registered. In this class we'll discuss what the SCA requires in a name, what was generally historically done, and how to avoid heartache over your desired name.

name: Historical Uses of Poisons
description_book: A rundown of the weaponization of poisons in history garnered from various resources.
description_web: A rundown of the weaponization of poisonous plants (and two rocks) as recorded in history. A summary garnered from various resources, the compilation paints a unique picture of warfare and weaponization techniques from several cultures.

name: Norse Runes and Divination
description_book: An introduction to the history, linguistics, and magical uses of the Runic alphabets. Several divination methods will be presented.
description_web: This class provides an introduction to the Runic alphabets in use by the Norse peoples prior to their conversion to Christianity, and hence the Latin alphabet. History and linguistic uses are covered, as well as their use in magic. Several methods of divination using Rune Stones will be discussed.

name: Sexy, Silly, Scheming Saints
description_book: Think saints' lives are boring? Think again! We'll explore saint stories from *The Golden Legend* that would fit right in on prime time TV.
description_web: Slept through Sunday school? Think saints' lives are boring? Think again! In this class, we'll explore saint stories from the medieval bestseller, *The Golden Legend*, that would fit right in on prime time TV. (Some themes not appropriate for children.)

name: Wire-Wrapped Jewelry
description_book: Learn the basics of wire-wrapped jewelry and make a bracelet or medallion hanger.
description_web: Learn the basics of wire-wrapped jewelry and make a bracelet or medallion hanger. Please bring tools, wire and beads if you have them. There will be some tools available to borrow and some to purchase at cost.

name: Pastries and Cookies from the 1549 *Banchetti*
description_book: Cheese pastry stars, rich raisin pastries, and sugar and cinnamon cookies from the 1549 Italian cookbook *Banchetti*, by Cristoforo di Messisbugo.

name: Presenting Period Vocal Performance
description_book: Presenting period poems or songs you love, maybe with unusual languages or unfamiliar sounds. Ways to select, prepare, and perform engagingly.
description_web: Have you ever found an awesome period song or poem that you really wanted to perform, but weren't sure how to present a piece that's in an unusual language or with an unfamiliar sound? This class will discuss various ways to select, prepare, and present extant pre-1600 vocal material, culminating with a walk through an example from the instructor's own repertoire.

name: Medieval Chasing and Tag Games
description_book: Want to tire your children out using medieval games? Then this class is for you! We'll learn and play four simple medieval chasing and tag games.
description_web: Want to tire your children out using medieval games? Then this class is for you! We'll learn and play four simple medieval chasing and tag games: Que Loo Loo, or Wolf's Tail; Tierce; Fox and Chickens; and How Many Miles to London? These games come from the book "Medieval Games" by Salaamallah the Corpulent.

name: Dances with Heys
description_book: Dances will include Grimstock, Goddesses, and Picking of Sticks.

name: Tarot and other Period Card Games
description_book: Games Tent staff teach a variety of period card games, then we play. Games may include "The Game of Tarot", "Losing Lodum", "Laugh and Lie Down".
description_web: Games Tent staff teach a variety of period card games. Games taught may include "The Game of Tarot", "Losing Lodum", "Laugh and Lie Down". Time for play will follow.

name: *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*: A Masterful Model
description_book: An overview of this virtuoso model book of calligraphy, written in 1561-62 by one Renaissance master and illuminated 30 years later by another.
description_web: Calligraphers gush when describing this virtuoso model book of calligraphy, written in 1561-62 by one Renaissance master and illuminated 30 years later by another. Find out why it’s so amazing and what it offers SCA scribes. This year’s Advanced Calligraphy track will offer an in-depth study of several of the scripts in this manuscript.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: The Submission Process
description_book: This class explains the basics of documenting and submitting a name, device or badge, and what happens to it afterwards.
description_web: So, you've worked with a herald to register your name and/or armory. What happens now? This class intends to explain the basics of documenting and submitting a name, device or badge, and what happens to it afterwards.

name: Half-Linings Considered Harmful
description_book: This class will examine fashion fabric, lining, and construction choices for the Gothic (late 14th-century) fitted dress.
description_web: This class will examine fashion fabric, lining, and construction choices for the Gothic fitted dress. Particular attention is paid to preferred choices as recorded in primary sources, and alternative options that acknowledge the widely variant needs of a lady of the Society from those of her ancestress.

name: Counted Work Not Displayed at the Met
description_book: The Metropolitan Museum has interesting embroideries not displayed to the public, but sometimes photographs can be made.
description_web: The Metropolitan Museum has interesting embroideries not displayed to the public, but I was able to photograph some to show, including a few reverse sides. Since the Met does not allow copies of the photos to be given out, the handout will include some charts instead. These items and fragments sometimes have interesting differences from those the public sees.

name: Jewish Heraldry and Onomastics
description_book: How to create a period Jewish name and/or device. Covers forms used in different languages plus Jewish symbols used in period heraldry.
description_web: How to create a period Jewish name and/or device. The class will cover forms used in different languages plus Jewish symbols used in period heraldry. The class will cover the evolution of Jewish names over time (and place), as well as Jewish canting arms.

name: Mead Begins with Bees
description_book: Class covers site selection, reference material sources, basic equipment needed to set up an apiary, all before you get your bees.

name: Analysis of 15th-Century Polyphony
description_book: In this class we'll look at a piece of 15th-C. polyphonic music, discuss the features of the music and how to perform it thoughtfully.

name: Advanced Labyrinths
description_book: A more in-depth look into the symbolism and use of the labyrinth in specific cultures (to be determined by participants)
description_web: A more in-depth look at the symbolism and use of the labyrinth in certain cultures. Participants will help guide the discussion with their questions.

name: Confections and the Banquet
description_book: What was a "banquet"? What was served and where? Includes sugar work, recipes.
description_web: The Elizabethan "banquet" was what we call "dessert". Learn what confections were served and where. See examples of sugar work. Handouts can be available electronically.

name: Beginner Dance: Absolute Beginner Dance
description_book: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We’ll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the ball!
description_web: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We’ll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the ball! No partner needed.

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a trim strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a trim strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: I Spy: Calligraphy
description_book: Want your calligraphy look more “medieval"? Letters don't look quite right? Learn how to analyze calligraphy and take your letters to the next level.
description_web: Searching for ways to make your calligraphy look more “medieval"? Not sure why your letters don't look quite right? This class will show you how to analyze calligraphy and take your letters to the next level. We will apply what we've discovered by learning a late-period Italian script, Rotunda, one of the scripts used in *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*. Some calligraphy experience is helpful.

name: Ships in the SCA Period: A Chronological Overview
description_book: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.
description_web: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.

name: The Cubic Equation, or Dueling Mathematicians
description_book: The solution of the cubic equation changed the world. Come learn why. Learn about the sordid lives of those who helped it along.
description_web: We will discuss the the cubic equation: how it was discovered, who it was who discovered it, and how it changed the world. And, with perhaps a small emphasis on the more sordid details. (Just why is it mathematicians never die of old age, surrounded by their loving children? And are angels really bound by the secular courts?)

name: Don’t Shave a Saxon, and Other Early Period Laws
description_book: Laws reveal many of a culture’s daily problems and priorities. Let's see what the Anglo Saxons, Salian Franks, Lombards, and Irish called important.
description_web: Most laws are retroactive and a reflection of the problems facing a community. As the law of the Roman Empire retreated, the tribal laws of the Anglo Saxons, Salian Franks, and Lombards surfaced, each with their own flavors and foci.   How they identified their problems, and how they chose to correct them tell us a lot about the daily life of the people in those communities. The Irish, in contrast, never felt the direct influence of the *Lex Romana*, and that also shows an effect.

name: Feasts are More than Cooking
description_book: A discussion of the many things needed for a successful feast that are not in the kitchen.

name: Embroidery for Children and the Young at Heart
description_book: Children learned to embroider at a young age in the Middle Ages. Children as young as four can manage nice freehand embroidery.
fee_itemization: Favor blank, small hoop, needle, embroidery floss.

name: Beginner Dance: The Inns of Court (Old Measures)
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Class starts with basic steps & patterns, & then teaches simple dances from Elizabethan England.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.

name: Youth Pilgrim's Bags
description_book: Make a youth pilgrim's bag out of felt. All materials provided to the first 15 along with instruction.
description_web: Make a youth pilgrim's bag out of felt. All material provided to the first 15 along with instruction. This is open to all youth 8-14 years old, with a responsible adult.

name: Middle Eastern Music and Dance
description_book: A time for people of all skill levels to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. All instruments are welcome, and loaner drums are available!
description_web: A time for people interested in Middle Eastern music and dance to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. We will be providing instruction appropriate to the interest of the attendees, from beginning Middle Eastern drum and belly dance to teaching songs in which everyone can participate. All skill levels and instruments are welcome, and drums are available for borrowing!

name: Simple Italian Dances from *Il Ballarino* 1580
description_book: Dances easily reconstructed from primary sources using modern technology. Time permitting, *Conto Dell'Orco, Se Pensando al Partire & Candida Luna*.

name: The Polearm Techniques of Paulus Hector Mair
description_book: A look at several techniques from the 16th-C manual of arms of Paulus Hector Mair.

name: The Shady Valley of Bizarre Love
description_book: We'll be doing two dances, *Ombrosa Valle* from Caroso, and *Bizzarria d'Amore* from Negri, as reconstructed by the teacher.
description_web: We'll be doing two dances, *Ombrosa Valle* from Caroso, and *Bizzarria d'Amore* from Negri, as reconstructed by the teacher.

name: Timeline of Soothsaying
description_book: When and where different forms of divination were practiced.
description_web: Don't just do a "Celtic Cross" with your "Steampunk" or "Dragon" Tarot. What form of divination is correct for your persona? When and where were palmistry, runes, tarot, numerology, and other forms of divination used? What were some of the more interesting forms of divination in period?

name: Open Dancing
description_book: Join us all evening for dancing by request.

name: ASHI First Aid & CPR Challenges
description_book: For current ASHI First Aid and CPR card holders whose cards expire soon and wish to challenge the written test and skills demonstration.
description_web: For current ASHI First Aid and CPR card holders whose cards expire soon and wish to challenge the written test and skills demonstration. Textbooks are available for review prior to taking the challenge.
fee_itemization: $15 per certification.  Extra charge for textbook if you wish to keep it.

name: *Opus Anglicanum* - Underside Couching
description_book: *Opus Anglicanum* embroidery has several defining characteristics. This class concentrates on teaching the underside couching portion of this style.
description_web: There have been numerous classes on aspects of *Opus Anglicanum* embroidery at Pennsic University. However, the underside couching portion has been under-represented. The technique produces a wonderful textural effect in the background. We will learn the technique, some history and, if time permits, review the split stitch part of the style.

name: The Bayeaux Tapestry
description_book: We will look at a history of the tapestry: the why, where, who and hows of its construction, as well as the embroidery used in its making.
description_web: In the first half of this class, we will delve into the history of the Bayeaux tapestry. The second half will be devoted to the embroidery used in its construction. There will be reconstruction pieces to look at, as well as recreations of frames and tools that were used at the time.
fee_itemization: $2 for color copies of the 10 page hand out.

name: Archaeological Textiles: Context and Provenance
description_book: This class will look at textiles that have been recovered from numerous archaeological excavations from around Europe and the Mid-East.
description_web: This class will look at textiles and textile production tools that been recovered from archaeological excavations, the structures and the fibers and tools used in their production. Sites include Northern Europe, British Islands, the Mediterranean and the Middle East prior to the Middle Ages.

name: Breastfeeding Support  Group
description_book: Are you pregnant or nursing & would like support? Please come. Nursing kids, IBCLC, La Leche Leaders, LCs, Counselors. Late is ok.
description_web: Breast-feeders, unite. Come join us If you are pregnant or nursing (any age child) or if you are a support person or educator. You are welcome to come, hang out and learn about breastfeeding and overcoming issues. Sometimes we all need help when we are working through issues like heat, growth spurts, teething, first foods and weaning. This is a casual group. If you have learned something about breastfeeding, and you think it would benefit others, please feel free to share it. If you are an IBCLC, LC, Support Counselor, Educator, La Leche League leader or associate, please come and provide your support.

name: Fingerloop Braiding for Beginners
description_book: A hands-on class learning a 5-loop braiding technique. Useful as decoration or cording. With slight variation it can be made into lanyard for tokens.

name: Henry VII of England: A Modern Monarch
description_book: A short presentation and discussion regarding Henry VII, 1485-1509, as a modern administrator rather than War King.
description_web: A short presentation and discussion regarding Henry VII, 1485-1509, as a modern administrator rather than War Lord/King.

name: FAP: Introduction to *Armizare*
description_book: Freelance Academy Press presents an introduction to *Armizare* (the Italian Art of Arms).
description_web: Freelance Academy Press Presents an introduction to *Armizare* (the Italian Art of Arms).

name: Fabric 101
description_book: Overview of period-appropriate fabrics, fabric use, fabric types; identifying fabric using a burn test or chemical test. Hands-on.

name: Christmas (Music) in July
description_book: Music-reading session on period music for 12th Night or Wassail. Singers and instrumentalists welcome. Public domain music, handout, no charge.
description_web: Bring your singing voice or instrument to a music-reading session featuring SCA-period Christmas/Yule music for 12th Night or Wassail. Public domain music, handout provided, no charge.

name: SCAbominations
description_book: The things the SCA taught you about the Middle Ages that just aren't true. Includes brief discussion of prostitution.
description_web: The things the SCA taught you about the Dark Ages, Middle Ages, and Renaissance that just aren't true. Includes a brief discussion of prostitution.

name: If Looks Could Kill - Evil Eye Amulets
description_book: Discussion of the history of the "Evil Eye" and the amulets used in the SCA time period.
description_web: In-depth discussion of the history of the "Evil Eye". What is it and how it influenced people in the ancient world. Discussion of the amulets used for protection through many cultures and time periods to modern day.

name: Mind the Beeswax: Wax Carving for All Ages
description_book: Come learn the time-honored techniques of beeswax carving. Then try it yourself with simple tools. Great for parent and child! Fun and easy.
description_web: Come learn about the time-honored technique of beeswax carving. Then try it yourself with simple tools. Great for parent and child! Fun and easy.

name: Harp Accompaniment for Storytelling and Song
description_book: Learn to create simple harp accompaniment that will support and augment, but not distract from, a vocal performance of story, poetry, or song.
description_web: Learn to create simple harp accompaniment that will support and augment, but not distract from, a vocal performance of story, poetry, or song. Assess the tone, cadence, and flow of a piece, then assemble a lovely and manageable accompaniment from a palette of musical pairings. Handouts and sample musical patterns provided.

name: Butter 101
description_book: Learn to make butter, learn some basic history and chemistry of butter, and bring home some butter to your encampment! It's very easy!

name: The Astrolabe in Theory and Practice
description_book: This class will discuss the history and theory of the astrolabe and provide extensive, hands-on practical experience.
description_web: This class will discuss the history and theory of the astrolabe and provide extensive, hands-on practical experience. Details at http://astrolabeproject.com
fee_itemization: Fee covers part of the cost of a large (50+ page) handout.

name: Beginning Sprang
description_book: Viking/Coptic twisted-thread weaving technique. Learn to warp a frame and do a basic stitch to make a pouch.
description_web: Sprang is a weaving technique without a weft thread. The warp is twisted together to make a net-like cloth. There are many examples from Viking and Coptic sources. In this class, students will learn how to construct an easy sprang frame, warp it, and learn the basic sprang warp-twisting technique. All materials included in the class fee to make both a frame and a pouch to take with you.
fee_itemization:
sprang frame - $2
weaving thread - $2
needle and sticks - $1

name: Introduction to Spinning Poi
description_book: In this one-hour workshop you will learn some of the basic poi movements and terminology necessary to get you started.
description_web: In this one-hour workshop you will learn some of the basic poi movements and terminology necessary to get you started. Poi spinning is a great low-impact workout that will help you to improve your coordination and give your fitness routine some "flare"! After paying for their first class, students are welcome to return to subsequent classes free of charge!
fee_itemization: $20.00 Material Fee covers handout, poi, and refreshments

name: Making Pierogi Only a *Babci* Wouldn't Like
description_book: A lab/practicum in the art of making Polish pierogi. Come prepared to knead, roll, pinch, boil, and be covered in flour.
description_web: A lab/practicum in the art of making Polish pierogi (skills transferable to other filled pasta dishes). Come prepared to knead, roll, pinch, boil and be covered in flour. No fee to participate, modest fee to take pierogi home. Limit 24 people.
fee_itemization: $3 a dozen to take home pierogi.

name: The Two-Beam Vertical Loom: Part 2
description_book: Warping and weaving on a two-beam vertical loom. This is part 2 of a two-part, hands-on class. We will be weaving.

name: Bread Baking In A Period Fire Pit
description_book: Class will include fire pit construction, period breads, preparing, baking and eating the breads made during the class.

name: *Tafl* Games
description_book: The *Tafl* family of games were played through the Norse lands. The rules are simple and easy to learn, and the game play can be quick or complex.
description_web: The *Tafl* family of games were played through the Norse lands. The rules are simple and easy to learn, and the game play can be quick or complex.

name: 16th-Century Limp Binding (Long-Stitch)
description_book: An all-day class making a limp vellum binding with long-stitched exposed spine. No prior experience needed.
description_web: An all-day class where students will learn to make a 16th-century limp vellum-covered book with decorative long-stitched exposed spine. Students may bring 2 matching beads if they like (must be no more than 10mm in diameter). No prior knowledge of bookbinding required, but it won't hinder.
fee_itemization: Fee includes a 5-page handout, vellum, leather for spine, paper for blank book, beads for the ties, and linen thread.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching.
description_web: During this ten-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and mundanely. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. No fee. String provided.

name: Known World Choir Rehearsal
description_book: Join the oldest Pennsic Choir as we rehearse in preparation for a concert Aug 1. We will perform some music in tribute to Owain Phyfe.
description_web: The Known World Choir, along with the Children's and Youth Choirs, the Debatable Choir, Chorulus Pennsicus, and other guests will present a concert of medieval and Renaissance choral literature. As part of their repertoire, the Known World Choir will perform some songs in tribute to Owain Phyfe.

name: Backstage at the Globe
description_book: Explore England’s most famous theater from a back stage perspective.  How were shows produced, and just where do we get the meaning of box office?
description_web: Join Master Lorcan Dracontius, Managing Housekeeper for KWP, as he dons the guise of an every day apprentice from Cheapside, stepping back in time, to enjoy an afternoon’s entertainment at the theater across the Thames. Once there, explore England’s most famous theater from a back stage perspective.  Yes, we’ll cover what happens on stage, but we’ll also go behind the scenes to discover how they really got those shows up and running.

name: Writing Between the Lines: Ames Lettering Guide
description_book: Hands-on class for beginning and intermediate calligraphers on using the Ames Lettering Guide to improve your scribal technique and scroll layout.
description_web: Are your miniscules misconstrued? Do your descenders dangle? Do you struggle with getting the words to line up straight across the paper? Are you ready to go beyond light table calligraphy? This is a hands-on class for beginning and intermediate calligraphers on using the Ames Lettering Guide to improve your scribal technique and scroll layout.
fee_itemization: Ames Lettering Guide, hard lead pencil, practice paper

name: Bellydance for Wee Ones
description_book: For the tiniest bellydancer in your life, ages 4-10. No experience necessary. One adult chaperone must remain for duration of class. Bring water.
description_web: Basic bellydance moves for those itty bitty wee ones that try to copy what their moms and other dancers do. Geared for ages 4-10, but slightly older students welcome. Shaheen will take them, patiently and with humor, through basics; older students and those with excellent attention spans will be offered additional info. No experience necessary. One adult chaperone (per child!) must remain for duration of class. Please bring water and maybe snacks. Visit www.ShaheenAlikhanBellydance.com or find her on Facebook to keep in touch.

name: The Voice of the Crown: Court Heraldry
description_book: Will cover court heralds' responsibilities from scroll wrangling to chair placement to voice projection to handling gaffs and awkward moments.
description_web: Standing behind the throne one gets a great view of court and is privy to inside jokes and humorous asides of the Crowns and Coronets we serve. This makes being a Court Herald a lot of fun, a pretty cool position to have. It also carries a level of responsibility. In this class we will discuss the basics of conducting a court, what not to do and what is absolutely expected of us. This class can be occasionally loud.

name: Late Period Cross Sititch and Variations
description_book: Examines how cross stitch was used, alone and with other stitches, plus a brief look at long-armed cross and reversible cross stitch.
description_web: Examines examples of extant pieces and images, as well as how cross stitch was used, alone and with other stitches, plus a brief look at long-armed cross and reversible cross stitch.

name: Deconstruction of Period Glass Beads
description_book: Hands-on class designed to show construction techniques of period glass beads using clay instead of glass.
description_web: Hands-on course using clay/playdough to demonstrate complex techniques that are sometimes difficult for a beginning glassworker to understand. Twisted and complex mosaic cane discussion and discussion of complex period beads.

name: Bread, Milk, Eggs: A Period Perspective
description_book: "The Essentials", viewed from medieval dietary perspective; how staples were acquired in various times and places.

name: What's in Your Leather Tool Box?
description_book: How to use leather tools that you might not know what they are for. Small "veg tan" leather handouts.

name: Folk Tunes of the Elizabethan Era
description_book: Learn to sing a few songs and rounds from the Elizabethan era, some broadside ballads and some tunes collected by Thomas Ravenscroft.

name: Henna Body Art for Beginners
description_book: A historical look at henna including regional patterns, then practical instruction, before students create their own natural henna body art.
fee_itemization: $5 per henna cone provided to students. I sell mundanely at this rate.

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Performing Arts Pavilion on Thursday afternoon of War Week. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.”

name: Dancing for Children: Emundr's Favourites
description_book: It's never too early to learn to dance! Come learn dances fun for all. All youth in attendance require a responsible adult to be present. Ages 3 & up.
description_web: It's never too early to learn to dance! Selected by a five-year-old, the class will be geared towards fun and frolicking rather than perfecting steps, and is suitable for ages 3 and up. All youth in attendance require a responsible adult to be present. Dances will include *Sellenger's Round, Petit Vriens, Rose Bransle, galliards* and more.

name: Vocal Techniques for Singers, Bards & Storytellers
description_book: Learn proper breathing, vocal exercises, projection techniques, and how to care for your voice.
description_web: Learn proper breathing, vocal exercises, projection techniques, and how to care for your voice. Singing and public speaking involve your whole body - learn to do it the right way so you can do it for a lifetime!

name: The Compleat Cook - and Other Pet Peeves
description_book: A participatory discussion about feasts and food with possible rants about things that go wrong, hosted by an opinionated Laurel.

name: Court for Nobles and Their Heralds
description_book: A discussion about how to put together Court when the nobles, herald, or both are new to it. Nobles are encouraged to bring their herald with them.
description_web: A discussion about how to put together Court when the nobles, the herald, or both are new to it. We'll talk about how to create smooth flow and good theatre for the people watching in the audience and discuss options for the tone of Court, preparing the docket with your herald beforehand, and adjusting to the inevitable changes and surprises that happen in the middle. Nobles are encouraged to bring their herald with them, if possible.

name: What Not to Wear: 14th-Century Sumptuary Laws
description_book: Overview of 14th-century English sumptuary laws; how they can apply to an SCA context. Handout with transcriptions of some laws and explanations.

name: Archaeology of a Byzantine Shipwreck
description_book: A Byzantine cargo ship sank off the coast of Yassi Ada (Turkey) in circa AD 626. Excavation strategy, cargo and ship construction will be discussed.
description_web: Description and discussion of the Yassi Ada shipwreck that sank in circa AD 626 off the coast of Turkey. Cargo & ship construction will be discussed. Cargo included a large number of storage jars, kitchen cook pots, coins, iron tools, etc.
fee_itemization: Photocopies of the diagnostic artifacts discussed in class.

name: Creating Period-Correct Clothing on a Budget
description_book: Using modern techniques, you can create late-period clothing without breaking the bank.
description_web: Using modern techniques, you can create late-period clothing without breaking the bank. We will discuss ways you can create a middle class kit.

name: Edge Your Veil
description_book: Veil edges from the simple rolled edge to ruffles and beads. Learn some "how-tos". Practice rolled edges on a cup cover.
description_web: Veils were on almost every woman's head in period and they had a variety of different edges. From a simple rolled edge, we will do the "perfect rolled hem" and explore a variety of other, more complicated edges. Practice rolled edges on a cup cover.
fee_itemization: Kit to include silk or linen, needle,  thread and beads

name: Coronation Ceremonies from Period Sources
description_book: Methods for creating more authentically-based coronation ceremonies using period sources.
description_web: Methods for creating more authentically-based coronation ceremonies using period sources, illustrated by several examples that the instructor has recently produced in the East and AEthelmearc with great success. Will cover secularization, music, ritual objects, geographical and temporal differences.

name: Telling Stories as Your Persona
description_book: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.
description_web: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.

name: Top It Off: A Simple Coif
description_book:
In this hands-on class you will construct a simple coif for men or women. 
Hand-sewing ability helpful.
description_web: Hats finish the outfit, so "top it off". This hands-on class will teach you how to construct a simple coif for men or women. Hand-sewing ability helpful. Bring scissors. Additional participants may bring their own fabric (linen suggested - 1/2 yard), needle and thread.

name: Later Medieval English Feasts
description_book: Not a service-oriented how-to, this class is about how feasts were structured and sequenced from the time of Richard II through Richard III.
description_web: Not a service-oriented how-to, this class is about how feasts were structured and sequenced from the time of Richard II through Richard III.

name: Iron Commedia: Creating a New 16th-Century Play
description_book: Join actors from your favorite improvisational *Commedia dell'Arte* troupes to craft, cast, perform, & premier a brand-new play in just one afternoon!
description_web: If you've ever laughed at the zany antics of improvisational *Commedia dell'Arte*, join members from your favorite troupes to craft, cast, and perform a brand new *commedia* play in just one afternoon with its world premier at at Pennsic! Peace Week's Iron *Commedia* will premier during the *Commedia* Experience Expo on the Middle Friday, and War Week's Iron *Commedia* will premier 5:00 pm on the same day at the PAP! Put a mask on; see what happens!

name: FAP: Fundamental Body Structure in *Armizare*
description_book: Freelance Academy Press presents fundamental body structure & movement in *Armizare* (the Italian Art of Arms). Pre-reqs: Introduction to *Armizare*.
