description_web: Freelance Academy Press presents fundamental body structure and movement in *Armizare* (the Italian Art of Arms). Pre-reqs: Introduction to *Armizare*, or familiarity with the terms of *Armizare* is recommended.

name: *Gracca Amorosa* for Beginners
description_book: Come learn *Gracca Amorosa*, one of the most popular 16th-C. *cascarde*! Dancers of all ages welcome. Prior dance experience helpful but not required.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* & Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Advanced Bellydance Layers, Combos, and MORE
description_book: Experience strongly recommended. Learn crisp combos and layers, transitions & more. Learn to make your own. Prepare to think & sweat.
description_web: This class is geared for those with at least 3 years' solid bellydance experience. All (ages 14 and up) are welcome, but it will be complicated and fast-paced. Shaheen of Fata Morgana Bellydance takes you through her unique folkloric tribal fusion drills for isolation, sharp combos, clear layers, smooth transitions and awesome traveling steps. Learn some of her favorite combos and, even better, learn how to create your own. The second class will briefly go over what was learned in the first and add new material. Bring water, hip scarf, and notebook; prepare to think and sweat. Visit www.ShaheenAlikhanBellydance.com or find her on Facebook to keep in touch.

name: Changing Fingering and Changing Clefs
description_book: We'll discuss how to go from a C recorder to an F recorder, and then practice doing it. Editions in C clefs and facsimile also will be available.
description_web: In this class we'll discuss how to go from a C recorder to an F recorder, and then spend most of our time practicing doing just that. Some fairly straight-forward music will be handed out that's suitable to different sizes of recorder. For more advanced players we'll have some editions of the music in various C clefs, Baritone Clef, French Violin Clef, and facsimile. The music will be pretty simple, so even musicians who aren't totally secure on their instrument of choice should be successful in this class.

name: Performance Techniques Class
description_book: Intro to performance techniques. Please bring 2-3 min. of prepared material; we will work together to apply techniques from class to performance.
description_web:
Introduction and practical class of performance techniques for SCA performers and venues for new and experienced performers. Performing class limit around 15 people. Non-performing: As many can watch and take notes as want. For those performing: Please bring 2-3 minutes of prepared material, your own or someone else's (not necessarily memorized, just ready to go). Topics to be discussed:
- Fitting the performance to the venue space
- Physical techniques while performing (such as movement, standing, sitting, using a book or props...) 
- Vocal techniques (tone, inflections, cadence...) 
- Projection techniques for various spaces
- Engaging the audience
- Choosing material for a performance
- Changing material at need for an audience or space
- Introductions of yourself or others
- Timing your performance
- ...and more!
Applying what we discuss to a performance. Each person performing will have 2-3 minutes to perform something (depending on number of people signed up to perform). We will work together to apply techniques from class to the performance.

name: Help Me, Tempus, You’re My Only Hope!
description_book: 2 hours with Tempus, anything sewing. Trouble-shooting, problem-solving, garb problems diagnosed and solutions proffered. Maybe learn to sew...
description_web:
(Garb Troubleshooting/Q&A Workshop)
This is a trouble-shooting and problem-solving class - garb problems diagnosed and solutions proffered. Bring to the class garb that went “wrong” or garb that didn’t “work” for you. We'll talk; it can be fixed. If you don’t have the garb here, bring your questions; we’ll do our best to solve your garb troubles. We’ll talk about gussets and how to use your seam ripper, too. This class can go on longer if needed. Also, this class will be offered next year.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Traditional Norse Medical Herbalism
description_book: Collecting, storing, and techniques of herbal preparations, some dating back to saga times.
description_web: Medicine in Norway was surprisingly sophisticated back into saga times, compared with the Continent. We will look at the herbs/roots/barks/berries/fungi, etc., used in traditional healing, including preparation and administration of salves, syrups, teas & washes, poultices, and lots more.

name: Mythbusting Period Piracy
description_book: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined.
description_web: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined. Common myths and mistakes about piracy in the SCA period will be highlighted.

name: Your Persona in an Hour
description_book: What should you ask to create and develop your persona? Where can you find the answers? Come and find out! For research newbies and library vets.
description_web: What questions should you ask to create and develop your persona? Where can you find the answers? Come and find out! Research newbies and library veterans are both welcome!

name: Beginning Bead Weaving on a Rigid Heddle Loom
description_book: Warping of the bead weaving loom, technique of weaving beads, creating a pattern and adapting pre-printed patterns for bead weaving.
description_web: We will discuss the warping of the bead weaving loom, technique of weaving beads, creating a pattern and adapting pre-printed patterns for bead weaving. Come share your projects, ideas & questions.

name: Tablet Weaving Letters
description_book: Demonstration of how to tablet weave letters onto a band. Each student is encouraged to try their hand at it on my loom.
description_web: Demonstration of how to tablet weave letters onto a band. Each student is encouraged to try their hand at it on my loom.

name: English Country Dance for Four Couples
description_book: We will cover *Goddesses, Hyde Park, If All the World Were Paper, Fine Companion,* and possibly other dances that need at least 8 dancers (4 couples).

name: Happy Japanese Games
description_book: Three leisure games of Japan will be discussed. Reproductions of each game will be available to play for the duration of class.
description_web: Three leisure games of Japan will be discussed. Reproductions of each game will be available to play for duration of class. May not be appropriate for small children; some game pieces can be a choking hazard.

name: The Physics of Musical Instruments
description_book: Covers the basics of how sound is produced in various types of period instruments, and how different frequencies are achieved.

name: Adv. Calligraphy: *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*
description_book: Learn 3 scripts: Lombardic caps, blackletter, & italic, and tips to take calligraphy to the next level. Three two-hour sessions. Not for beginners.
description_web: The *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta* is a late-period Renaissance master’s showcase. In this 3-day, in-depth study, students will learn scripts used in this manuscript: Lombardic capitals, blackletter, and italic. Take your calligraphy to the next level with our tips on using a quill, using an Ames lettering guide, and creating non-standard layouts. Plan to attend all 3 two-hour sessions. Not suitable for beginners.
fee_itemization: calligraphy marker, watercolor paper, binder, supplies, color handouts

name: GKS 1005: The *Flateyjarbók*
description_book: An overview and introduction to manuscript # GKS 1005 - The *Flateyjarbók* - one of the most exquisite of the Icelandic manuscripts.
description_web: An overview and introduction to manuscript # GKS 1005 - The *Flateyjarbók* - one of the most exquisite of the Icelandic manuscripts. We will look at the book, its contents, and its illustrations. This class is a precursor to a more detailed class which will be offered next year.

name: Documenting Names & Armory Submissions
description_book: How to build good documentation for names and armory in SCA heraldic registration.
description_web: It is important to clearly document all elements of any name submitted in the SCA. It is equally important to show supporting documentation for first-time registrations of charges, designs that follow culturally specific patterns, use of restricted charges or proof of previously forbidden charges. We'll talk about what the Colleges look for, what sources are best and which to avoid, how to handle submission forms to your best advantage and how to build a (hopefully) convincing argument for your or your client's desired name or armory.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Ninja: Truth from Shadows
description_book: Dare you look into the shadows of history to find the truth? Come to discover both the legends and real history of Japan's famed assassins.
description_web: Dare you look into the shadows of history to find the truth? Come to discuss and discover the legends and real history of Japan's famed spies and assassins. This class will deconstruct the romanticized image of the Ninja and discuss the actual history of the world's most famous spies.

name: Storytelling in the SCA
description_book: A how-to class on telling stories. Covers getting tellable tales from books, rehearsing, telling, getting feedback, and dealing with stage fright.
fee_itemization: Class handout, Stories for Beginners handout, Stories for Beginners CD.

name: Latin Smack Talk
description_book: Learn how to insult friends and foes in Latin! Good fun on and off the field! We shall be rowdy!
description_web: Learn how to insult friends and foes in Latin! Good fun on and off the field! We shall be rowdy!

name: The Effect of Whorl Design on Thread Production
description_book: A presentation and discussion about spinning wool with period spindles, followed by a chance to try out the spindles yourself.
description_web: Class will begin with a presentation on the design of 8th-century whorls and the thread they can spin. Then there will be time to test out Bronze Age, Neolithic and 8th-century whorl types to see for yourself how they compare to modern drop spindles.

name: Beginner Dance: Bransles
description_book: Bransles are fun and easy dances that can be done by large groups, all dancing together. Come and learn all about them.

name: Needle-Woven Pouch
description_book: A simple needle-weaving method and loom for creating a woven pouch or bag.
description_web: A simple needle-weaving method and loom for creating a woven pouch or bag. Loom & string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Drumming for European Dance
description_book: Learn the basics every drummer should know about basic European rhythms and tempos, and communicating with musicians and dancers.
description_web: Whether you're a new drummer, an experienced musician new to drumming, or an experienced drummer new to Renaissance dance music, this class has something for you. We'll cover the basics of communicating with musicians and dancers, basic rhythms and appropriate tempos for Renaissance dance music, how to prevent things from going wrong, and how to handle it when things go wrong anyway. No drum or experience is necessary.

name: Sing We And Chant It - Madrigal and A Capella Jam
description_book: Optional jam & practice session for audience participation, "Sing We and Chant It" Madrigal and A Capella Jam, on the 28th.
description_web: Optional jam & practice session for the audience participation "Sing We and Chant It" Madrigal and A Capella Jam, Sunday 28, at 5 pm in the Performing Arts Tent. All are welcome! Music will be available to share, or bring your own! (Material fee optional for a folder of this year's jam music)
fee_itemization: Optional $5 Fee.  Music packet of around 25 choral public domain songs, sheet music to keep.

name: I Just Want to Bellydance
description_book: Want to dance at the numerous drum circles at Pennsic? Learn to listen to the music and practice some traditional movements. Fun is emphasized.
description_web: Want to dance at the numerous drum circles at Pennsic? This class introduces you to basic movements & listening to the music to find your personal style. Posture, attitude, stretching & fun are emphasized. Learn how to use mental cues and "pods" of movement to extend your dancing time.

name: Chirurgeon Orientation
description_book: Orientation for those wishing to volunteer at First Aid Point at Pennsic.

name: Heraldic Flag Design
description_book: Learn about the various types of heraldic flags that existed in period, their design and application. Then design your own!
description_web: What does one do with those fantastic animals, interesting designs and brilliant colors needed for a good heraldic design? And where does one apply said design? Before heraldry ever appeared on shield and surcoat, those heraldic designs fluttered over the heads of kings and peasants, like majestic birds, in the form of banners, pennons, standards and gonfalons. Learn about the various types of heraldic flags that existed in period, their design and application. Then design your own!

name: Algebra as Geometry
description_book: Learn how to do algebra the period way - by treating it as geometry!
description_web: From the time of Euclid into nearly the 17th century - almost 2000 years - all mathematics was geometry. In this class, we will use the solution of the quadratic equation, or equations, to explore the ramifications of this difference from modern algebra. There is nothing in here that should be unfamiliar to anyone who has taken high-school algebra. The math behind this is not difficult, it is the Renaissance perspective that makes it challenging (and interesting!)

name: Brewing and Experimental Archaeology
description_book: Lessons learned from experimental archaeology with wine and beer will be discussed and tasted. Brave adults (over 21) only.
description_web: Lessons learned from experimental archaeology with wine and beer will be discussed and tasted. The discovery and excavation of a monastic winery at the archaeological site of Tell Tuneinir will be discussed including artifacts and inscriptions. Brewing examples with include a variety of herbed beers as well as wines (quince, herbed red wine, and poignant mead). Brave adults (over 21) only.

name: With These Knots I Bind My Camp
description_book: You will learn to master a very few knots that will meet almost every need you may have in camp - or double your money back!
description_web: Before cordless drills and screws, before plentiful cheap nails, even before glue - there was knotted cord holding our lives together. Sadly, most of us barely know how to tie even two or three knots. My guarantee: you will learn to master a small handful of knots that will meet almost every need you may have in camp - or double your money back!

name: Modern Application of Old-Time Herbal Medicine
description_book: Come on a global exploration of herbal medicine and folk remedies throughout time. There will be recipes and an old-time remedy for you to take home.
description_web: Come on a global exploration of herbal medicine and folk remedies throughout time. We will discuss some of the first remedies ever recorded. There will be recipe handouts and an old-time remedy for you to create and take with you.

name: Medieval Apothecary
description_book: Overview of an apothecary's profession. Includes supplies, techniques, materials and plants used in the trade.
description_web: A brief overview of what an apothecary is and is not: what they would know and use in the course of plying their trade. The differences between an apothecary and a physician/surgeon. What plants would be found in an apothecary's garden; how to make your own apothecary supplies, as well as other tidbits of garden and herbal information.

name: Period Bead-Making and Furnace Construction
description_book: Experimental archeology in using wood fire-fueled furnaces to create period glass beads. Come and go.
description_web: Discussion of different types of bead furnaces, fuels, bellows, glass used, and construction techniques. Glass bead-making methods using period furnaces will be discussed and demonstrated. Students may come and go at will. Will have all-day demonstration. Experienced glass workers who wish to try period bead-making are encouraged to wear all natural fiber clothing and bring safety goggles and aprons if they have them.

name: Beginner Dance: 15th-Century Italian *Bassadanza*
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class will teach the basic steps and patterns necessary for this graceful style of dance.

name: Morris Games
description_book: We will teach Nine Man's Morris and other games of that family (which include the modern tic tac toe).
description_web: We will teach Nine Man's Morris and other games of that family (which include the modern tic tac toe).

name: Advanced *Repoussé* & Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block working, forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block working, forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.

name: Intro to Harmony and Ear Training for Bardic Arts
description_book: Intro practical class: hearing & singing harmony, melody balance, different types of written & impromptu harmony found in bardic events and the SCA.
description_web: Ever been to a bardic event and wanted to join in the harmony being sung?  This class is an introductory and practical class on how to start hearing and singing the harmony found in song, the importance of melody balance, and includes a brief discussion of different types of written and impromptu harmony found in bardic events and the SCA. Some musical and/or bardic circle experience useful, but not required.

name: Pilgrim's Bags
description_book: History on pilgrim's bags and info on how to make a cloth or leather bag. Free up your hands by wearing a pilgrim's bag instead carrying a basket.
description_web: Ever thought about wearing a pilgrim's bag instead of carrying a bulky basket?  Free up your hands and keep your modern items out of sight. Learn about the history of pilgrim's bags; get instructions on how to make a cloth or leather bag. If you made one last year, bring it for a show-and-tell.

name: Introduction to Beginning Period Cookery
description_book: Want to cook in period but don’t know where to start? No problem! For beginners who want a quick intro to some basics of modern period cookery.
description_web: Want to cook in period, but don’t know where to start? Your apartment doesn't have a handy open fireplace? No idea what an “eyroun” is or where to buy one?  No problem! This class is designed for those beginners who have never cooked a period recipe before but want a quick introduction into some of the basics of modern period cookery.

name: Analysis of 15th-Century Polyphony
description_book: In this class we'll look at a piece of 15th-C. polyphonic music, discuss the features of the music and how to perform it thoughtfully.

name: The Polearm Techniques of Paulus Hector Mair
description_book: A look at several techniques from the 16th-C manual of arms of Paulus Hector Mair.

name: Middle Eastern Music and Dance
description_book: A time for people of all skill levels to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. All instruments are welcome, and loaner drums are available!
description_web: A time for people interested in Middle Eastern music and dance to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. We will be providing instruction appropriate to the interest of the attendees, from beginning Middle Eastern drum and belly dance to teaching songs in which everyone can participate. All skill levels and instruments are welcome, and drums are available for borrowing!

name: Cascarde *Chiara Stella*
description_book: *Chiara Stella* is a fun and lively dance from Fabritio Caroso. Students should be familiar with 16th-C Italian dance steps.

name: County Criminal Indictment in 13th-C England
description_book: 13th Century Indictment brought before the law. Be part of the process in the jury. Cases are actual county roles and crimes.
description_web: Come to a 13th Century Indictment of several suspects brought before the law. See the procedure and be part of the process in the jury. The accused come from actual county roles and actual crimes.

name: Survey of Bagpipes in the Middle Ages
description_book: A survey of bagpipes in Europe during the 13th, 14th, and 15th C. Includes a pictorial display of the bagpipes & examples of period-style bagpipes.
description_web: This class is a survey of bagpipes in England and Europe during the 13th, 14th, and 15th centuries. There will be a pictorial display of the bagpipes and examples of bagpipes that have been made in period styles. The bagpipes will not be played during class but students may visit my camp after the class to hear them.

name: Arbeau's Branles
description_book: These branles are often taught to beginners, but how well do we really know them? Let’s have another look at them, as reconstructed by the teacher.
description_web: These branles are often taught to beginners, but how well do we really know them? Let’s have another look at them, as reconstructed by the teacher.

name: Pennsic Homes
description_book: This is a slideshow/discussion class on what should be considered to plan out a Pennsic wagon. Part 2 of tour on Tuesday.
description_web: This is a slideshow/discussion class on what should be considered to plan out a Pennsic wagon. There are many different uses, from kitchens or showers to sleeping to 'gracious living'. Also, various building materials that work or don't work, etc.

name: Medieval Oil Lamps
description_book: Oils were used to light lamps by all cultures throughout the Middle Ages. Learn how easy, inexpensive, and best of all, *safe* oil lamps are!
description_web: Oils were used to light lamps by all cultures throughout the Middle Ages. Learn how easy, inexpensive, compact and, best of all, *safe* oil lamps still are! Learn how to camp with just one bottle of cooking oil. New this year, a brief mention of 'fat' lamps will be included.
fee_itemization: copying cost for handout and wick kit materials.

name: Open Dancing
description_book: Join us all evening for dancing by request.

name: Street Smarts
description_book: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography. How the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.
description_web: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography. How the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.

name: Embroidery of the 14th Century
description_book: Embroidery techniques of the 14th century with an emphasis on *opus anglicanum* and pouches. Other class by instructor will cover pouch construction.
description_web: Class will cover embroidery techniques of the 14th century with an emphasis on *opus anglicanum* and pouches. Basic stitches will not be covered in class, but will be included in handout. Goldwork will be covered. Other class by instructor will cover pouch construction.

name: Dots, Dots, Dots....Decoration and More!
description_book: Dots make really fun decorations on beads. They can also be used to do so much more: more complex designs, plus bead construction!
description_web: Dots make really fun decorations on beads. But combined with other dots, lines, or even just using them to construct the bead, dots can be more useful than you realize!

name: Sexy, Silly, Scheming Saints
description_book: Think saints' lives are boring? Think again! We'll explore saint stories from *The Golden Legend* that would fit right in on prime time TV.
description_web: Slept through Sunday school? Think saints' lives are boring? Think again! In this class, we'll explore saint stories from the medieval bestseller, *The Golden Legend*, that would fit right in on prime time TV. (Some themes not appropriate for children.)

name: History of Hand Knitting
description_book: Hand knitting is period! Come see what you can make beyond the Tudor flat cap!
fee_itemization: I have a handout with color illustrations & extensive bibliography.

name: The Medieval Discovery of Music
description_book: When medieval Europeans first asked themselves, "What is this stuff?", what were their answers, and where did they go for answers?
description_web: When medieval Europeans first asked themselves, "What is this stuff?", what were their answers, and where did they go for answers?

name: Fingerloop Braiding for Beginners
description_book: A hands-on class learning a 5-loop braiding technique. Useful as decoration or cording. With slight variation it can be made into lanyard for tokens.

name: Thorsberg Trousers: Pants That Last!
description_book: Tired of repairing pants that rip in unmentionable places? Then you’ll love these pants based on trousers from an Iron Age burial!
description_web: Tired of repairing pants that rip in unmentionable places? Then you’ll love these pants based on trousers from an Iron Age burial! Learn what you’ll need to make them yourself: fabrics, seams, pattern, and construction.

name: Sharpening and Using Woodworking Tools
description_book: Have you had terrible luck with planes and chisels? This class will help you learn to sharpen, tune and use these tools.

name: Bling on a Budget
description_book: How to use glass jewels, beads, and metal to add dignity and ostentation to garb without going broke.
description_web: How to use glass jewels, beads, and metal to add dignity and ostentation to garb without going broke. From minor flourishes to full-bore excess, planning and execution covered by instructor with 25+ years experience working with these forms of embellishment. Supplies available for purchase; prices vary depending on patterns chosen. No purchase necessary.
fee_itemization: Fee depends on choices made. No purchase necessary.

name: Heraldry for Scribes
description_book: Beginning course for scribes who want to understand herald-speak.
description_web: What do heralds mean when they describe someone's device? Where can I find illustrations to their particular way of talking? Who can explain heraldese to me? This and many other questions that scribes have can be answered with this class. Class includes handouts and a brief slide show.
fee_itemization: Fee is for color handouts or students may request copies sent through the e-mail.

name: Embroidery: A Beginning
description_book: Learn a few simple stitches to start a project with. Create a sampler to take home.
fee_itemization: Hand out, sampler materials - linen, needle, thread, hoop.

name: Beginning Knitting
description_book: This is a beginning class.  Learn how to cast on, knit, purl, and cast off.  You may bring your own materials.
description_web: This is a beginning class.  Learn how to cast on, knit, purl, and cast off.  You may bring your own materials.

name: Making Your Own Glass Molds
description_book: Learn how to make and use your own glass bead molds.
description_web: In period, people could not order cool glass bead molds from the local Internet website. Instead, they made their own. Come and learn how to make and use your own glass bead molds!

name: Beaded Kumihimo
description_book: Part 4: Students will learn how to make modern jewelry from an ancient technique. Students will make a beaded bracelet to take home.
description_web: Part 4: Students will learn how to make modern jewelry from an ancient technique. Students will make a beaded bracelet to take home. It is recommended to bring your own magnification for work if needed. Teacher will have limited number of magnifiers for use.

name: Game of the Goose
description_book: Period game in the style of Chutes and Ladders. We will review the rules and then play through a game, dice willing.
description_web: Period game in the style of Chutes and Ladders. The game is purely deterministic dice-based so it is suitable for children but will require gambling or drinking for adult reply value. We will review the rules and then play through a game, dice willing.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching.
description_web: During this ten-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and mundanely. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: From the Ground Up: Basics for SCA Belly Dance
description_book: Basic movement vocabulary + improv skills with cultural information, dance etiquette + discussion of dance in the SCA. Class is for all levels!
description_web: This class will cover basic movement vocabulary and improvisational skills while touching on both cultural information and musicality. Also presented will be dance etiquette and discussion of different ways you will see (or do!) dance within the scope of the SCA. For both the newer dancer and those with prior experience, the class is designed to get you up and moving at events!

name: Known World Choir Rehearsal
description_book: Join the oldest Pennsic Choir as we rehearse in preparation for a concert Aug 1. We will perform some music in tribute to Owain Phyfe.
description_web: The Known World Choir, along with the Children's and Youth Choirs, the Debatable Choir, Chorulus Pennsicus, and other guests will present a concert of medieval and Renaissance choral literature. As part of their repertoire, the Known World Choir will perform some songs in tribute to Owain Phyfe.

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Warp a loom, weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes & hat; leave from Univ. Point. **We are seeking teachers to help us continue this Pennsic tradition!**
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. **We are seeking teachers to help us continue this tradition, one of Pennsic's two longest-running classes!**

name: Learn Illumination Skills from a Period Master
description_book: Beginning scribes will learn illuminations skills via instructions and hands-on practice based on the the "Göttengen Model Book".
description_web: Beginning scribes: Come and learn illumination skills based on a 15th-century Model Book.  Hands-on practice using step-by-step instructions from the "Göttengen Model Book". Class will also cover ways that scribes can gain knowledge and experience to continually improve their work. Please bring your scribal kit.

name: The Voice of the Crown: Court Heraldry
description_book: Will cover court heralds' responsibilities from scroll wrangling to chair placement to voice projection to handling gaffs and awkward moments.
description_web: Standing behind the throne one gets a great view of court and is privy to inside jokes and humorous asides of the Crowns and Coronets we serve. This makes being a Court Herald a lot of fun, a pretty cool position to have. It also carries a level of responsibility. In this class we will discuss the basics of conducting a court, what not to do and what is absolutely expected of us. This class can be occasionally loud.

name: 14th-Century Pouch Construction
description_book: Make a 14th-C pouch. Rectangular pouches will be the focus, but other shapes will be discussed. Kit will be available to make your own.
description_web: Make a 14th-C pouch. Rectangular pouches will be the focus, but other shapes will be discussed. Kit will be available to make your own. Class will build on "Embroidery of the 14th Century" class, but attendance at the other class is not necessary.

name: Glass and Metal Link Chain
description_book: Learn to make glass and metal chain links and join them. This is an intermediate class; prior glass experience required
description_web: Learn to make glass links using a torch, and metal links with tools. This is a theory, then practice, class.

name: 13th-15th-C Women's Veils and Other Head Coverings
description_book: An overview of different veils and head coverings worn in the later Middle Ages by women of all classes.
description_web: An overview of different veils and head coverings worn in the later Middle Ages by women of all classes. Handout includes a pattern for a women's coif and instructions on how to wear a veil without the aid of a circlet no matter the length of your hair.

name: Documenting Your Potable
description_book: Learn basic components of effective potable documentation. Geared toward brewers who need to strengthen the documentation piece of their entry.
description_web: Learn the basic components of effective documentation for potables. See an example of effective documentation. This class should help you prepare for most competitions and panels. Some period resources will be shared. Geared toward brewers who have started brewing, who need additional support on strengthening the documentation piece.

name: Anglo-Saxon Coinage
description_book: What coins were used in Anglo-Saxon England from 600-1066?
description_web: What's in your pouch? What coins were used in Anglo-Saxon England and areas with which they traded? We'll cover from the Migration period to the Norman Conquest. We'll also talk about moniers.

name: Running or Winning Siege Cooking Contests
description_book: How to run, enter and win "siege cooking" contests, from picking the foods to handout to adding theater to your entry. In-persona class.
description_web: "Siege cooking" contests pit contestants, provided with identical raw ingredients, against each other or a pre-announced standard. A popular feature of weekend events, such contests can spice up a household dinner or provide the entire feast. The instructor has run the Maison Rive siege cooking contest at Pennsic for more than ten years now; learn what worked and what didn't from both sides of the judging table.

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Performing Arts Pavilion on Thursday afternoon of War Week. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.”

name: Dancing for Children: Stories and Improvising
description_book: It's never too early to learn to dance! Come learn dances fun for all. All youth in attendance require a responsible adult to be present. Ages 4 & up.
description_web: While open to all ages, the class will be geared towards fun and frolicking rather than perfecting steps, and is suitable for ages 4 and up. All youth in attendance require a responsible adult to be present. After learning some basic steps, the class will cover a variety of dances that tell stories as well as more free-form dances.

name: Modern Music for the Medievally Minded
description_book: Do you play music by ear or jam with others but wish you had a grasp on reading modern notation? Come learn basics or review music theory.
description_web: Do you play music by ear or jam with others but wish you had a grasp on reading modern notation? Come learn basics or review music theory. Will touch on scales, circle of 5ths, modes, how to find improvisational tonal points, clefs and other basic fundamentals of music and how they relate to what YOU do medievally in music.

name: Muscle Memory for Middle Eastern Dancing
description_book: Build muscle memory for belly dance by drilling layers of isolations & fluidity in movement. These tools will help your dance become second nature.
description_web: Being able to dance beautifully & effortlessly takes lots of time and practice. That's why I created this short class to help develop those muscles that are needed for belly dance/ Middle Eastern dance. It takes roughly 30,000 repetitions to achieve muscle memory for a movement. Come sweat and drill in that muscle memory so there will be less thinking & more feeling when you dance to live music around the fires! Layering, stamina, & super slow to super fast movements will be covered. All levels.

name: Being Your Persona
description_book: How to maintain the illusion, at an event, that you are a period person interacting with other period people.
description_web: How to maintain the illusion, at an event, that you are a period person interacting with other period people.

name: Gussets, Godets, Gores, Neck Holes and Shirts...
description_book: Everything about making shirts. Fit the neck perfectly, how to cut and sew gussets, godets and gores, easily. And how to make real Renaissance shirts.
description_web: This class is everything you need to know about making your shirts. Comes in three parts. First, how to cut the neck opening to fit any garment, the geometry and how to make the perfect keyhole necks which work for the T-tunic, doublet, bodice, cotehardie, houppelande and even modern shirts. Second, is how to cut and sew gussets, godets and gores, all devices to give your clothes better fit, more fullness and freedom of movement. We'll discuss how to cut and sew gussets, as found on the underarms of T-tunic, the fast and easy way. Also covering godets and gores, the difference and how easy they are to sew. Lastly, we'll look at how to make shirts in the Renaissance style; how it was originally done as well as a few minor changes to make it easier, faster and fit you better. Renaissance shirts for men women and children, with a minimum of fuss and waste.

name: Beginning Blackwork: Thread a Needle and...
description_book: Blackwork: examples, uses, and how-to. Covers basic stitches and breaking down geometric patterns in an easy way in a hands-on class.
description_web:
Introduction to counted blackwork patterns. Learn how to break down complex patterns into easy parts, with a simple trick to help prevent errors. We will look at period examples of blackwork, showing how it was used, including types beyond geometric. Then we'll get out the needles and start.

Blackwork was used on sleeves, collars and cuffs in lovely and striking patterns, as well as on household goods. There is a lot you can do with blackwork!

name: Event Decorating on a Shoestring
description_book: Learn how to cut heraldic forms for centerpieces or wall decorations out of paper to decorate feast halls or event sites. Class materials supplied.
description_web: Learn how to cut heraldic forms for centerpieces or wall decorations out of paper to decorate feast halls or event sites. Applications for metalwork, leather work, stained glass or clothing decorations. Ages 12 & up. Class materials supplied. Pattern book available for $20.

name: Top It Off: Mid-16th-Century Flat Cap
description_book: This hands-on class will teach you how to construct a mid-16th-century flat cap for men or women. Bring scissors.
description_web: Hats finish the outfit, so "top it off". This hands-on class will teach you how to construct a mid-16th-century flat cap for men or women, based on the burial hat of Don Garzia de'Medici (1562). Hand-sewing ability helpful. Bring scissors. Additional participants may bring their own fabric (1 yard), needle and thread.

name: *Le Roman de Fauvel: A Horse Is a Horse--or Is He?
description_book: Satirical poem set as 14th-C. MS with narrative text, illuminations & monophonic/polyphonic music. It tells the story of an evil horse named Fauvel.
description_web: *Le Roman de Fauvel* is a satirical poem from the early 14th century that was turned into an elaborate illuminated manuscript with narrative text, paintings and accompanying music both monophonic and polyphonic. It tells the story of an evil horse named Fauvel, his tenure over man in a reversal of man's dominion over beasts and his search for love and security. This class will explore the story and manuscript as well as listen to a selection of recorded music from *Le Roman de Fauvel*.

name: SCA and the ADA
description_book: How does the ADA (Americans with Disabilities Act) apply to the SCA?  What to do and how to do it as well as what not to do.
description_web: How does the ADA (Americans with Disabilities Act) apply to the SCA?  What to do and how to do it as well as what not to do. If you are autocrating an event, or just wondering what your options are under the ADA, you can find the answers here.

name: Beginning Viking Wire Weaving
description_book: Students will learn to make intricate chains in the manner of the Vikings and other cultures, without need for heat or complicated tools.
description_web: This class will teach beginning students to make intricate chains in the manner of the Vikings and other ancient cultures, without the need for heat or complicated tools. With the techniques presented, you will learn to create items like the ones found in Viking burials and treasure hoards across the Nordic countries dating from the 9th century to the late 12th century. Wire chains made in this fashion have also been discovered in the British Isles (875 AD) and in the Roman, Greek and Byzantine civilizations from the 4th century BC to the 1st century AD. Timeless items can be created that are still beautiful and wearable today. If you have needle-nose pliers and wire cutters, please bring them. If you need glasses for close or small work, please bring them. The fee for the class includes the materials needed to complete the leather cord necklace. To view this unique jewelry, please visit www.AncientWire.com/book.htm

name: The *Bransle de la Haye*--and a Bit More
description_book: The *Bransle de la Haye* breaks all the rules. In fact, it feels like those English dances that some people like to complain about. Hmm, I wonder…
description_web: We all know how to do a bransle, right? Well, wrong. All that double left, double right stuff is fine for 90-something percent of bransles, but there is one—ah, how have we overlooked it for so long?—that is free, fanciful, and (dare I suppose) feels a lot like some of the best parts of those English dances that some people like to complain about. Hmm, I wonder…

name: Beginning *Repoussé* & Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Cooking Over a Campfire 101
description_book: Covers the very basics of making a fire for cooking, some types of cookware, very basic sanitation principles, and a Q&A period.
description_web: Covers the very basics of making a fire for cooking, some types of cookware, as well as some foods to stay away from, and very basic sanitation principles. Two-hour time period to allow demonstrations of fire keeping and safety, and a Q&A period.

name: *Bodhran* 101
description_book: Introduction to playing the Irish frame drum. No experience necessary. Please bring your drum.

name: Documenting a French name
description_book: There are good sources available to document a French name. We'll discuss how to document a name, plausible structures of names and how to submit it.
description_web:
There are some good sources available to document a French name. We'll discuss how to document a name, plausible structures of names and how to submit it for registration. 
This class is suitable for newer heralds as well as for non-heralds.

name: Trance/Altered States in Middle Ages & Renaissance
description_book: Long before Mesmer & modern hypnosis, there were the power of suggestion, trance states, altered states and magnetism theories.
description_web: This class explores the precursors to hypnosis that are found in the Middle Ages, Renaissance and even earlier. We will explore evidence of trance, altered states of consciousness, the power of suggestion and the animal magnetism theories that later inspired Mesmer. Historical material will be put in context by comparisons with modern hypnosis information. Presenter is a certified hypnotist.

name: What Does Period Vocal Music Sound Like?
description_book: A whirlwind tour of five centuries of vocal music, with two vocalists and a harp using extant examples for illustration.
description_web: Don't know your Machaut from your Morley? Join two vocalists and a harp for a whirlwind musical tour! We will sketch a historical arc that follows the major developments of five centuries of writing for the voice, using extant examples for illustration. We'll also share some of our own favorites.

name: Secrets of the Manor Stillroom
description_book: What is the "manor stillroom"? Is it the place for the formation of all healing, scent, cosmetics, used by residents of the manor? Come find out!
description_web: What is the "manor stillroom"?  Is it the most important room in every manor? The place where all medicines were created? The room where cosmetics and perfumes were created? The room were herbal formulaes were created for the manor kitchen? Perhaps it is all of the above. Come and let's learn about this room that was so important to the residents of the manor.

name: *Memento Mori*
description_book: *Memento Mori*, the cult of a good death was intrinsic to the Spaniards. Examine its history, its effect on daily life, and Phillip II as an exemplar.
description_web: *Memento Mori*, the Spanish attitude toward death in the 16th century, focused on leading a good life and having a holy death. *Ars Moriendi* was a manual for preparing for this good, holy death. The death of Phillip II was considered an exemplar of the good death.

name: Help Advise a Dance Apprentice
description_book: Criticism is a great way to improve as a dance teacher. We'll pick experts from the attendees & critique me teaching like a novice. Will I be fired?
description_web: Giving and taking constructive criticism is a great way to improve as a dance teacher. We'll pick an expert panel from the class attendees, and critique Gregory pretending to be a novice dancemaster. Will I be fired?

name: Alquerques
description_book: Period game from the Middle East in the family of checkers-style games. We will teach the rules and the play.
description_web: Period game from the Middle East in the family of checkers-style games. We will review what is known, the rules, and the play through some games to learn the basic strategies.

name: *Minyo*: Japanese Festival Dance
description_book: A participatory introduction to Japanese dance movement and several Japanese festival dances.
description_web: A participatory introduction to Japanese dance movement and several Japanese festival dances.

name: Choral Conducting
description_book: Hands-on training in conducting patterns, cueing, finding & fixing errors, and choral leadership. You will sing & direct with teacher mentoring.
description_web: Taught by a past Pennsic Choir director and current director of the Debatable Choir, this class covers conducting patterns, cueing, finding and fixing errors, and choral leadership. Participants will sing and direct the other students in a choral piece, with assistance and advice from the instructor.

name: Adv. Calligraphy: *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*
description_book: Learn 3 scripts: Lombardic caps, blackletter, & italic, and tips to take calligraphy to the next level. Three two-hour sessions. Not for beginners.
description_web: The *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta* is a late-period Renaissance master’s showcase. In this 3-day, in-depth study, students will learn scripts used in this manuscript: Lombardic capitals, blackletter, and italic. Take your calligraphy to the next level with our tips on using a quill, using an Ames lettering guide, and creating non-standard layouts. Plan to attend all 3 two-hour sessions. Not suitable for beginners.
fee_itemization: calligraphy marker, watercolor paper, binder, supplies, color handouts

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Intermediate Heraldic Research Roundtable
description_book: Take your heraldic research to the next level. Or come to share your favorite sources and tricks. Intended for heralds of all levels.
description_web: Where do you go when the usual sources just don't have what you need? Have skills you'd like to pass on to newer heralds? Come share your favorite sources and research tips in a roundtable format. Intended for heralds of all experience levels. Handout provided.

name: Keeping Bees in the Knowne World
description_book: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.
description_web: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.

name: The Renaissance *Saccoccia* (aka Pocket)
description_book: A short workshop where we will review *saccoccia* images followed by hand-stitching your own to carry your valuables and small Pennsic purchases.
fee_itemization: Handout, pre-cut fabric, needle and thread.

name: Funny Little Cordial
description_book: The properties of humors in brewing. Covers the classification of medieval beverages & how to create a cordial based on a desired humor. Over 21 only.
description_web: A look into the properties of humors in brewing. Medieval food and drinks were chosen and arranged based on their “humors”, a classification system of hot to cold, and moist to dry that was thought to influence one's temperament and health. Class covers the classification of typical medieval beverages such as ales, beers, wines and mead as well as how to create a personalized cordial based on a desired humor. Over 21 only.

name: Period Stained Glass Basics
description_book: Discussion of materials, techniques, and primary sources used in period stained glass work. This will not be hands-on, but many visual aids!
description_web: Discussion of materials, techniques, and primary sources used in period stained glass work, including vitreous paints, silver stain, design considerations, lead came technique, etc. Discussion will also include an overview of primary sources and other resources for research. Practical hands-on will not be available, but many examples will be available for viewing.

name: Capons, Gelatin, & Bread from the 1549 *Banchetti*
description_book: Capons with sour grape juice, egg yolks, and barberries; French egg-white gelatin; and the bread of milk and sugar from the 1549 *Banchetti*.

name: Law in the Lands of Peace
description_book: A class on *Sharia*, Muslim law, taught in persona from the point of view of the Maliki school.
description_web: A class on *Sharia*, Muslim law, taught in persona from the point of view of the Maliki school.

name: Period Black Powder Firearms Safety & Handling
description_book: Firearm safety, handling, and shooting procedures for small arms and artillery, 1320-1600. Powder + match supplied by teacher. Ages 18+.
description_web: Firearm safety, handling, and shooting procedures for small arms and artillery, 1320-1600. Owners of period arms are requested/encouraged to bring them and help with coaching newer shooters. Powder and match are supplied by instructor. Ages 18+.

name: Beginner Dance: Absolute Beginner Dance
description_book: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We’ll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the ball!

name: Period Board Games
description_book: Games Tent staff will teach a variety of period board games. Students will then have time to play them.
description_web: Games' tent staff will teach a variety of easy-to-learn period board games from various cultures. Students will then have a chance to play them.

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: *Chorulus Pennsicus*
description_book: A limited voice choir by audition only that will rehearse and perform at War. Attend first session if interested. Listeners are welcome.
description_web: A limited voice choir by audition only that will rehearse and perform at War. Attend first session if interested. Listeners are welcome. Music will be available in advance from the KWChoir yahoo group's page.

name: Heraldic Customer Service
description_book: How to be a better local officer/consultation herald with a few relatively painless changes.
description_web: So you went to the bathroom during the bizmeet and now you're the herald. Or maybe you've been your group's herald since Cariadoc was a bootblack and there's no one to take over the office. Come learn some ways to be a better officer and serve your group without letting the heraldry go by the wayside.

name: Quadratic Problems using Euclid
description_book: Book 2 of Euclid is all about various different quadratic problems. Come join us as we try to use it practically.
description_web: Book 2 of Euclid is all about various different quadratic problems. We will attempt to use Euclid to solve various period math problems. The point of this class is to attempt to free ourselves from modern mathematics and solve period problems in a period manner (and being limited by period limitations).

name: Powering Medical Devices at Pennsic
description_book: How to power your CPAP machine or other medical device in the middle of camp at Pennsic without an extension cord.

name: Sack of Rome, 1527
description_book: An overview of the 1527 sack of Rome by Spanish, German, and Italian troops; its lead up, campaign, and results.
description_web: An overview of the 1527 Sack of Rome by Spanish, German, and Italian troops of the Holy Roman Empire. The class will look at the political and military events leading up to the sack, the campaign itself, and the political results.

name: Table Hopping 101
description_book: Ever want to perform at tables during feast but didn't know where to start? Come! This class can show you how and, more importantly, when.

name: Make Your Own Bobbin Lace Pillow and Bead Bobbins
description_book: How to make a lace pillow and bead bobbins from materials you have at home.  Bobbin materials supplied.
description_web: How I made my own cookie pillows, roller pillow, block pillow and bobbins.  Many  bobbins can be made from everyday materials you have at home.  I will share my designs for the pillows I find the easiest to work with, my $5 pillow stand idea and instructions on how I made my pillows and bobbins.  Participants will be able to make their own bobbins that can be picked up the following day.
fee_itemization: Supplies to make your own bobbins.  Each participant will make and be able to pick up 10 of their own hand created bobbins the following day

name: Institutional SCAbominations
description_book: What aspects of the SCA's structure do we just get **wrong** in relation to how it really was in period? Can we do it better or are we stuck?
description_web: What aspects of the SCA's structure do we just get **wrong** in relation to how it really was in period? Did knights wear white belts? What's a shire, really? And what do you **really** call a former king? Can we do it better or are we stuck?

name: *De Lapidibus*
description_book: A class on gemstones, taught in persona, based on period sources.
description_web: A class on gemstones, taught in persona, based on period sources.
fee_itemization: no materials, probably a one page handout.

name: Medieval Chasing and Tag Games
description_book: Want to tire your children out using medieval games? Then this class is for you! We'll learn and play four simple medieval chasing and tag games.
description_web: Want to tire your children out using medieval games? Then this class is for you! We'll learn and play four simple medieval chasing and tag games: Que Loo Loo, or Wolf's Tail; Tierce; Fox and Chickens; and How Many Miles to London? These games come from the book "Medieval Games" by Salaamallah the Corpulent.

name: Beginner Dance: English Country Dance
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class starts with basic steps and patterns, then teaches simple English country dances.

name: Board Games
description_book: This class will review board games previously taught and provide opportunities to practice with a knowledgeable instructor's assistance.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.

name: Advanced Doumbek: Turkish Split Finger
description_book: Want to increase your speed, volume, and ability while using less energy? Then this class is for you. Straight from Istanbul, split finger!
description_web: This class will focus on development and strengthening of the split hand technique and its applications. Come prepared to play.

name: Recorder Jam Session
description_book: Do you play the recorder? Would you like to play with others in a group setting? Read through music? Come join us. All ages welcome.
description_web: Do you play the recorder? Would you like to play with others in a group setting? Read through Renaissance literature? Come join us. In the 90-minute session we will start with beginner/easy reading and then move towards harder music. If you're a youth player, then come at the beginning. If you're more advanced, then come halfway through. Bring your instrument or use one of ours.
fee_itemization: There will be soprano recorders available at $6.00 each.

name: Designing Armory from Period Examples
description_book: Want to have a device that might have existed in the Middle Ages? This class will help you design period-style arms by looking at period examples.
description_web: Thinking about a device but don't really know what you want? Want to have something that might have existed in the Middle Ages? This class will tell you how to design core-style arms by looking at period examples (many of which are online) and borrowing ideas, all within the standards of the Society.

name: World Tour of Smack Talk
description_book: Insults from around the world! Great fun for on the field and off!  We shall be rowdy!
description_web: Insults from around the world! Great fun for on the field and off! We shall be rowdy!

name: Bardic Collegium Practicum
description_book: Students will present a short piece for senior bards who will critique their performance. **Pre-registration is required.**
description_web: Students (of any experience level) will present a short piece for senior bards who will critique their performance. **Pre-registration is required." For more details, see the website: http://www.no-gorsedd.com/collegium/

name: Archery Marshals' Meeting
description_book: For MITs and Archery Marshals. Rules of the Pennsic Ranges.

name: Middle Eastern Music and Dance
description_book: A time for people of all skill levels to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. All instruments are welcome, and loaner drums are available!
description_web: A time for people interested in Middle Eastern music and dance to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. We will be providing instruction appropriate to the interest of the attendees, from beginning Middle Eastern drum and belly dance to teaching songs in which everyone can participate. All skill levels and instruments are welcome, and drums are available for borrowing!

name: *Amoroso* by the Book
description_book: *Amoroso* is a fun dance from 15th-C. Italy that appears in two manuscripts. Learn both versions as well as the common SCA version.

name: County Criminal Trial in 13th-C England
description_book: Indicted criminals faced justice in the courts. Determine the fate of Indicted suspects from actual cases.
description_web: After indictment, an accused faced trial. We shall need a jury to determine the fate of indicted persons in 13th Century England. Your help as a citizen is needed for justice.

name: The Polearm Techniques of Paulus Hector Mair
description_book: A look at several techniques from the 16th-C manual of arms of Paulus Hector Mair.

name: *Chigi* Dances
description_book: Come learn three dances from one of the earliest manuals of 16th-century Italian dances. All experience levels welcome.
description_web: Come learn dances from one of the earliest manuals of 16th-century Italian dances. All experience levels welcome. Possible dances: *Rose E Viole, Spagnioletta, Contra Passo*.

name: I Just Want to Bellydance
description_book: Want to dance at the numerous drum circles at Pennsic? Learn to listen to the music and practice some traditional movements. Fun is emphasized.
description_web: Want to dance at the numerous drum circles at Pennsic? This class introduces you to basic movements & listening to the music to find your personal style. Posture, attitude, stretching & fun are emphasized. Learn how to use mental cues and "pods" of movement to extend your dancing time.

name: EKBG Panel and Meet and Greet
description_book: Members of the East Kingdom Brewers' Guild may sign up for panel slots with the Guildmistress. Others are welcome to visit and share their potables!
description_web: Members of the East Kingdom Brewers' Guild may sign up for panel slots with the Guildmistress. Others are welcome to visit and share their potables! Panel opportunities are contingent on availability of those trained and eligible to do the paneling. More panel opportunities may be scheduled and would be held in a private camp (Thanet House). If those opportunities become available, they will be advertised on the EKBrewers Yahoo Group. Meet and greets will happen even if panels are not available.

name: Beginner's Ball Prep
description_book: A review of dances for the Beginner's Ball.
description_web: A review of dances for the Beginner's Ball.

name: Timeline of Soothsaying
description_book: When and where different forms of divination were practiced.
description_web: Don't just do a "Celtic Cross" with your "Steampunk" or "Dragon" Tarot. What form of divination is correct for your persona? When and where were palmistry, runes, tarot, numerology, and other forms of divination used? What were some of the more interesting forms of divination in period?

name: Paternosters: A Visual History of Period Prayer
description_book: Slideshow will feature images of prayer bead sets and fragments from the 12th-16th centuries.
description_web: After a brief discussion of the history and development of prayer beads in western Europe, this slideshow will feature images of prayer bead sets and fragments from the 12th to 16th centuries.

name: Open Dancing
description_book: Join us all evening for dancing by request.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: A general, multi-level yoga class to address the needs of the Pennsic attendee. Please dress for modesty, and bring a mat/towel or similar.
description_web: A general, multi-level yoga class to address the needs of the Pennsic attendee. Please dress for modesty, and bring a mat/towel or similar. Children responsible enough to follow along are welcome.

name: Sharpening and Using Woodworking Tools
description_book: Have you had terrible luck with planes and chisels? This class will help you learn to sharpen, tune and use these tools.

name: Medieval Pinwheels
description_book: Based on illuminations, pinwheels were a common toy of the 15th and 16th centuries. We will examine the various styles of pinwheels and make one.
description_web: Based on illuminations, pinwheels were a common toy of the 15th and 16th centuries. We will examine the various styles of pinwheels and make one to take home. Fun for adults and children. Children should be accompanied as appropriate to their tool use skills.

name: History and Techniques of Drawn-thread Work
description_book: Covers the history and techniques of drawn thread work, or *Punto Turati*. Students will create a sample piece including each technique.
description_web: This class will cover the history of drawn thread work, or *Punto Turati*, as well as the techniques involved in both the creation of the base fabric and the period stitches used for the final design. Students will create a sample piece to demonstrate each technique.

name: *Kute Uchi* (Also *Kumihimo*)
description_book: Part 5: Japanese finger-loop braiding (early *kumihimo*). Come learn how early Japanese started braiding. This is a beginner class
description_web: Part 5: Japanese finger-loop braiding (early *kumihimo*). Come learn how early Japanese started braiding. This is a beginner class
fee_itemization:
5.00 for class & handout
2.00 for handout only

name: 10th-Century York Needle-Binding Stitch
description_book: Needle-binding stitch from an extant example. A hands-on class; material will be available for loan and purchase; feel free to bring your own.
description_web: Another historical needle-binding stitch, this time from York. Yarn and handout are free. Handouts for other stitches will be available, too.
fee_itemization: If you keep the needle it is $5, but borrowing one for the class is free.

name: Top It Off: 16th-Century Woman's Caul
description_book: This hands-on class will teach you how to construct a late-16th-century woman's caul. Bring scissors.
description_web: Hats finish the outfit, so "top it off". This hands-on class will teach you how to construct a late-16th-century caul. Hand-sewing ability helpful. Bring scissors. Additional participants may bring their own fabric (1/2 yard), needle and thread.

name: FAP: Basics of Medieval Italian Dagger, Part 1
description_book: Freelance Academy Press presents fundamentals of medieval Italian dagger (in three 1-hour classes, progressive). This is the first of three classes.
description_web: Freelance Academy Press presents fundamentals of medieval Italian dagger (in three 1-hour classes, progressive). Equipment: Dagger simulator (some loaners available); fencing mask for part 3. Pre-reqs: Fundamental body structure and movement in *Armizare*, or familairity with the terms of *Armizare* is recommended.

name: Basic Coining
description_book: Striking basic coins from punched dies. Die preparation, creating punches, using those punches to make dies, and striking coins. Slightly messy.
description_web: Striking basic coins from punched dies. Die preparation, creating punches, using those punches to make dies, and striking coins. Somewhat messy.
fee_itemization: Handout, dies, punches, sandpaper, and coin blanks.

name: ASHI First Aid
description_book: Successful completion of this class will provide a two-year certification in first aid.
description_web: Successful completion of this class will provide a two-year certification in first aid. Current certifications in both first aid and CPR are required for serving as a chirurgeon.
fee_itemization: $15 for certification card.  An additional $5 is required if you wish to keep the text book

name: The Submission Process
description_book: This class explains the basics of documenting and submitting a name, device or badge, and what happens to it afterwards.
description_web: So, you've worked with a herald to register your name and/or armory. What happens now? This class intends to explain the basics of documenting and submitting a name, device or badge, and what happens to it afterwards.

name: History of Gunpowder and Gunpowder Weapons
description_book: The instructor will document the origins and history of gunpowder and gunpowder weapons from their earliest use to ca. 1600 CE.

name: Orgainizing a Successful Feast
description_book: Successful feasts start with planning. How to set-up and organize a feast, lessons learned from a State Dinner, followed by round-table discussion.
description_web: Successful feasts start with planning. How to set-up and organize a feast. Instructor will give lessons learned from many feasts, including State Dinner at Pennsic, followed by round-table discussion of what students have seen that works/doesn't work.

name: Archaeological Textiles: Context and Provenance
description_book: This class will look at textiles that have been recovered from numerous archaeological excavations from around Europe and the Mid-East.
description_web: This class will look at textiles and textile production tools that been recovered from archaeological excavations, the structures and the fibers and tools used in their production. Sites include Northern Europe, British Islands, the Mediterranean and the Middle East prior to the Middle Ages.

name: Everybody Dies
description_book: This class examines the evolution of Western attitudes towards death in the Middle Ages.
description_web: This class will examine the evolution of Western attitudes towards death in the Middle Ages. Topics discussed will include, but not be limited to, locations of burial, costs for burial, rituals before and after death, and the importance of the soul.

name: Guild of St Barbara - Meeting
description_book: Anyone interested in black powder weapons, and how they relate to the SCA, please join us.
description_web:
Anyone interested in Black Powder weapons, and how they relate to the SCA, please join us. Based within the Society of Creative Anachronism, we research, practice and celebrate all things black powder. Led by our Guild Master, Master Roderic Hawkyns, OL, OP, and Captayne General of Artillary for Pennsic, it is the guild's duty to expand the knowledge of period firearms within the Kingdom and the Society in general. He is assisted by Master Gunners, Master Michael Graham, OL; Master Joseph of the Red Griffin, OP; and Erich von Kleinfeld.
The guild is chartered in the East Kingdom, and known as 'Queen Anna's Gunners.'

name: Gathering of the Louds
description_book: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Players of loud Renaissance instruments  gather just for fun to play poly-choral music. Come and be heard.
description_web: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Players of loud Renaissance instruments  gather just for fun to play poly-choral music. Not sure what these instruments are? Come listen or try one. Bring a music stand and clothespins.

name: *RunValdr*
description_book: System for using runes for healing and "magic."
description_web: In period runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to heal even at distance, to awaken inanimate objects, to stop migraines, and more.

name: Multiplayer Tables
description_book: Learn variations of Tables (Nard, Backgammon) for 4 or 7 players.
description_web: Learn variations of Tables (Nard, Backgammon) for 4 or 7 players.

name: 16th-Century Limp Book Binding (Chain Stitch)
description_book: All-day class making a 16th-C limp vellum-covered book with decorative chain stitching on exposed spine. Some embroidery skills required.
description_web: An all-day class on how to make a 16th-C limp vellum-covered book with decorative chain-stitched exposed spine. Some embroidery skills are required to do this decorative spine, but no prior bookbinding knowledge is required. All tools are loaned by the instructor, but students can bring at least 3 matching beads (no larger than 10mm) for the ties.
fee_itemization: Fee covers vellum for the cover, a handout, paper for the blank book, leather for the spine, beads for the ties, and linen thread.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching.
description_web: During this ten-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and mundanely. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: Known World Choir Rehearsal
description_book: Join the oldest Pennsic Choir as we rehearse in preparation for a concert Aug 1. We will perform some music in tribute to Owain Phyfe.
description_web: The Known World Choir, along with the Children's and Youth Choirs, the Debatable Choir, Chorulus Pennsicus, and other guests will present a concert of medieval and Renaissance choral literature. As part of their repertoire, the Known World Choir will perform some songs in tribute to Owain Phyfe.

name: Changing Fingering and Changing Clefs
description_book: We'll discuss how to go from a C recorder to an F recorder, and then practice doing it. Editions in C clefs and facsimile also will be available.
description_web: In this class we'll discuss how to go from a C recorder to an F recorder, and then spend most of our time practicing doing just that. Some fairly straight-forward music will be handed out that's suitable to different sizes of recorder. For more advanced players we'll have some editions of the music in various C clefs, Baritone Clef, French Violin Clef, and facsimile. The music will be pretty simple, so even musicians who aren't totally secure on their instrument of choice should be successful in this class.

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a trim strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a trim strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: Calligraphy 101
description_book: Learn the basics of calligraphy; practice techniques of beginning alphabets using Speedball dip pens and India ink. For beginners

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day.
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. 
Day 1- Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum
Day 2- Chiftitelli, Masmoudi
Day 3- Ayub, Malfouf
Day 4- Kashlimah and other strange stuff

name: Armory Consultation: How to Consult Effectively
description_book: A look at the role of the herald in the process of armory consultations, methods for fulfilling it effectively, and other things to keep in mind.

name: The Renaissance Barber-Surgeon
description_book: The instructor will use reproduction medical tools and facsimile texts to explain medical and surgical techniques and the role of the Barber-Surgeon.

name: Women's Open Hoods
description_book: A look at the development of the open-style hood worn by women in the 14th and 15th centuries, including patterns and construction information.

name: *Opus Anglicanum* - Underside Couching
description_book: *Opus Anglicanum* embroidery has several defining characteristics. This class concentrates on teaching the underside couching portion of this style.
description_web: There have been numerous classes on aspects of *Opus Anglicanum* embroidery at Pennsic University. However, the underside couching portion has been under-represented. The technique produces a wonderful textural effect in the background. We will learn the technique, some history and, if time permits, review the split stitch part of the style.

name: Basic Weaving: Emphasis on Tablet Weaving
description_book: Hands-on weaving using cards to produce a decorative woven band. For older children (age 12 and up with parent) and adults.
description_web: Learn a few tablet weaving basics and begin weaving on pre-strung cards. Students leave with abilities to reproduce simple bands on their own. Handout included in material fee. For older children (age 12 and up with parent) and adults.

name: Performing Theater in the SCA
description_book: Learn about kinds of theater to do in the SCA - mummings, masques, civic processions, and plays that may be short, long, bawdy or morally instructive.
description_web: Theater in period took many forms - mummings, civic processions, plays that are short, long, bawdy or morally instructive and even more. Learn about what they were, where to find out more about them and ways to do them.

name: Quick & Easy Handmade Largess
description_book: A discussion about largess - why we should give it, why you should make it, and what options are out there. We will make two to three examples.
description_web: A discussion about largess - why we should give it, why you should make it, and what options are out there. We will make two to three examples.

name: Make a 14th-Century-Style Linen Hood
description_book: In three hours, you will have a fitted 14th-century-style linen hood.  Hands-on. Everything you need is in the kit.
description_web: The goal at the end of this class is to have a mid-14th-C-style hood completed (or almost completed). I will walk you through the hand-sewing of this fitted accessory (including doing a fitting for you to make sure your hood will fit *you*). Class includes instructions on how to make wad buttons (so your buttons will match your hood) - OR you may choose to purchase buttons from the many merchants at Pennsic. If you purchase buttons, please buy them before class and bring them with you. This way, you can make sure your buttonholes will be the correct size.
