fee_itemization: 2-3 yards of linen, sewing thread, DMC thread, needles, pins, small scissors, seam ripper, chalk, handouts, ruler, paper to make a pattern

name: Make a St. Birgitta Coif
description_book: Come make a simple linen coif appropriate for all classes of women from the 13-15th century. Recommended: knowledge of basic hand-sewing.

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Performing Arts Pavilion on Thursday afternoon of War Week. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.”

name: Introduction to Pavan and Galliard
description_book: Suitable for beginners, this class offers a walk-through of the pavan and galliard, two improvisational dances from the 16th century.
description_web: Suitable for beginners, this class offers a walk-through of the pavan and galliard, two improvisational dances from the 16th century. The pavan is extremely low-impact, but the galliard can rather unforgiving on one's knees and ankles. It can be modified to reduce impact, however.

name: Simple Board Games
description_book: Many were tavern games but are great fun for young folks without the adult context. Parents must accompany children.
description_web: Simple board games for our younger members such as Morris and Goose will be taught. All are welcome as many of these games are known from their tavern versions. This is an introductory class and lots of time to play will be included.

name: Bling on a Budget
description_book: How to use glass jewels, beads, and metal to add dignity and ostentation to garb without going broke.
description_web: How to use glass jewels, beads, and metal to add dignity and ostentation to garb without going broke. From minor flourishes to full-bore excess, planning and execution covered by instructor with 25+ years experience working with these forms of embellishment. Supplies available for purchase; prices vary depending on patterns chosen. No purchase necessary.
fee_itemization: Fee depends on choices made. No purchase necessary.

name: Stage Fright: Nothing To Fear But Rotten Tomatoes
description_book: Knees knocking? Butterflies make you batty? Had enough of the heckler in your head? Shedding light on stage fright for bards and performers.
description_web: Knees knocking? Butterflies make you batty? Had enough of the heckler in your head? Shedding light on stage fright for bards and performers. Topics to be discussed include causes and effects of stage fright, tips and tricks of performing despite of stage fright, practical exercises to start moving through and beyond the fear, and beginning steps to find the fun in performing again.

name: Welcome To Your First Pennsic
description_book: An overview of what it's like to be at your first or second Pennsic. The second hour of the class is an optional walking tour.
description_web: Just what have you gotten yourself into? An overview of what it's like to be at your first or second Pennsic. We'll talk about the basics: Drink water any time anyone offers, what happens in the battles, where to see the coolest Arts & Sciences and where things are. The first hour will be in the class tent, and the second hour will be an optional walking tour of some Pennsic sites.

name: Beginning *Pysanky*
description_book: Students will learn the history of the *pysanka*, and have the opportunity to create one of their own.
description_web: Students will learn the history of the *pysanka*, as well as the techniques involved, and have the opportunity to create one of their own. The class is listed as 3 hours to allow plenty of time for writing the shells; it doesn't usually take that long.
fee_itemization: $5 overall, $2 if you just want the handout (but it IS a hands-on class ...)

name: Roses Then and Now
description_book: A survey of roses that were available and/or cultivated during our period and how they compare to roses commonly grown today.
fee_itemization: Handouts are in color so fee to cover that expense

name: Bidding the Bedes: Introduction to Paternosters
description_book: The history and development of western European Christian prayer beads as well as information on making your own replica.
description_web: In the 13th-16th centuries in western Europe, prayer beads were a ubiquitous accessory. This class discusses the history and development of the paternoster, as well as information on making your own replica. Kits will be available to make a glass or bone paternoster.
fee_itemization: Beads, silk thread, needle, terminal pendant, bead tip

name: Henna Party
description_book: Come and explore the world of henna body art! All materials and instruction are provided. Children welcome with responsible adult.
description_web: Come and explore the world of henna body art! All materials and instruction are provided. Children are welcome when accompanied by a responsible adult.
fee_itemization: Henna powder (approximately 1 kilo), mylar cone applicators, Scotch tape, packing tape, plastic baggies, lemon juice, tea tree essential oil, geranium essential oil, watercolor pencils, paper towels, cotton balls, witch hazel, bamboo skewers

name: Introduction to Medieval Music Notation
description_book: We'll discuss differences with modern notation, then read several examples. Bring melody instruments you play fluently, e.g., recorder, fiddle, voice.
description_web: Reading medieval music in modern notation imposes modern notions of measure, phrasing, and tonality. Reading it in the original notation allows us to get closer to the composer's intentions and the head-space of a medieval performer, and can help achieve those elusive, magical “medieval moments”. We'll start with an overview of differences between modern and medieval notation, and then spend most of the class reading examples. Bring melody instruments you play fluently, such as recorder, gamba, fiddle, voice (if you have good pitch memory), etc. If you have multiple sizes of your instrument, please bring them (e.g., SATB recorders).

name: Horn Carving
description_book: We will discuss horn variety, selection, stripping, layout, carving and treating your horn. **Some hands-on**; bring tools!!!
description_web: We will discuss horn variety, selection, stripping, layout, carving and treating your horn. We will have some hands-on for those interested; please bring a very sturdy, short, sharp, carving blade. I do not have horns available; however, I will have practice pieces there for you to play with. You may purchase horns on site, but after the class you will have a better idea of what to look for. Primarily Norse-style work.

name: Armor Extrication
description_book: Learn how to remove armor without injuring yourself, the fighter, or their armor and when to use it (splinting/support).
description_web: Learn how to remove armor without injuring yourself, the fighter, or their armor and when to use it (splinting/support). Covers the assorted types of armor used in all adult and youth SCA martial activities. While the class is directed toward first aid providers, it is useful knowledge for anyone who may be assisting armored individuals. The logic presented here can also be applied to complex garb. This class will be part class room and part walking tour of the combat areas. Volunteers will provide you the opportunity get hands-on practice during the class.

name: *Furioso All'Italiano*
description_book: Come learn *Furioso All'Italiano*, a 16th-C Italian dance for sets of three couples! Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.

name: Period Board Games
description_book: Games Tent staff will teach a variety of period board games. Students will then have time to play them.
description_web: Games' tent staff will teach a variety of easy-to-learn period board games from various cultures. Students will then have a chance to play them.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* & Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Known World Children's Choir
description_book: The Known World Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.
description_web: The Known World Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.

name: Sing We And Chant It - Madrigal and A Capella Jam
description_book: Optional jam & practice session for audience participation, "Sing We and Chant It" Madrigal and A Capella Jam, on the 28th.
description_web: Optional jam & practice session for the audience participation "Sing We and Chant It" Madrigal and A Capella Jam, Sunday 28, at 5 pm in the Performing Arts Tent. All are welcome! Music will be available to share, or bring your own! (Material fee optional for a folder of this year's jam music)
fee_itemization: Optional $5 Fee.  Music packet of around 25 choral public domain songs, sheet music to keep.

name: Basic Turkish Romany Dance
description_book: Learn the basics of Turkish Romany dance: culture, style, costuming, music, musicians & dance moves. Part lecture, part dance class.
description_web: This class is an introduction to authentic Turkish Romany Dance. Part lecture and part dance class, we will talk about the culture, style, costuming, music, musicians and we will dance! Some handouts and music will be available to purchase. Bring your notebooks and dancing feet!

name: Multi-Kingdom Heraldic Roundtable
description_book: A discussion of court, pageantry, submissions process, IKA and any other heraldic topic brought up. Everyone is invited and welcome to participate.
description_web: Current and former Principal Heralds and Submissions Heralds as well as other interested parties will hold a roundtable discussion of court, pageantry, submissions process, IKA and any other heraldic topic brought to the discussion. Everyone is invited and welcome to participate.

name: Event Finances: Before, During and After
description_book: From budget to gate to the event report, a practical discussion of event finances, based on Chapter 9 of the *Local Exchequer Handbook*.

name: The Champagne Fairs
description_book: A history of the great Champagne Fairs of Northern France and their impact on Europe's culture and economics.
description_web: A history of the great Champagne Fairs of Northern France. The fairs were six-to-eight-week-long international trade fairs, rather than small market fairs. They played a major role in the flow of goods and ideas and laid the foundation for international banking and finance as we know it today.

name: Intermediate Sprang: S & Z Twist Patterns
description_book: Learn continuous loop warping and how to make a band with patterns using S and Z twists in the same row. Must already know basic sprang.
fee_itemization:
20 page handout
yarn, sticks, needle, etc.
Frames available or bring your own.

name: Spinning Flax on a Wheel
description_book: Spinning flax is fun! Learn to spin flax on a wheel from a distaff.
description_web: Spinning flax is fun! It's frustrating! It's a unique spinning experience! With the fibers measuring from 24-36 inches, it's a completely different experience than spinning even the longest staple wool. We'll talk about using a distaff, and other ways to support the fibers. I'll show you how I dress my tree-branch distaff, and those interested may spin at my wheel. You may also bring your own if you like. I find that I prefer my double-drive wheel with attached distaff for flax spinning, but plenty of folks use their Scotch tension wheels quite successfully. This class is an advanced-level spinning class though all are welcome to come listen and watch.

name: *Opus Anglicanum* (English Goldwork)
description_book: Learn the art of *Opus Anglicanum*, or "English Goldwork". This class is for both beginners and advanced embroiders. Hands-on class.
description_web: Learn the art of *Opus Anglicanum*, or "English Goldwork". This class is for both beginners and advanced embroiders. Hands-on class.
fee_itemization:
Gold thread - $2
silk thread - $3
hoop - $2
linen - $2
needles, thread, misc - $1

name: From Clay to Bread: Recreating/Using a Clay Oven
description_book: Discussion/examples of clay ovens in period and the materials to create them. Demo how to use; we will bake bread.
description_web: Discussion and examples of clay ovens in period and the materials used to create them. Also a demonstration on how to use a clay oven. We will be baking bread.

name: Whose Partner Am I Anyway?
description_book: Why settle for one when you can have both? Learn three fun, flirty, and fickle Playford dances: *Rufty Tufty, Heart's Ease, & Cuckolds All in a Row.*
description_web: Why settle for dancing with one partner when you can dance with both! Learn three fun, flirty, and fickle four-person Playford dances including *Rufty Tufty, Heart's Ease,* and *Cuckolds All in A Row.* Basic ECD steps will be reviewed. Beginner+.

name: Tarot and other Period Card Games
description_book: Games Tent staff teach a variety of period card games, then we play. Games may include "The Game of Tarot", "Losing Lodum", "Laugh and Lie Down".
description_web: Games Tent staff teach a variety of period card games. Games taught may include "The Game of Tarot", "Losing Lodum", "Laugh and Lie Down". Time for play will follow.

name: Known World Youth Choir
description_book: The Known World Youth Choir is open to youth age 12-18 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.
description_web: The Known World Youth Choir is open to youth age 12-18 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.

name: Adv. Calligraphy: *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*
description_book: Learn 3 scripts: Lombardic caps, blackletter, & italic, and tips to take calligraphy to the next level. Three two-hour sessions. Not for beginners.
description_web: The *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta* is a late-period Renaissance master’s showcase. In this 3-day, in-depth study, students will learn scripts used in this manuscript: Lombardic capitals, blackletter, and italic. Take your calligraphy to the next level with our tips on using a quill, using an Ames lettering guide, and creating non-standard layouts. Plan to attend all 3 two-hour sessions. Not suitable for beginners.
fee_itemization: calligraphy marker, watercolor paper, binder, supplies, color handouts

name: How to Draw Manuscript Flora
description_book: If you passed kindergarten art class, you can draw a 14th-C French scroll.
description_web: If you passed kindergarten art class, you can draw a 14th-century French scroll. This class will break down the elements and have you leaving confident and ready to illuminate.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Commenting on Letters of Intent
description_book: Heraldic letters of intent (in and out of kingdoms) can always benefit from trained, or less experienced, commenters. How can you help?
description_web: Heraldic letters of intent (in and out of kingdoms) can always benefit from trained, or less experienced, commenters. We will discuss how to provide helpful commentary for these. For heralds or aspiring heralds.

name: Simply Plaited: 14th-Century Women's Hair
description_book: Theorized period methods of achieving three 14th-C hairstyles popular in England and France with archaeological and artistic examples. Instructional.
description_web: Theorized  period methods of achieving three 14th-century hairstyles popular in England and France. Period archaeological and artistic examples will be shown/demonstrated. Discussion of the use of modern materials also included.

name: Period Nautical Personas Roundtable
description_book: An open discussion on what constitutes a nautical persona in the SCA, and how to effectively portray one.
description_web: An open discussion on what constitutes a nautical persona in the SCA, how sailors were perceived and behaved in period, and tips on how to bring nautical personas to life in the SCA.

name: Fun with Body Parts I: Relics
description_book: Miscellaneous body parts more precious than jewels? An irreverent look at the cult of the saints.
description_web: Miscellaneous body parts more precious than jewels? An irreverent look at the cult of the saints, a phenomenon which led to an international business in bones, daring thefts and major con jobs.

name: Children's Garb Roundtable
description_book: Join a discussion on how to make inexpensive garb for your child as they grow. Share your tips, ideas and questions.
description_web: Join a discussion on how to make inexpensive garb for your child as they grow. Share your tips, ideas and questions. Bring samples of your favorite go-to garb for your child. The handout will include ideas, websites, pictures that have been gleaned over the years.

name: Introduction to Youth Rapier (East Kingdom Rules)
description_book: For youths under 18 yrs old who want to learn the basic fundamentals of fencing according to East Kingdom rules. **Please bring a parent!**

name: Building a Bardic Book
description_book: For new bards or performers in search of new performance material: tips and advice from a librarian. Emphasis on pre-1600 music/poetry/story.
description_web: For new or aspiring bards, or performers in search of more performance material: tips and advice from a bard (mundanely a librarian) on sources for music and more. Emphasis on pre-1600 music (plus some poetry/story) but we'll also make forays into "traditional" songs, SCA songs, and resources for those who need words for their music, or music for their words.

name: 14th-Century Nalbinding
description_book: An introduction to what is known about nalbinding in the 14th century. Pictures of extant items will be shown. Practice basic stitches.
description_web: An introduction to what is known about nalbinding in the 14th century. Pictures of extant items will be shown. Practice basic stitches. No prior experience with nalbinding necessary. Stitches are simple looping variants.
fee_itemization: Materials include string and a #13 tapestry needle.

name: Historical Facets of *Commedia dell' Arte* Troupes
description_book: Ideas on how to manage *commedia dell' arte* troupes in the SCA based on research regarding *commedia* troupes in period.
description_web: Have you been interested in joining, creating or potentially finding new members for a *Commedia dell'Arte* group? *Commedia dell'Arte* differs from traditional theater in many ways. This class will present research about how to run an SCA troupe based on the structure and profession in period. Whether you are *Comici* or a *Capicomico*, learn how to interact in a troupe with courtesy, diligence and commitment to the art. During the second hour, all students are welcome to network and discuss with artists from various kingdoms. All are welcome to attend.

name: FAP: Basics of Medieval Italian Dagger, Part. 2
description_book: Freelance Academy Press presents fundamentals of medieval Italian dagger (in three 1-hour classes, progressive): Part 2.
description_web:
Freelance Academy Press presents fundamentals of medieval Italian dagger (in three 1-hour classes, progressive): Part 2. 
Equipment: Dagger simulator (I will have some loaners available); fencing mask for class 3. 
Pre-reqs: Fundamental body structure and movement in *Armizare*, or familiarity with the terms of *Armizare* is recommended.

name: Beginner Dance: 15th-Century Italian Dance
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class starts with basic steps and patterns, then teaches a few simple 15th-C. Italian dances.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class starts with basic steps and patterns, then teaches a few simple 15th-C. Italian dances. Dances taught may include *Petit Vriens, Petit Rose, Amoroso*, and *Gelosia*.

name: Playing the Renaissance Side Drum
description_book: This class will cover the basics of playing a Renaissance side drum, including period rhythms. Hands-on.
description_web: The Renaissance side drum is the predecessor to the modern snare drum. In this class, we'll cover the basics of playing a side drum. We'll review the parts of the drum, how to hold the drum and the sticks, the basics of rhythm, and what we know about period rhythms. This will be a hands-on class; bring a pair of drumsticks and a drum, if you have one. Some loaner sticks will be available.

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Warp a loom, weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own.

name: Intermediate  Doumbek
description_book: Various topics for those looking to get beyond *baladi*. Pops, snaps, rolls, combinations, fills, soloing, etc.

name: German Ren. *Tellerbarret* Hats: Make-and-Take
description_book: Learn how to make the striking German *Tellerbarret* ("platter hat") popular during the 16th century.
description_web: A hands-on German hat-making experience! Students will view several examples of different *Tellerbarret* hat styles and constructions, then be instructed in creating their own hat -- complete with slashing, if desired. No experience is necessary. Students will cut, slash, and sew their own hats. These hats work great for keeping your face shaded at Pennsic! Please bring your own scissors.

name: The Great Gothic Experiment
description_book: The class will be a summary of the effort thus far (and future) to stake out the perimeter of a Gothic cathedral using period tools alone.
description_web: The GGE is an attempt to stake out the perimeter of a Gothic cathedral ( Chartres) using period tools alone. This class will serve as a summary of the efforts thus far in making and using the tools, and steps moving forward.

name: *Cloisonné* Enameling
description_book: Introduction to the technique, tools, and materials of *cloisonné* enamel. Kits are available for students to create a small piece.
description_web: Students will be introduced to the technique, tools, and materials of *cloisonné* enamel. Kits are available for students to create a small piece of their own. You may - and are encouraged - to bring wire working tools such as pliers and cutters.
fee_itemization: Kit Includes handout, blank disk to apply enamels, cloisonne' wire and use of instructors enamel colors and kiln to fire.

name: Hand-Sewing 101
description_book: A discussion and hands-on of hand-sewing of garb, etc. This is not embroidery but useful stitches. Please bring needle, thread and light cloth.

name: Roundtable: Teaching Lampworking & Beadmaking
description_book: Let's all get together and talk about the best ways to teach lampworking & beadmaking. For experienced instructors and those considering teaching.

name: Simple Pouch Purse
description_book: Learn to make a leather pouch purse with your child! Kits available to first 10 parent-child/team. Permanent paints will be used to decorate pouch.
description_web: A hands-on class for making a leather pouch purse. This class is family-friendly and youth/children are encouraged to participate. (Responsible adult required for any youth in attendance.) History of the importance of pouches along with their construction will be discussed with decoration and sewing of pouches. *Non-toxic* permanent paints provided. Kits are limited to the first 10 teams/families.
fee_itemization: 10.00 for kit including all materials (leather, thread, cording, bead, and paints). Needles will be provided but not to be taken.

name: How Do You Know When You Are a Bard?
description_book: An opinion of where an SCA bard fits within our performing world and how to go about being one.

name: Leaves of Laughter - Comic Theatre Workshop
description_book: A participatory workshop introducing late-medieval improvisational Japanese comic theatre. Script short plays for performance later in the week.
description_web: A participatory workshop introducing late-medieval improvisational Japanese comic theatre. Participants will be introduced to stock characters, theatrical devices, and comic theory. We will read several play synopses and script a short play for performance later in the week.

name: FAP: Basics of Medieval Italian Dagger, Part 3
description_book: Freelance Academy Press presents fundamentals of medieval Italian dagger (in three 1-hour classes, progressive): Part 3. Fencing mask required.
description_web:
Freelance Academy Press presents fundamentals of medieval Italian dagger (in three 1-hour classes, progressive): Part 3. 
Equipment: Dagger simulator (some loaners available); fencing mask for class 3. 
Pre-reqs: Fundamental body structure and movement in *Armizare*, or familiarity with the terms of *Armizare* is recommended.

name: Known World Courtesan Social
description_book: Join us for an afternoon of leisure, food & entertainment. This “meet ‘n greet” is open to anyone interested in courtesan history and/or persona.
description_web: Join our 2nd Annual Social for an afternoon of leisure, food and entertainment. This “meet and greet” is open to anyone who has an interest in courtesan history and/or courtesan persona. Topics of conversation will include introductions, courtesan persona Q&A, & future meetings. More details can be found at http://courtesans.weebly.com.

name: Beginner Dance: Pavane and Galliard
description_book: The pavane and galliard is a traditional dance combination of the 16th century. Class covers the steps and techniques needed for both dance styles.

name: Card Games
description_book: This class will review the card games previously taught and let you practice playing them with an instructor's assistance.
description_web: This class will review the card games previously taught and let you practice playing them with an instructor's assistance.

name: Advanced *Repoussé* & Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block working, forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block working, forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.

name: Variations on a Theme I: *De Tous Bien Pleyne*
description_book: Play polyphonic settings of one of the Greatest Hits of the 15th century, and compare what various composers did with it. For recorders and strings.
description_web: Fifteenth-century Franco-Flemish *chansons* were frequently based on "pop tunes" of the day. We will play polyphonic settings of one of the Greatest Hits of the 15th century as realized by some of the greatest composers. For recorders, viols and other period soft instruments.

name: Bread Myths Busted
description_book: Think you know about medieval bread? Maybe not! We'll take a look a popular beliefs about bread and look for the truth.

name: Elizabethan Embroidered Slips
description_book: Popular from the mid-16th to the mid-17th C, slips were embroidered motifs on canvas which were cut out and applied to various backing fabrics.
description_web: Popular from the mid-16th to the mid-17th centuries, slips were embroidered motifs on canvas which were cut out and applied to various backing fabrics. Many of the surviving examples found today are of floral and plant motifs with many of the images having been copied or inspired by herbals, hence the use of the term 'slips.'
fee_itemization: Kits will include an embroidery hoop, needles, floss, 18-count evenweave fabric with a pre-drawn image, and full-colour handout.

name: From Text to Voice
description_book: Converting traditional tales from text to oral form and why there's a difference.
description_web: Traditional stories from around the world have been recorded in writing, but the forms used by writers differ from those we use orally. This class addresses reasons why writers' versions vary from both the oral forms and each other, and how to give them voice. Students will have opportunity to retell stories during class; books will be available for reference but you are welcome and encouraged to bring a story you'd like to play with.

name: The Polearm Techniques of Paulus Hector Mair
description_book: A look at several techniques from the 16th-C manual of arms of Paulus Hector Mair.

name: Middle Eastern Music and Dance
description_book: A time for people of all skill levels to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. All instruments are welcome, and loaner drums are available!
description_web: A time for people interested in Middle Eastern music and dance to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. We will be providing instruction appropriate to the interest of the attendees, from beginning Middle Eastern drum and belly dance to teaching songs in which everyone can participate. All skill levels and instruments are welcome, and drums are available for borrowing!

name: All Ages Revel
description_book:
Dance and be merry. This is the perfect ball for children and beginners.
All youth in attendance require a responsible adult to be present.
description_web: Dance and be merry. This is the perfect ball for children, beginners, and experts wanting to have fun. Dances will have just enough instruction to keep everyone on the right foot. All youth in attendance require a responsible adult to be present.

name: Arabic Folk Songs
description_book: Learn some songs from Arabic-speaking countries, including lyrics, pronunciation, meaning, melody and rhythm.
description_web: Learn songs of various regions of the Arab world. All aspects of the songs will be covered, including lyrics, pronunciation, meaning, melody and rhythm. Open to singers (these are folk songs - anyone can sing them!), melody musicians and drummers who understand volume control. Quarter-tone alert: some of the songs will include quarter-tones. In order to be able to play these tunes, you will need to have an instrument capable of playing quarter-tones, such as *oud*, violin, *ney*, or the vocal cords you were born with.

name: Dumbek Diagnosis
description_book: This class is designed to hone your technique whether you are a beginner or advanced.  We will diagnose and offer suggestions on how to improve.
description_web: This class is designed to hone your technique. Or, simply learn technique if you are not familiar with the dumbek.  Whether you are just beginning or have been playing for years we will diagnose and offer suggestions on how to improve your technique.  Each and every student will receive individual attention.

name: Chirurgeon Orientation
description_book: Orientation for those wishing to volunteer at First Aid Point at Pennsic.

name: About the Pennsic Memorial Viking Ship
description_book: An explanation of the custom of the ship from the inspiration to now.

name: Prick-and-Pounce: Period Embroidery Transfer
description_book: Try a period embroidery transfer method that’s still in use today. Bring white fabric in a hoop to transfer a design. Limited kits available.
description_web: Try a period embroidery transfer method that’s still in use today. Bring white fabric in a hoop to transfer a design.
fee_itemization:
Archival pen: 2.50
pounce: 1
needle: 0.3
felt: 0.25
cork handle: free
Pattern on paper: 0.05
cork mat: 0.70

name: Fight with All Your Strength: Getting Started
description_book: Basic weightlifting for full-body strength that will that will help you fight better and reduce injury.
description_web: This class is an introduction to basic weightlifting for strength. The class covers basic exercises for developing full-body strength that will help you fight better. Strength training is also the best tool for reducing the chance of injury. A limited number of participants will also be able to get hands-on instruction. Learn more at http://fightwithallyourstrength.blogspot.com/

name: I Just Want to Bellydance
description_book: Want to dance at the numerous drum circles at Pennsic? Learn to listen to the music and practice some traditional movements. Fun is emphasized.
description_web: Want to dance at the numerous drum circles at Pennsic? This class introduces you to basic movements & listening to the music to find your personal style. Posture, attitude, stretching & fun are emphasized. Learn how to use mental cues and "pods" of movement to extend your dancing time.

name: Start a Fire Like a Moderately Intelligent Saxon
description_book: Learn how to start a fire like Saxons, Vikings, and everyone else in the Middle Ages using flint and steel. This is a hands-on class.
description_web: Learn how to start a fire like Saxons, Vikings, and everyone else in the Middle Ages using flint and steel. This is a hands-on class.

name: Ball Prep
description_book: Want to dance at the ball, but have no or little idea how? This is the class for you! All steps will be taught, along with etiquette & survival tips.

name: Gender Roles in Anglo-Saxon England
description_book: What do we know about the male/female/gay gender roles in Anglo-Saxon England?
description_web: In anthropology, sex is biological, but gender describes culturally-based roles. What differences did gender make for Anglo-Saxon men and women? What do we know about homosexuality in this culture?

name: Cupid's Arrow Ball
description_book: Romance abounds in this evening’s revels! There will be mixer dances for the singles, romantic dances for the couples, and entertainment between sets.
description_web: Celebrate already being under Cupid's spell or come see if you're his next target! There will be plenty of mixer dances for the singles, slow dances for romancing your partner, and quick, flirty dances for all. Between sets, enjoy the finest entertainment and refreshments AEthelmearc has to offer, including loving choral music and a comedic improv sketch about love. Romance abounds as Cupid lets loose his arrows!

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: A general, multi-level yoga class to address the needs of the Pennsic attendee. Please dress for modesty, and bring a mat/towel or similar.
description_web: A general, multi-level yoga class to address the needs of the Pennsic attendee. Please dress for modesty, and bring a mat/towel or similar. Children responsible enough to follow along are welcome.

name: ASHI CPR
description_book: Successful completion of this class will provide a two-year certification in CPR.
description_web: Successful completion of this class will provide a two-year certification in CPR. Current certifications in both first aid and CPR are required for serving as a chirurgeon.
fee_itemization: $15 for certification card.  Additional $5 if you wish to keep the text book

name: Beginning Celtic Knotwork
description_book: Using 5-dot technique, students will be able to create knotwork. We'll look at examples and see patterns used. You get handout, pencils, graph paper.

name: Mental Illness in Medieval Europe
description_book: Discusses issues from diagnostic categories to treatment and care, court fools to the insanity defense, and medical melancholy to spirit possession.
description_web: How did medieval people -- including both educated specialists in law, medicine, religion, and more ordinary folks -- cope with the challenges of mental illness?  This class discusses issues from diagnostic categories to treatment and care, from court fools to the insanity defense, and from medical melancholy to spirit possession.

name: Hoods, Horns & Hennins
description_book: Categorizing the diversity of women's headdress in 15th-century France.

name: Beginning Bead-Making
description_book: Interested in learning the art of glass bead-making? Must wear closed-toed shoes, long sleeves and pants/dress.
description_web: Interested in learning the art of glass bead making? Come join us! Instruction will be given the first hour of class with guided practice; the second hour is for you to practice the skills that you have learned. Students will be able to take home any beads they make during class! Must wear closed-toed shoes, long sleeves and pants or dress. Students not wearing the proper attire will be turned away. Sorry, we are dealing with hot glass, people, and it is hot!!!
fee_itemization: Glass rods, propane, mandrels, hot head torches, bead release.

name: Books Worn on the Body
description_book: Discussion of books worn on the body, including "girdle books," *cumdachs*, *vade mecums*, and girdle "tabletts". Hands-on Turk's head knot.
description_web: Discussion of books worn on the body throughout SCA period, including the well-known "girdle book," but also lesser-known *cumdachs*, *vade mecums*, and girdle "tabletts". Color handout with photos of extant pieces. We'll learn and practice making the Turk's head knot found on many girdle books. Donations to cover cost of photocopies gladly accepted.

name: Throw Away Your Wristwatch: Basic and Advanced
description_book: Period methods of timekeeping. First 10 minutes teaches several ways to tell time. Last 50 minutes teaches you how to tell time anywhere, anytime.
description_web: Learn period methods of timekeeping to tell time day and night at Pennsic. Basic course (first 10 minutes) teaches several ways to tell time. Advanced course delves into the science and teaches more ways to tell time so you can tell time anywhere, anytime.

name: Copyright Law for Performers
description_book: An attorney demystifies U.S. copyright law: e.g., registration, works-for-hire, contracts, licenses, fair use, and the creative commons.
description_web: An attorney demystifies U.S. copyright law by covering publication, registration, works-for-hire, contracts, licenses, fair use, and the creative commons.

name: A Period Basket. Really.
description_book: This year we will be constructing a triangular seed basket as pictured in several period illuminations.

name: Medicine Before a Provable Germ Theory
description_book: Learn about the correlation between medicine and disease in late-period England.
description_web: People in late-period England viewed medicine in much the same way as people do today: full of complex theories, new and different types of medication, and sub-specialties that may or may not have actually been helpful. While we can either go to the pharmacist or take over-the-counter medicine, they were able to go to the apothecary or make their own. Come learn a quick overview of late-period English medicine.

name: Dressing a Distaff with Flax
description_book: Learn about different styles of distaff and how to use them.
description_web: Flax-spinning cultures developed a variety of distaff styles. I'll show you a few different types and demonstrate how to dress them.

name: "But I Can't Read That!" Using Non-English Sources
description_book: A class on tools for doing research in foreign languages. Focus will be primarily on alphabetic rather than pictographic languages.
description_web: This class will be taught jointly with Lady Judith bas Rabbi Mendel. If you have ever been frustrated by finding that the perfect reference to document your project is in a language you don't know, this class is for you. We'll be talking about using online translation web sites, dictionaries, and many other tools that can help you to understand and use foreign language resources. While we will briefly touch on pictographic languages like Chinese and Japanese, our focus will be on languages written with alphabets.

name: Introduction to Target Archery
description_book: The first steps. No loaner gear; must bring own gear, however multiple people may share, or come as you are to observe and learn.
description_web: A class for those that are interested in target archery but don't know where to get started. Bow safety, line etiquette and the steps to the first shots. This class will be held on the archery range. There is no loaner gear available. You may attend without gear to learn and observe, but if you want to shoot you must bring gear. However, multiple people can share gear, provided it is appropriate in size and weight for all.

name: Fletching - Basic
description_book: Taught by Rask, Viking Archery. How to fletch your arrow. Bring your own feathers & shafts.

name: Family Stick Weaving
description_book: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian.
description_web: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian. Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Fee covers sticks and string; take your work home with you.

name: Reconstructing Archaeological Textiles
description_book: In this hands-on class, students will weave several reconstructions of textiles from archaeological context. Use of loom and yarn included in fee.
description_web: In this hands-on class, students will weave several reconstructions of textiles from archaeological context, illustrating structure, fibers and tools used, and time involved in creating textiles prior to industrialization. Use of loom and all supplies for completing samples included in class fee.
fee_itemization: handouts, supplies for completing woven samples

name: Intro to Egyptian-Style Group Improvisation
description_book: Learn basic Egyptian group improv dance with beledi-style combinations.
description_web: Rajni is a Certified Level 1 Tribal Odyssey dance leader, a group improvisational style developed by Kawakib of Fredericksburg, VA. In the words of Kawakib: “Tribal Odyssey uses natural posture and both sides of the body in combinations based primarily on Egyptian beledi-style movement. It's versatile enough to adapt to any size group.” Class will repeat to allow for several days of practice with a group, and will incorporate recorded Middle Eastern drumming as well as live music/ drumming as available. Learn moves that you and your dance friends can use at Pennsic haflas this year!

name: Medieval Pigments I: Red Ocher
description_book: How to make and use red ocher pigment. Basics of paint-making and pigment safety. Tools and materials provided.
description_web: How to make and using red ocher pigment. Fundamentals of paint-making and pigment safety. Tools and materials provided.
fee_itemization: Fee paper, brushes, use of tools.

name: Where to Find the Fun, Once It Has Been Lost
description_book: Have you lost "the fun"? Changing how you identify yourself is difficult. Come join me in a discussion on ways to get it back.
description_web: There are a great many ways in which you can lose "the fun". You may or may not have had any control over its leaving. Much of the time you are fighting yourself and how you identify with yourself. Come join me in a discussion on ways to get it back.

name: *Rað Rett Runar*: Runes for Your Persona
description_book: Learn about the variations in runic alphabets from Novgorod to Greenland, from 500 to 1400. Find the *futhark* that fits your persona!
description_web: Runic alphabets varied from 500 to 1400, from wood to paper, from Kiev to Greenland. Come learn about the evolution from the 24-rune to 16-rune alphabets, short twig versus long twig, "staveless" variants, and abbreviations.  Leave the *Elder Futhark* behind, and find the *futhark* that fits your persona.

name: Waste-Free Garment Cutting
description_book: Twice the clothes from half the fabric...or at least, better clothes from less fabric. Come prepared to take notes.
description_web: Hand-spun, hand-woven, hand-finished...they never waste a single thread. You don't have to! An overview of the thriftiest cutting and sewing tricks used in the SCA's target centuries. We cover only pre-17th century Western European clothing.

name: Lucet: Beyond Square Cord
description_book: You can make good square cord; what's next? Flat and multi-color cords. Bring your lucet. (We can slip a cord off and put it back on after class.)
description_web: You’re comfortable making square cord; what's next? We'll work on flat and multi-color cords. Please bring your lucet. We'll also demonstrate how to slip a cord off, and put it back on after class.
fee_itemization: (3) colors of floss on cards, and handout

name: Wool Spinning with Spindle Stick and Distaff
description_book: Wool spinning using a long spindle stick (provided) rotated in the palm of the hand. Distaff mounting technique of wool fiber included.
description_web: The long spindle stick, rotated when held in the palm, is probably a very ancient technique which has survived in Portugal and Eastern Europe up to modern times. The spindle stick, approx 18-19 inches long, is tapered at both ends. It is held horizontally and the wool fiber is twisted off one end, using a distaff to hold the fibers. The yarn created is wound around the center of the spindle stick. A limited number of spindle sticks and simple distaffs will be available. Students should wear a belt.
fee_itemization:
copy cost for paper printing.
Cost of wood and shaping for spindles.

name: Beginning Bobbin Lace
description_book: Three-day class for a total of 9 hours. Learn the basic movements and make a basic project. Start a period pattern.
description_web: This is a three-day class for a total of 9 hours of bobbin lace! First Day: Students will learn the basic movements of bobbin lace and begin a project. Second Day: Students will finish the project and learn some simple grounds. Third Day: Students will begin a period pattern from *The Nuew Modelbuch*.
fee_itemization: $30 – One-time fee for all three days. Includes pillow with cover, bobbin holder, 10 pair of bobbins, pins, handout, patterns

name: Creating a Sampler of Medieval Pigments
description_book: Try out historical pigments by creating a sampler of the many colors available.
description_web: Try out historical pigments by creating a sampler of the many colors available.

name: Cadels for the Intermediate Calligrapher
description_book: Learn how to make a cadel using your own calligraphy supplies. Students should have a working knowledge of gothic and secretary hands.
description_web: Cadels, also called cadeaux, are those beautiful built-up decorative letters found in numerous sources (both illuminated manuscripts and in documents) across later periods and in different western cultures. This class will cover a hands-on lesson in creating a single cadel, with discussion on sources and techniques. Experience in gothic and secretary or batarde hands are required. Some materials may be available, but students should bring their own supplies and tools, including paper.

name: Basic Origami: Exploring the Blintz Fold
description_book: Folding as many models as time permits from this simple yet versatile base.

name: Before the Book Is Bound
description_book: A history of European printing.
description_web: A history of European woodblock and movable-type printing, including the technological and societal changes that made printing possible and necessary.

name: Advanced Fletching
description_book: Taught by Master Geraint Graeme de Menteith. Period cutting, wrapping, etc. Bring your own fletches. Some provided.

name: Combat Photography
description_book: Learn the secrets of capturing battlefield movements with even a basic camera. Bring your camera, we will spend part of the class at the list field.
description_web: Learn the secrets of capturing battlefield movements with even a basic camera. Bring your camera, we will spend part of the class at the list field. These techniques work for photographing dancers, processions and other action shots.

name: Joy and Jealousy
description_book: We'll run through two Italian pieces, *Bizzaria D'Amore* and *Gelosia*.
description_web: We'll run through two Italian pieces, *Bizzaria D'Amore* and *Gelosia*.

name: Introduction to *Go*
description_book: A basic introduction to the Japanese game of *Go*.
description_web: A basic introduction to the Japanese game of *Go*.

name: The Anatomy of a Double Bellows
description_book: Discuss the tricks and traps of making your own set of blacksmith double bellows from start to finish while avoiding costly mistakes.
description_web: This class will cover the tricks and traps of making your own set of blacksmith double bellows from start to finish while avoiding costly mistakes. I have made several bellows over the years and my goal is to help others learn from my experience. This class will cover common design constraints and how those define the rest of the design.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching.
description_web: During this ten-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and mundanely. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: Known World Choir Rehearsal
description_book: Join the oldest Pennsic Choir as we rehearse in preparation for a concert Aug 1. We will perform some music in tribute to Owain Phyfe.
description_web: The Known World Choir, along with the Children's and Youth Choirs, the Debatable Choir, Chorulus Pennsicus, and other guests will present a concert of medieval and Renaissance choral literature. As part of their repertoire, the Known World Choir will perform some songs in tribute to Owain Phyfe.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes & hat; leave from Univ. Point. **We are seeking teachers to help us continue this Pennsic tradition!**
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. **We are seeking teachers to help us continue this tradition, one of Pennsic's two longest-running classes!**

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day.
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. 
Day 1- Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum
Day 2- Chiftitelli, Masmoudi
Day 3- Ayub, Malfouf
Day 4- Kashlimah and other strange stuff

name: So You Want to Be a (Book) Herald? Part I – Intro
description_book: An introduction to book heraldry. Covers the registration process, the College of Arms, available resources, and other topics.
description_web: Interested in heraldry? Want to be involved with device or name submissions? This three-part class introduces the basics of book heraldry for the non-(book) herald. Part I covers the registration process, the organization of the College of Arms, the available resources, and other general topics. The three parts of the course are not prerequisites for each other.

name: Ships in the SCA Period: A Chronological Overview
description_book: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.
description_web: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.

name: Glass Beads for Teens Plus
description_book: Anyone can learn how to create a glass bead. Teens 14 and older are welcome. Parent *must* accompany their teen.
description_web: Come learn how to create a glass bead. Teens 14 and older are welcome. Parent or guardian *must* accompany their teen to the class. Students will get to keep what they make. Open to everyone, but this class will be geared towards teenagers.

name: Fruit dishes from *Scappi*
description_book: This class covers the use of fruit in 16th-century Italian menus and recipes from *Scappi*, the ultimate 16th-century Italian cookbook.
description_web: Over the years I have taught salads, vegetables, meats, fish, pastries, and more from *Scappi* but never fruit. In this class we will cover the role of fruit in the menus given by *Scappi* and give a few of the fruit recipes from all chapters.

name: Renaissance Musical Instruments
description_book: Intro to musical instruments played in Renaissance Europe, illustrated by woodcuts and recordings. First session: winds. Second session: strings.
description_web: We will go on a tour of the instruments played in late Renaissance Europe, illustrated by woodcuts from Praetorius' *Syntagma Musicum* (1614-1620), and listen to many examples. The first session will focus on wind instruments and the second session will focus on stringed instruments.

name: Viking Navigation
description_book: This class will present at least two of the methods of direction-finding seen in the Viking TV series.
description_web: The methods of navigation employed by the Viking navigators are currently unverifiable by archeological evidence. However, the search for answers goes on. This class will present the arguments for at least two methods of direction-finding by experts in the field. The published findings of Soren Thirslund from the Danish National Maritime Museum and Leif Karlsen, a retired merchant marine navigator will be presented. Both of these gentlemen’s published findings are internationally recognized and available from the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde Denmark. Hands-on demonstrations and primary source documentation of these authors’ navigation theories.

name: A Tutorial for Thread-Covered Buttons
description_book: Buttons are a great, easy way to dress up or dress down your garb. Come learn a few different versions of period thread-covered buttons. Hands-on.

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Performing Arts Pavilion on Thursday afternoon of War Week. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.”

name: Italian Dance for ECD Feet: *Contrapasso en Due*
description_book: Don't let Italian dances intimidate you! Take a chance with love and learn Caroso's *Contrapasso en Due* with the English Country dancer in mind.
description_web: Italian dances can often seem quite intimidating for dancers just getting steady on their English Country feet. Caroso's *Contrapasso en Due* is a simple Italian dance for couples that translates easily into ECD terminology. For as many couples as will.

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. No fee. String provided.

name: Song of the Valkyrie
description_book: A look at the *Darradarljod*, a Norse poem which compares battle to weaving; includes an account of the Battle of Clontarf (north of Dublin-1014 CE).
description_web: A look at the *Darradarljod*, a Norse poem which compares battle to weaving; including an account of the Battle of Clontarf (north of Dublin - 1014 CE).

name: Photographers' Roundtable
description_book: Want to take better SCA photos? Want to talk shop with other photographers? Come hang out for a chat. No topic too big, no camera too small.

name: Directing Elizabethan Plays
description_book: Things to consider when directing Elizabethan plays, such as verse, prose, blocking, the lack of a 4th wall, and a respectfully irreverent attitude.
description_web: Things to consider when directing Elizabethan plays, such as verse, prose, blocking, the lack of a 4th wall, and a respectfully irreverent attitude.

name: Beginning Bead Weaving on a Rigid Heddle Loom
description_book: Warping of the bead weaving loom, technique of weaving beads, creating a pattern and adapting pre-printed patterns for bead weaving.
description_web: We will discuss the warping of the bead weaving loom, technique of weaving beads, creating a pattern and adapting pre-printed patterns for bead weaving. Come share your projects, ideas & questions.

name: Divination: Palm and Face Reading
description_book: From the western system of palm reading to eastern face reading, we will teach you divination using signs and portents on the human body.
description_web: From the western system of palm reading to eastern face reading, we will teach you divination using signs and portents on the human body. Palm reading will be hand-on. Face reading will be face-to-face. Because of arbitrary restrictions imposed by Pennsic University, we regret that we will not demonstrate the reading of human livers and entrails.

name: Improv Theater Games for Improving Your Character
description_book: Theater games for learning improvisation. Good for commedia, theater, and living in persona.
description_web: Come learn and play theater games focused on the art of improvisation. Skills learned here can be used to improve any kind of performance including the portrayal of your persona in the SCA. Come practice here for auditions for "Who's Line Doth It Be Anyway" on Monday! Instructors will be channeling Midair MacCormaic.

name: How to Be an Archery Marshal
description_book: Taught by Master Geraint Graeme de Menteith, KDEM Midrealm. Inspection, reporting, etc. Geared to Midrealm.

name: Beginning and Intermediate English Country Dance
description_book: No clue? No partner? No problem; this class is taught by the Saltatoris Dance Guild so everyone is guaranteed a partner for one-on-one instruction!
description_web: Learn (or just practice) beginning (first hour) and intermediate (second hour) English Country dance. Don't have a clue? Don't have a partner? Not a problem; this class is taught by the Saltatoris Dance Guild so everyone is guaranteed a partner for one-on-one instruction!

name: A Good Quill or Reed Is a Good Start
description_book: Turn wing feathers of duck or goose, or a piece of reed or locally-grown bamboo into the perfect pen - **for your hand**. Bring a knife if you can.
description_web: Usual and some unusual ways to turn fowl feather or weedy reed into a work of art itself - the first tool of the writer's trade that can aid your period writing skills,  or leave you with a bad case of Monk's Cramp. Then on to other tools of the trade as necessary to a herald, copyist or rubricator as a good brush is to a painter, that can either hinder or help a task difficult enough in the first place. While even the youngest SCAdian probably knows how to handle a knife, if you're 12 of younger, please bring a parent. Inks from oak gall to pomegranate available to try. We try to share our knives, but if you have anything from a period pen knife to a #5 X-Acto, please bring it along. Quills available for $1 each; possibly some more exotic materials available
fee_itemization: Free if you have a fowl primary feather or reed, $1/feather, possibly 50 cents bamboo. We'll have paper and ink to try out your work.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* & Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Known World Children's Choir
description_book: The Known World Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.
description_web: The Known World Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.

name: Hafla Songs for All Instruments by Lady Melissa!
description_book: New songs for haflas! Bring your drum, zills, band or orchestra instruments! Sheet music available. *Jemillah, Gul Ali, Al Ataba, Habibi Nourelain*.
description_web: New songs for haflas! *Jemillah* (Armenian), *Gul Ali* (Turkish 9/8), *Habibi Nour El Ain* (Arabic), and *Al Ataba Gazaz* (Arabic). Bring your drum, zills, band or orchestra instruments! Sheet music available to purchase. Let's make beautiful Middle Eastern music together.
fee_itemization: Sheet music and drum rhythm sheets

name: Cooking Over a Campfire 201
description_book: Follow up to Cooking Over a Campfire 101: The Practical. Learn to work with fire and create a dish to share.
description_web: This class will be more comprehensive than 101, building on the principles established there. We will be cooking over various forms of fire using some pots and cookware provided. This class is practical and the fruits of our learning will be shared around. Minors welcome with a participating adult. If interested, we can show a limited number of people how to do certain things in their own cookware after the class. After-class limited to 6 participants.

name: *Saidi* Steps and Style with Samira
description_book: Learn the history of how *saidi* came into women's dance in Egypt. Learn the rhythm and steps, as well as cane work! Exciting, authentic and fun!
description_web: Learn the history of how *saidi* came into women's dance in Egypt. Learn the rhythm and steps, as well as cane work! Exciting, authentic and fun! *Saidi* is flirty and fun, but originated with a martial art. Samira combines her Oriental experience with folklore work in this step- and combination-based workshop. Includes rhythm dissection, Samira’s tutorial on how to understand and find the meter and rhythm, and Samira’s crossover coaching (how to use this musicality in different styles of the belly dance tree).

name: *Monsho*: Samurai Banners
description_book: An introduction to the history, function, aesthetics, and display of Japanese heraldry.
description_web: An illustrated introduction to the history, function, aesthetics, and display of Japanese heraldry. If time permits, we will also consider court procedure.

name: Pennsic Runestone Memorial Discussion
description_book: A discussion of the Pennsic Runestone Memorial Community Project - the concept, design, location and efforts needed to bring this project to light.
description_web: A discussion of the Pennsic Runestone Community Project - We will be discussing the concept behind this 9-ton memorial stone that will be carved by you. Most importantly, we will be discussing the funds and what all is needed to bring this project to completion. Those interested in the project as a curiosity are welcome as well as volunteers, donors and anyone who feels moved to be involved. We will discuss the design and the location of this memorial and the park that will evolve around it for memorial services, contemplation or a quiet read.  At the end of the discussion we will take a walk up to the area that has been granted us by the Coopers to carve and erect this memorial stone.

name: Making "Rising Sun" Viking *Murrini*
description_book: Learn  to make the "rising sun"-style *murrini* found on many Norse beads. Ages 12+. Intermediate level class. No open-toed shoes.
description_web: Learn  to make the "rising sun"-style *murrini* found on many Norse beads, with hands-on glass work. Make a cane of *murrini* you will take with you to use on your own bead creations. This is an intermediate level class, so some lampworking experience is necessary. Sleeves must be tight or tied up, no open-toed shoes, and hair must be short or tied back; natural fiber clothing recommended.

name: Leather Corners for Wooden Book Covers
description_book: Students will learn how to make the four most common corners using leather on wooden book covers, and make samples.
description_web: Students will learn how to make the four most common corners using leather on wooden book covers. Each student will make four sample corners. All tools will be loaned by instructor. This is a hands-on class.
fee_itemization: Fee covers both a handout and the wood, leather, thread to make the samples.

name: Practicing Storytelling in the SCA
description_book: Get feedback on your storytelling. Meant mainly for those who took the companion class, "Storytelling in the SCA". Stories limited to five minutes.
description_web: Get feedback on your storytelling. Meant mainly for those who took the companion class, "Storytelling in the SCA", but all are welcome. Stories are limited to five minutes.

name: Youth Combat Roundtable
description_book: A roundtable discussion focusing on ways to promote youth combat. Come for ideas on how to start a local program or to share your experiences.
description_web: A roundtable discussion focusing on ways to promote youth combat. Come for ideas on how to start a local program or to share your experiences of what worked, or didn't, for you.

name: *Kosode* Construction
description_book: An essential garment in every *nihonjin* wardrobe! We’ll discuss construction of this top, based on a museum example from the *Muromachi* period.
description_web: An essential garment in every *nihonjin* wardrobe! We’ll discuss construction of this top, based on a museum example from the *Muromachi* period. The predecessor to the kimono, the *kosode* was worn by both men and women throughout most of Japanese history. A visual, step-by-step example of its construction will be presented during the first hour. Extra time is allotted for consultations. Please bring along your own materials if you would like assistance getting your pattern started. Approximately 4-6 yards (45”-wide minimum) of fabric will be needed, depending on your height, size and fabric pattern. Contact me, if you have any questions at yamamura.kitsune@gmail.com.

name: Arthurian Legends 101
description_book: An overview of the stories and legends of King Arthur and his court in England during the Middle Ages.

name: Fight with All Your Strength: Conditioning
description_book: Concepts for developing a cardiovascular endurance and conditioning program to help you fight longer. The class will cover a wide variety of tools.
description_web: This class presents the fundamental elements of developing a cardiovascular endurance and conditioning program to help you fight longer. Also covers a wide variety of conditioning tools. A limited number of participants will also be able to get hands-on instruction. Learn more at http://fightwithallyourstrength.blogspot.com/

name: *Shogi* for Beginners (Japanese Chess)
description_book: A 90-minute class in how to play *Shogi*, or Japanese Chess. History, rules, strategy and tactics; time left over for students to play afterwards.
description_web: A 90-minute class in how to play *Shogi*, or Japanese Chess. History, rules, strategy and tactics; time left over for students to play afterwards.

name: The 4th Annual Inkmaking Class & Get-Together
description_book: Anyone interested in ink-making, beginner to expert, come learn and pass on advice, including a new redaction of a 10th-C clear copper green ink.
description_web: It's ... green - or I'm hoping it is - The 4th annual class & get-together on period ink making, including my redaction of a 10th-C or so clear green ink recipe (and a half-dozen other 'new' Copper Greens), along with the usual oak gall, pomegranate, and carbon-based inks. All ink-makers are invited to share their methods (and their own inks) for making any art laid down with a pen. Please contact me in advance, if possible, if you too have something unique.

name: Family Spool Knitting
description_book: Family-oriented spool knitting. Youth welcome with parent or guardian.
description_web: Family-oriented spool knitting. Cord braiding on a spool. Make a basic round cord. Youth welcome with parent or guardian. Fee covers spool and string; take your work home with you.

name: Known World Youth Choir
description_book: The Known World Youth Choir is open to youth age 12-18 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.
description_web: The Known World Youth Choir is open to youth age 12-18 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Court for Nobles and Their Heralds
description_book: A discussion about how to put together Court when the nobles, herald, or both are new to it. Nobles are encouraged to bring their herald with them.
description_web: A discussion about how to put together Court when the nobles, the herald, or both are new to it. We'll talk about how to create smooth flow and good theatre for the people watching in the audience and discuss options for the tone of Court, preparing the docket with your herald beforehand, and adjusting to the inevitable changes and surprises that happen in the middle. Nobles are encouraged to bring their herald with them, if possible.

name: Egyptian Jews under Fatimid Rule
description_book: An analysis of the life of Egyptian Jews under Muslim and Fatimid rule. The laws in place to protect the Jews and what it meant to be *dhimmi*.
description_web: An analysis of the life of Egyptian Jews under Muslim and Fatimid rule. The laws in place to protect the Jews and what it meant to be *dhimmi*. Focus of time is from 641 to 1095.

name: Fun with Body Parts II: Pilgrimage
description_book: Need the personal intervention of a saint? Pay him or her a visit! An irreverent look at the hundreds of thousands who left home on pilgrimage.
description_web: Need the personal intervention of a saint? Pay him or her a visit! An irreverent look at the hundreds of thousands who left home on pilgrimage: who went, why, and where. Taught by someone who has been to the Big Three: Compostela, Rome, Jerusalem.

name: Boreal Master Symposium
description_book: Presentation of papers and discussions of the totally unknown Norse poet called the Boreal Master.
description_web: Presentation of papers and discussions of the totally unknown Norse poet called the Boreal Master.

name: Edge Your Veil
description_book: Veil edges from the simple rolled edge to ruffles and beads. Learn some "how-tos". Practice rolled edges on a cup cover.
description_web: Veils were on almost every woman's head in period and they had a variety of different edges. From a simple rolled edge, we will do the "perfect rolled hem" and explore a variety of other, more complicated edges. Practice rolled edges on a cup cover.
fee_itemization: Kit to include silk or linen, needle,  thread and beads

name: Circa 1200
description_book: Glimpse the realities of daily life for *most* of the folk who lived in medieval England around the year 1200.
description_web: Meet Gawaine and Hedwiga, free peasants living in rural Yorkshire, England. Visit the "archeological evidence" of their home and belongings and converse with them about their hopes, dreams, and fears. This presentation is designed for school children and adults. You'll only need to bring your imagination.

name: Your Good First Bow
description_book: Taught by Forester Grey. How and what to look for in your bow. Bring your own bows.

name: German Combatives: Fundamentals
description_book: Traditional German martial arts share a common vocabulary and set of principles, which we'll explore in this hands-on class. Wear comfortable clothes.
description_web: Traditional German martial arts share a common vocabulary and set of principles, which we'll explore in this hands-on class. Wear comfortable clothes.  Bring training weapons, if you have them -- from knives to staves, we can work with it.

name: Bellatrix Techniques
description_book: Fundamental & advanced Bellatrix techniques of armored sword and shield fighting. Unarmored class appropriate for all levels of proficiency.
description_web:
This class teaches fundamental and advanced techniques of the Bellatrix system of armored sword and shield fighting. It is appropriate for all levels of proficiency. Technique is one of the main pillars of successful fighting. No matter what your level of proficiency, efficient and effective technique will help you to improve your game, and avoid injury through faulty bio-mechanics.
The class is taught unarmored. Students will need a sword and preferably a shield, or something similar. Neither need to be SCA legal, but must be safe.

name: Beginner Dance: Absolute Beginner Dance
description_book: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We'll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the ball.
description_web: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We'll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the ball. Dances covered may include *Lorayne Alman, Sellinger's Round*, and *Upon a Summer's Day*.

name: Pennsic Fools' Parade
description_book: The long-standing Pennsic tradition continues! Bring noise makers and bright clothes! Great for families! Meet at Bath House next to Cooper's store.
description_web: The long-standing Pennsic tradition continues! Open to any and all Pennsic campers! Adults, teens, and kids, come romp around the marketplace with fools from around the Knowne World! Bring your toys, noise makers, juggling balls, puppets, kazoos, and wear your brightest clothing!  Kids under 16 must bring a responsible adult. (This is a great activity for families!) We will meet at the Bath House next to the Cooper's store. All fools must attend the safety briefing 15 minutes before parade start. Parade lasts about 45 minutes. Please contact the Fool In Charge (Sophia the Orange) if you would like to arrange for the parade to visit your encampment or event.

name: Fun and Funky – Finger Cymbals!
description_book: Every dancer must learn finger cymbals! Bring your own if you have them and learn fantastic sounds, concepts and authentic patterns along with steps.
description_web: Every dancer must learn finger cymbals! Samira teaches primarily *sagat*, which are the Arabic version of zills. Bring your zills or *sagat* and learn fantastic sounds, concepts and patterns to go with movements. See, hear and feel the differences between zills and *sagat*; build confidence and go from feeling fumbling to fabulous while learning great, authentic combinations.

name: *Chorulus Pennsicus*
description_book: A limited voice choir by audition only that will rehearse and perform at War. Attend first session if interested. Listeners are welcome.
description_web: A limited voice choir by audition only that will rehearse and perform at War. Attend first session if interested. Listeners are welcome. Music will be available in advance from the KWChoir yahoo group's page.

name: *Riq* Curious?
description_book: The *riq* (Middle Eastern tambourine) is a versatile instrument and super portable! This class will show the basics for first-timers.
description_web: The *riq* (Middle Eastern tambourine) is a versatile instrument and super portable! This class will show the basics for first-timers. Any tambourine that has jingles and a skin on it will work to get started.

name: Armory Consultation: How to Consult Effectively
description_book: A look at the role of the herald in the process of armory consultations, methods for fulfilling it effectively, and other things to keep in mind.

name: Give Us Your Hand... SMACK
description_book: The hand-kissing class: the history, anatomy, and how to kiss a hand and how not. Some other good things to know about in these current Middle Ages.
description_web: An examination of the fine art of hand-kissing, its history and anatomy, instruction on how to kiss a hand and how to get your hand kissed or not, and a few other good things to know about it. Just to help you have fun in these current Middle Ages.

name: The London Plague of 1603
description_book: In 1603, the plague swept through London killing nearly a quarter of the population. Learn how it spread, why, and popular cures of the time.
description_web: In 1603, the plague swept through London killing nearly a quarter of the population. Learn how it spread, why, and popular cures of the time. This class is not appropriate for children below the age of 14.

name: Basic Shaping of Glass Beads
description_book: How to shape lamp work glass beads for historic shapes. Must have taken basic class.
description_web: How to shape lamp work glass beads for historic shapes. Must have taken basic class.

name: First Feast
description_book: Learn how to plan, schedule, and cook SCA period-style feasts.
description_web: Learn the process of planning, scheduling, and preparing SCA period-style feasts. Hand-out includes menu, recipes, and schedule for preparing SCA period dishes for 8 in your home.

name: 10th-Century York Needle-Binding Stitch
description_book: Needle-binding stitch from an extant example. A hands-on class; material will be available for loan and purchase; feel free to bring your own.
description_web: Another historical needle-binding stitch, this time from York. Yarn and handout are free. Handouts for other stitches will be available, too.
fee_itemization: If you keep the needle it is $5, but borrowing one for the class is free.

name: Prick-and-Pounce: Period Embroidery Transfer
description_book: Try a period embroidery transfer method that’s still in use today. Bring white fabric in a hoop to transfer a design. Limited kits available.
description_web: Try a period embroidery transfer method that’s still in use today. Bring white fabric in a hoop to transfer a design.
fee_itemization:
Archival pen: 2.50
pounce: 1
needle: 0.3
felt: 0.25
cork handle: free
Pattern on paper: 0.05
cork mat: 0.70

name: Developing Your Japanese Persona
description_book: Designed to take an individual through the process of building and fully developing any Japanese persona.
description_web: Designed to take an individual through the process of building and fully developing any Japanese persona. Focusing on thinking through back story to add realism to one's SCA identity. Good for newcomers and old hands alike.

name: Don’t Shave a Saxon, and Other Early Period Laws
description_book: Laws reveal many of a culture’s daily problems and priorities. Let's see what the Anglo Saxons, Salian Franks, Lombards, and Irish called important.
description_web: Most laws are retroactive and a reflection of the problems facing a community. As the law of the Roman Empire retreated, the tribal laws of the Anglo Saxons, Salian Franks, and Lombards surfaced, each with their own flavors and foci.
