How they identified their problems, and how they chose to correct them tell us a lot about the daily life of the people in those communities. The Irish, in contrast, never felt the direct influence of the *Lex Romana*, and that also shows an effect.

name: Beginner Dance: Bransles
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then introduce you to fun bransles from 16th-C France.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then introduce you to fun bransles from 16th-C France.

name: Board Games
description_book: This class will review board games previously taught and provide opportunities to practice with a knowledgeable instructor's assistance.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.

name: Beyond Lucet Basics
description_book: Variations, Loops, and Monkey Wrenches.
description_web: Starts with a basic refresher class for everyone. We then proceed to Variations, Loops, and Monkey Wrenches. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. String provided.

name: Recorder Jam Session
description_book: Do you play the recorder? Would you like to play with others in a group setting? Read through music? Come join us. All ages welcome.
description_web: Do you play the recorder? Would you like to play with others in a group setting? Read through Renaissance literature? Come join us. In the 90-minute session we will start with beginner/easy reading and then move towards harder music. If you're a youth player, then come at the beginning. If you're more advanced, then come halfway through. Bring your instrument or use one of ours.
fee_itemization: There will be soprano recorders available at $6.00 each.

name: How to Write a Traditional Commedia dell'Arte Play
description_book: Traditional *commedia* didn't use scripts but brief outline summaries called scenarios. Learn the general plot lines and how you can write them.
description_web: *Commedia* has been called "the actor's theatre" because of its improvisation and lack of scripts. But it's also "the writer's theatre". Learn about the brief outline summaries of the plot called scenarios, the general structure of a typical plot and how it can be molded into new forms, and how to write a brand new 16th-century play yourself! We'll also cover some of the more obscure plots from Period troupes!

name: Intermediate Heraldic Research Roundtable
description_book: Take your heraldic research to the next level. Or come to share your favorite sources and tricks. Intended for heralds of all levels.
description_web: Where do you go when the usual sources just don't have what you need? Have skills you'd like to pass on to newer heralds? Come share your favorite sources and research tips in a roundtable format. Intended for heralds of all experience levels. Handout provided.

name: Viking Age Clothing: The Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of the major finds of Viking Age clothing, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make accurate reproductions. 45-page handout.
description_web: A brief survey of the major finds of Viking Age clothing, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make reasonably accurate reproductions. We will cover Thorsbjerg, Mammen, Viborg, Damendorf, Birka, Eura, and other finds. 45-page handout is available.

name: Law and Order: Rome
description_book: Overview of the law and legal system in the Roman Empire.

name: Beyond the HerbWife: Fantasy, History & Herbalists
description_book: Lecture/discussion attempting to separate fact from fiction in our historical idea of herbalists and herb use pre-1650.
description_web: Our modern concept of the role of herbs and herbalists in pre-1650 Europe is a mishmash of fact, fiction, misunderstanding and propaganda. We'll try to identify the most controversial ideas on herbs, women, witches and medical treatment, and give a more balanced, if less satisfying, picture of SCA-period herbalism.

name: Bardic Collegium Practicum
description_book: Students will present a short piece for senior bards who will critique their performance. **Pre-registration is required.**
description_web: Students (of any experience level) will present a short piece for senior bards who will critique their performance. **Pre-registration is required." For more details, see the website: http://www.no-gorsedd.com/collegium/

name: Inter-Kingdom Brewers Guild Competition
description_book: Brewers and vintners: Have your beverages evaluated by experts from across the Known World. Up to two entries per category. Over 21 only.
description_web: An opportunity for brewers and vintners to have their beverages evaluated by experts from across the Known World. Up to two entries per category (wine/mead, beer, cordials/others) per participant. IKBG masters are asked to help judge. Entrants are responsible for the temperature/condition of their beverage(s) as it may be some time before a particular beverage is judged. Documentation is encouraged. Over 21 only.

name: IKBG Roundtable
description_book: This roundtable is designed to serve as both a place to discuss period beverages as well as hang out for the IKBG. Over 21, please.
description_web: This roundtable is designed to serve as both a place to discuss period beverages as well as hang out till your beverage is called to be judged with the IKBG and is being held in conjunction with the IKBG. All entrants are asked to wait in this area and someone will come call you when your entry is ready to be judged. Please bring something to do/drink/discuss until your entry is called. Over 21, please.

name: Archery Marshals' Meeting
description_book: For MITs and Archery Marshals. Rules of the Pennsic Ranges.

name: Fight with All Your Strength: Strength & Power
description_book: Intermediate concepts in weightlifting for the development of fighting specific power. Barbell exercises are introduced for max force and power.
description_web: This class presents more advanced concepts in weightlifting for the development of fighting specific power. Barbell exercises are introduced as a means of developing maximum force and power. A limited number of participants will also be able to get hands-on instruction. Learn more at http://fightwithallyourstrength.blogspot.com/

name: Middle Eastern Music and Dance
description_book: A time for people of all skill levels to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. All instruments are welcome, and loaner drums are available!
description_web: A time for people interested in Middle Eastern music and dance to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. We will be providing instruction appropriate to the interest of the attendees, from beginning Middle Eastern drum and belly dance to teaching songs in which everyone can participate. All skill levels and instruments are welcome, and drums are available for borrowing!

name: Low, Slow and Flirtatious: *Lauro*
description_book: *Lauro*: a flirtatious dance of the 15th century written by Lorenzo de' Medici. Footwork to be taught, historical-cultural tidbits added for flavor.

name: Andalusian *Muwashahat*
description_book: Learn to sing and/or play some *muwashahat*. The *muwasha* is a form of classical Arabic poetry set to music, developed in Andalusian Spain.
description_web:
Learn to sing and/or play some *muwashahat*. The *muwasha* is a form of classical Arabic poetry set to music, developed in Andalusian Spain, and still performed today in North Africa and the Levant. We will cover all aspects of the songs, including lyrics, pronunciation, meaning, melody and rhythm. Open to singers, melody musicians and drummers who understand volume control.  
Quarter-tone alert: some of the songs will include quarter-tones. In order to be able to play these tunes, you will need to have an instrument capable of playing quarter-tones, such as *oud*, violin, *ney*, or the vocal cords you were born with.

name: Dumbek Rhythm Changes
description_book: This class will focus on changing from one common rhythm to another.  Handouts will be supplied.
description_web: This class will focus on changing from one common rhythm to another.  Handouts will be supplied.

name: Pennsic Dance Band Practice
description_book: Attention, musicians: Come learn the tunes for the Grand Ball at Pennsic! Music will be provided. All instruments and skill levels are welcome.
description_web: The Grand Ball at Pennsic needs musicians! Come learn the tunes for the dances that will be in the ball. Music will be provided. Players of all instruments at any skill level are welcome.

name: The Life of a Trade Bead
description_book: Discussion of the creation of a trade bead, where it may have traveled, and what it may have been used for. Handout supplied.

name: Known World Beekeepers Gathering
description_book: Join fellow beekeepers to swap tips and tales from the field. Please bring a sample of your own honey to share.

name: When in Eastern Rome: Byzantine Dress
description_book: The basics of constructing and wearing Byzantine clothing.
description_web: Interested in Byzantine clothing and intimidated by the wacky names and intense embellishment? Don't be. Come down and learn the different between a superhumeral and an ecclesiastical pallium while some of Europe's most beautiful and complicated clothing is demystified. Special emphasis will be on a tunic in the Metropolitan Museum of Art collection.

name: Start a Fire Like a Moderately Intelligent Saxon
description_book: Learn how to start a fire like Saxons, Vikings, and everyone else in the Middle Ages using flint and steel. This is a hands-on class.
description_web: Learn how to start a fire like Saxons, Vikings, and everyone else in the Middle Ages using flint and steel. This is a hands-on class.

name: Perfume in History
description_book: The impact of fragrance in culture and chemistry, plus technological advancements from the dawn of history through the ages.
description_web: The impact of fragrance in culture and chemistry, plus technological advancements from the dawn of history through the ages.

name: Best Scribal Books for Your Bucks
description_book: Limited resources? Learn tips to build your scribal library; then, *Let's go shopping*! Take a guided tour of the best scribal books for sale on site.
description_web: Limited resources? Find out tips for building your own scribal library: what to look for in a great book -- and what to avoid! Then, *Let's go shopping*! Instructor will take you on an (optional) guided tour of the best calligraphy and illumination books available in the marketplace.

name: 14th-Century Alliterative Poetry
description_book: Join the "Alliterative Revival"! Learn about the Alliterative Long Line - a high medieval poetic style with its roots in Anglo Saxon poetry.
description_web: Chaucer wasn’t the only game in town for poetry in the 14th century. Join the "Alliterative Revival"! The “Alliterative Long Line” was a poetry style evocative of Anglo-Saxon verse, but with the distinctive imagery of the 14th century. We will discuss how to create the alliterative long line that appears in many poems from this period, as well as how to blend it with rhyming poetry such as in “Sir Gawain and the Green Knight”.

name: *Renga*: Linked Poetry, Part 1
description_book: Part 1: A survey on the history and creation of the traditional Japanese poetic form.
description_web: Part 1: A survey on the history and creation of the traditional Japanese poetic form.

name: German Combatives: *Fühlung*
description_book: One of the most important ideas in traditional German martial arts: feeling precedes action. Bring a weapon. Develop this vital fighting skill.
description_web: One of the most important ideas in traditional German martial arts: feeling precedes action. Bring a weapon. Develop this vital fighting skill.

name: Meet-the-Dance-Faculty Social
description_book: Come meet the people who make the Pennsic School of European Dance happen! Open to all. Light refreshments will be provided & a group picture taken.
description_web: Come meet the people who make the Pennsic School of European Dance happen! This event is open for all students and dancers to meet this year's faculty and staff, and is another social event for our faculty and experienced dancers. We encourage all to attend. Light refreshments will be provided and a group picture of staff and teachers will be taken.

name: Kumihimo Basics
description_book: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk & string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Beyond *Dum Tek Ka*: Advanced Drumming Techniques
description_book: Whether a *doumbek* cowboy, *djembe* jammer, or a casual musician, there's something in this class for you. Learn more than the traditional sounds.
description_web: Sounds to be covered include slides, snaps, bends, kicks, and more. This is for any kind of drum but applies mostly to *doumbeks* and *djembes*. This class is for all skill levels; bring a drum and enjoy.

name: Glass Fusing for Total Beginners
description_book: An introduction to glass fusing, including some vocabulary associated with the art. Students will assemble a small piece to be fused on site.
description_web: This class, which covers introductory glass fusing, is very, very basic. It is geared towards total beginners with no glass experience. Students will learn basic terminology as well as assemble a small piece to be fused on site.
fee_itemization: covers the cost of the glass used

name: Russian Hats and Headdresses
description_book: A look at the different types of hats seen in Russia in SCA period, including construction techniques in period, and how to recreate them.
description_web: Come and learn about the wide variety of elaborate hats worn by both women and men in Russia during the medieval era. We'll look at the different styles and terminology, plus discuss construction techniques in period, and how to recreate these pieces.

name: Sultan's *Pachisi*: Like Human Chess but Cooler
description_book: Human Parcheesi - with a twist. We need 4 guys who want to best each other, a herald-ish-voiced person, a scorekeeper, and 16 awesome belly dancers.
description_web:
*Pachisi*, referred to as the Royal Game of India, was played with humans - generally the women of the harem - as the pieces. We've all seen human chess; this version is *guaranteed* to be more active for participants and audience members alike. Sixteen belly dancers, 4 teams of 4, are the game pieces, using dance moves *randomly selected* to advance. Dancers should have several years' experience and be comfortable with improv performance. Please state red, yellow, green, or blue team and be prepared to wear that color. Also needed are 4 witty 'players' (guys or girls) wearing one of the four colors listed above. Also needed, 1 scorekeeper/die-roller and 1 heraldic-voiced person wearing different colors.
Basics: Players roll, dancers move like the pieces would. 
Extras: Scorekeeper rolls giant die for each move; each side has a dance move. Dancer advances using that step. Two dice can be rolled for extra points; this makes a layered move the dancer uses to advance. 
Those wishing to participate: please contact Shaheen ASAP at Shaheen@FataMorganaBellydance.com. Sign-up will be available at University Point until 25 July if any spots are left.

name: FAP: Italian Sword and Buckler without Tears
description_book: Freelance Academy Press presents a short guide to basic attacks and defenses of Bolognese swordsmanship.
description_web: Freelance Academy Press presents a short and sweet guide to basic attacks and defenses of Bolognese swordsmanship. Equipment: One-handed sword, buckler. Head protection and leather gloves preferred.

name: Ball Prep
description_book: Want to dance at the ball, but have no or little idea how? This is the class for you! All steps will be taught, along with etiquette & survival tips.

name: Youth Combat Marshals' Meet and Greet
description_book: Meet and Greet for Knowne World youth combat marshals hosted by the Society Deputy for Youth Combat.
description_web: Meet and Greet for any youth combat marshals and any adults interested in the youth combat program. Hosted by the Society Deputy for Youth Combat, this is a chance to ask questions, air concerns, and get to know other marshals.

name: 18 and Over: World Tour of Smack Talk
description_book: A global guide to vulgarities and insults! We shall be rowdy! (No one under 18, even with parent present, please.)
description_web: A global guide to vulgarities and insults! We shall be rowdy! (No one under 18, even with parent present, please)

name: *Waka Renga Haiku* - Samurai Poet
description_book: A participatory introduction to Japanese poetics. Includes Japanese poetry from early classical period to the development of *haikai* and *haiku*.
description_web: An introduction to Japanese poetics. Includes Japanese poetry from the early classical period to the development of *haikai* and *haiku*. We will consider both formal poetic forms and less formal, and even licentious poetry. Participants will have an opportunity to experiment with creating their own poetry. Please bring writing materials.

name: Known World Siege Marshal Social
description_book: A social meeting for informal discussions about siege combat and marshaling.
description_web: To promote convivial dialogue amongst the various groups of siege marshals in the Known World, Lord Diccon de Reinport, D.E.M. of Siege for the Middle Kingdom, is please to announce the 4th Annual KNOWN WORLD SIEGE MARSHAL SOCIAL to be hosted at the Holt Heroetus encampment at Pennsic War 42. Please join us for informal discussions about siege combat and marshaling and any other topics of interest.

name: Guedra - North African Trance Dance
description_book: Brief instruction in dance followed by participation in Guedra ritual. All levels. Bring water. Bring a veil if you want to dance.
description_web: Dance and chant will be taught, as well as some background info. (If you've heard the talk before, you can skip the first 30 minutes or so and come for the participation in the dance. Men must leave at that point.) Until our voices give out, we'll chant the Guedra for 1 to 4 dancers at a time. Bring a veil if you think you might want to dance. Everyone must participate in chant, no singing talent required, no dancing experience necessary. Bring water. Avoid wearing large jewelry.

name: Beginner's Ball
description_book: All levels welcome. All dances taught. No partner needed. Musicians welcome to join the open band. Some light refreshments will be served.
description_web: The Beginner's Ball is your opportunity to explore the joys of dance available to all. Please join us for a ball that is open to all levels of dancers (partners and fancy garb not necessary). We will dance a lively assortment of dances from bransles to English country to dances from the Inns of Court to some easy Italian dances. Is all this meaningless to you? Don't worry, as this is a 'teaching' ball. Beginners more than welcome. Music will be provided by an open band assembled at Pennsic. We welcome musicians to join us in our celebration. In addition, there will be light refreshments available.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: A general, multi-level yoga class to address the needs of the Pennsic attendee. Please dress for modesty, and bring a mat/towel or similar.
description_web: A general, multi-level yoga class to address the needs of the Pennsic attendee. Please dress for modesty, and bring a mat/towel or similar. Children responsible enough to follow along are welcome.

name: Fae Mythology
description_book: This class will go into fae creatures and the history of fae mythology from the British Isles and beyond, from the time of Pro-Celts to modern era.
description_web: This class will go into fae creatures and the history of fae mythology from the British Isles and beyond, from the time of Pro-Celts to modern era.

instructor: THL Isabelle de Montreuil sur Mer
name: How to Host a University Event
description_book: Are you interested in hosting a university event but unsure where to start? Come learn how easy and fun it can be!
description_web: Are you interested in hosting a university event but unsure where to start? Come learn how easy and fun it can be! We will discuss the types of events currently being sought in the East Kingdom and the ways in which the East Kingdom University can help and support you through your event planning.

name: Really Long Fingerloop Braids
description_book: How to fingerloop braid a *really* long braid with a new modern trick that requires no special equipment beyond a bit of medical tape.
description_web: How to fingerloop braid a **really** long braid with a new modern trick that requires no special equipment beyond a bit of medical tape. A simple method for intermittent braiding using colored poster board will also be taught. Use this simple method for those really long bodice-lacing braids. Produce long-enough narrow trim very simply. It is helpful if students can already braid a finger loop braid. If you can't, class will try to get you going, class size permitting.

name: But Honestly...The Internet Is Public Domain!
description_book: Discusses copyright, copyleft, the Internet, proper sourcing and how to protect your SCA articles from plagiarism and copyright infringement as well.
description_web: A class on copyright, copyleft, the Internet, proper sourcing and how to protect your SCA articles from plagiarism and copyright infringement as well as a retelling of the tale of how an apple pie took down a magazine.

name: Fingerloop Braiding for Beginners
description_book: A hands-on class learning a 5-loop braiding technique. Useful as decoration or cording. With slight variation it can be made into lanyard for tokens.

name: Event Decorating on a Shoestring
description_book: Learn how to cut heraldic forms for centerpieces or wall decorations out of paper to decorate feast halls or event sites. Class materials supplied.
description_web: Learn how to cut heraldic forms for centerpieces or wall decorations out of paper to decorate feast halls or event sites. Applications for metalwork, leather work, stained glass or clothing decorations. Ages 12 & up. Class materials supplied. Pattern book available for $20.

name: Loop String-Making
description_book: Taught by Rask of Viking Archery. Demo on how to make loop strings. Some hands-on.

name: Beginning Archery - 14 and Under
description_book: Taught by Forester Captain Liam. Learn the how to shoot, etiquette, and parts of the bow and arrow. For ages 2-14 years only. Meet at Family Range.
description_web: For beginners who are between ages 2 to 14. This class will be offered twice on the Family Range on Monday and Tuesday from 9 to 11 am.  Learn how to shoot, rules of the range, etiquette of the range, parts of the bow and arrows.  Bring your own bows and arrows. Some loaners are available for this class. Taught by Forester Captain Liam.

name: Bling on a Budget
description_book: How to use glass jewels, beads, and metal to add dignity and ostentation to garb without going broke.
description_web: How to use glass jewels, beads, and metal to add dignity and ostentation to garb without going broke. From minor flourishes to full-bore excess, planning and execution covered by instructor with 25+ years experience working with these forms of embellishment. Supplies available for purchase; prices vary depending on patterns chosen. No purchase necessary.
fee_itemization: Fee depends on choices made. No purchase necessary.

name: Intro to Egyptian-Style Group Improvisation
description_book: Learn basic Egyptian group improv dance with beledi-style combinations.
description_web: Rajni is a Certified Level 1 Tribal Odyssey dance leader, a group improvisational style developed by Kawakib of Fredericksburg, VA. In the words of Kawakib: “Tribal Odyssey uses natural posture and both sides of the body in combinations based primarily on Egyptian beledi-style movement. It's versatile enough to adapt to any size group.” Class will repeat to allow for several days of practice with a group, and will incorporate recorded Middle Eastern drumming as well as live music/ drumming as available. Learn moves that you and your dance friends can use at Pennsic haflas this year!

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Warp a loom, weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own.

name: Basic Coining
description_book: Striking basic coins from punched dies. Die preparation, creating punches, using those punches to make dies, and striking coins. Slightly messy.
description_web: Striking basic coins from punched dies. Die preparation, creating punches, using those punches to make dies, and striking coins. Somewhat messy.
fee_itemization: Handout, dies, punches, sandpaper, and coin blanks.

name: Medieval Pigments II: Acanthus Leaves
description_book: Paint acanthus leaves from *Göttingen Model Book*. Basic paint-making and pigment safety. Tools and materials provided.
description_web: Paint acanthus leaves from *Göttingen Model Book*. Basic-paint making and pigment safety. Tools and materials provided.

name: Tools to Use in Scribal Arts
description_book: How to start a scroll, and tools to use.

name: Small, Simple Period Notebook
description_book: No experience needed! Make a small notebook for your pouch or purse, appropriate for most mid- to late-period personas. All supplies included.
description_web: No experience needed! Make a small stab-stitch notebook for your pouch or purse, appropriate for most mid- to late-period personas. All supplies included. If you have any of the following tools, please bring them: ruler, awl, embroidery needle with large eye.
fee_itemization:
Instruction handout
Rawhide
Leather
Paper
Thread

name: Drafting **and** Draping Basic Sleeves
description_book: Learn how to flat-draft a basic sleeve in 5 minutes or less **plus** learn how to do a basic draping.
description_web: Learn how to flat-draft a basic sleeve in 5 minutes or less. You will get a chance to practice this simple technique. For more challenging silhouettes, you will learn how to do a basic Ddaping.

name: On Almond Milk
description_book: A demonstration on making almond milk; discussion of the differences between commercial almond milks and handmade with period recipe samples.
description_web: Demonstration and taste testing of almond milk making and commercially available almond milks. There will also be tastings of period recipes made with both, plus a discussion of uses for almond milk in period.

name: Dragon Hunting 101: Teaching Folklore in the SCA.
description_book: A discussion of successes/failures in teaching/researching folklore within the SCA, meant for both students & teachers of folklore and mythology.
description_web: This class is a discussion of successes and failures in teaching/researching folklore & mythology within the SCA. Though framed by the decades of amateur scholarship and practical experience of the teacher, this class is meant to be an enriching and open discussion by all participants. This class is for those who teach folklore, and for those who wish to optimize their learning experience.

name: Beginning Bobbin Lace
description_book: Three-day class for a total of 9 hours. Learn the basic movements and make a basic project. Start a period pattern.
description_web: This is a three-day class for a total of 9 hours of bobbin lace! First Day: Students will learn the basic movements of bobbin lace and begin a project. Second Day: Students will finish the project and learn some simple grounds. Third Day: Students will begin a period pattern from *The Nuew Modelbuch*.
fee_itemization: $30 – One-time fee for all three days. Includes pillow with cover, bobbin holder, 10 pair of bobbins, pins, handout, patterns

name: Songwriting to Tell a Story
description_book: Principles and guidelines for constructing tight, compelling, original SCA-appropriate songs that capture (and hold) an audience.
description_web: Principles and guidelines for constructing tight, compelling, original SCA-appropriate songs that capture (and hold) an audience. The focus is on lyrics, song and story structure. How is writing a good lyric different from writing a good poem? Create a singable story that is entertaining, engaging, and will hold the attention of a SCAdian audience (who enjoy period material, but still prefer a song that runs 6 minutes or under).

name: Paternosters: The Evidence
description_book: Lecture class on evidence for prayer bead construction from Europe prior to 1600, and the benefits and challenges of each source.
description_web: We will discuss what evidence we have for the construction of prayer beads in Europe prior to 1600 and the benefits and challenges of using each kind of source. Lecture-style class.

name: Jewish Cooking in No. Europe in the Middle Ages
description_book: An overview of medieval Jewish cooking in *Ashkenazi* regions of Europe (France, Germany, eastern Europe).
description_web: An overview of medieval Jewish cooking in *Ashkenazi* regions of Europe (France, Germany, eastern Europe).

name: Bow Inspection
description_book: Taught by M. Godric, AG from East Kingdom. Questions & answers; what to look for when any type of bow is inspected.

name: Fire Pit Cooking Play Date
description_book: Come play with food and fire to share techniques, information, recipes and issues. The class is a potluck; be prepared to share for lunch!
description_web: Come play with food and fire to share techniques, information, recipes and issues. The class is a potluck; be prepared to share with classmates for lunch! The class begins with some safety lessons and equipment. Newcomers, first-timers and experienced are welcome. Be ready to take notes and share recipes.

name: Gathering of the Louds
description_book: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Players of loud Renaissance instruments  gather just for fun to play poly-choral music. Come and be heard.
description_web: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Players of loud Renaissance instruments  gather just for fun to play poly-choral music. Not sure what these instruments are? Come listen or try one. Bring a music stand and clothespins.

name: *RunValdr*
description_book: System for using runes for healing and "magic."
description_web: In period runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to heal even at distance, to awaken inanimate objects, to stop migraines, and more.

name: Bread Baking In A Period Fire Pit
description_book: Class will include fire pit construction, period breads, preparing, baking and eating the breads made during the class.

name: Build a Bellows for Your Camp Fire
description_book: Each student will build a functional camp fire bellows from the provided materials.
description_web: Students will build a bellows that can be used for their camp fire. Each student will be provided materials, patterns and the use of tools to make their bellows. When complete, the bellows will be usable to help start your fire without having to huff and puff.

name: Flashmob Prep Class: *Gracca Amorosa*
description_book: Don't know the dance? Take this class to prepare for flashmob, Tues. 30th, noon, in grassy area near main gate.
description_web: Meet at noon on Tues., 7/30 in the wide, grassy south merchant area near the main gate for the flashmob. Don't know the dance, *Gracca Amorosa*? Take this class to prepare. We will learn all the moves and practice how to start the flashmob so you'll look like a pro when we perform it for the lucky folks who happen to be strolling by. Musicians who can play the song well are welcome, too!

name: Multiplayer Chess Games
description_book: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.
description_web: Chess games for four players.

name: Henna History and Application
description_book: Learn how and why henna was used in period, and how you can use it yourself. We will mix some henna in class and everyone gets some to try.
fee_itemization: One cone of fresh henna paste. You may also take the class without this, or bring your own.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching.
description_web: During this ten-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and mundanely. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: Known World Choir Rehearsal
description_book: Join the oldest Pennsic Choir as we rehearse in preparation for a concert Aug 1. We will perform some music in tribute to Owain Phyfe.
description_web: The Known World Choir, along with the Children's and Youth Choirs, the Debatable Choir, Chorulus Pennsicus, and other guests will present a concert of medieval and Renaissance choral literature. As part of their repertoire, the Known World Choir will perform some songs in tribute to Owain Phyfe.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes & hat; leave from Univ. Point. **We are seeking teachers to help us continue this Pennsic tradition!**
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. **We are seeking teachers to help us continue this tradition, one of Pennsic's two longest-running classes!**

name: The Black Hours
description_book: Take a look at one of the rarest of all manuscripts, *Das Schwarze Stundenbuch*. This class includes an overview of the style and painting techniques.
description_web: Take a look at one of the rarest of all manuscripts, *Das Schwarze Stundenbuch*. This class includes an overview of the style as well as painting techniques. Basic materials for practice piece supplied, but please bring your favorite paint brush (fine tipped).

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day.
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. 
Day 1- Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum
Day 2- Chiftitelli, Masmoudi
Day 3- Ayub, Malfouf
Day 4- Kashlimah and other strange stuff

name: Fire Safety 101
description_book: Campfire safety for apartment dwellers. How to light a fire, basic fire behavior, and what you need to be safe when dealing with fire.
description_web: Campfire safety for apartment dwellers. How to light a fire, basic fire behavior, and what you need to be safe when dealing with fire.

name: Street Smarts
description_book: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography. How the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.
description_web: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography. How the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.

name: The London Plague of 1603
description_book: In 1603, the plague swept through London killing nearly a quarter of the population. Learn how it spread, why, and popular cures of the time.
description_web: In 1603, the plague swept through London killing nearly a quarter of the population. Learn how it spread, why, and popular cures of the time. This class is not appropriate for children below the age of 14.

name: SCA People, Places and Things
description_book: An introductory class on the development and geography of the SCA with a special focus on the differences among kingdoms and the growth of the SCA.
description_web: An introductory class on the development and geography of the SCA with a special focus on the differences among kingdoms. We'll talk about "The Backyard Party," how the East and the West developed differently, how the 19 kingdoms came about, who some of the key people were along the way, and why some local groups have the names they have. Excellent for new and experienced folks.

name: Youth Archery in the SCA: How to Get Started
description_book: Geared toward families. Covers basic equipment selection and use, range rules & courtesies, and youth archery activities.
description_web: Geared toward families. Covers basic equipment selection and use, range rules and courtesies, and youth archery activities. It's easier to get started than you think, and a great way to get kids involved in the SCA.

name: *Cantigas d'Amigo*: Songs of My Boyfriend
description_book: Introduction to the songs and poems of the women troubadours and *trouveres*, plus *cantigas d'amigo* from Iberia. Handout includes poems and music.
description_web: An introduction to the songs and poems of the women troubadours and *trouveres*, and the *cantigas d'amigo* from Iberia. The *Cantigas d'Amigo* were written by men, but are from a woman's point of view, usually a young unmarried woman, but sometimes her mother. Handout includes poems and music, plus some original singable English translations/compositions by the instructor.

name: 16th-C  English Monochrome Embroidery: Blackwork
description_book: This class will focus on Elizabethan "blackwork" embroidery. This is *not* a how-to class; it is a lecture/discussion.
description_web: This class will focus on Elizabethan "blackwork" embroidery. This is *not* a how-to class; it is a lecture/discussion. We will examine extant examples and discover what late-16th English monochrome embroidery really is and, perhaps more importantly, what it is not. Fee applies if keeping handout; handouts available for class use and electronically.
fee_itemization: Handout available electronically; if keeping hard copy, donation of $4 is requested.

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Performing Arts Pavilion on Thursday afternoon of War Week. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.”

name: Dancing Above The Waist
description_book: Learn to dance beyond the choreography as we cover personal interactions, what to do with your hands, how to embellish, and more. Beginners welcome.
description_web: There's more to dancing than learning the steps? Yes! Learn to dance "above the waist" as we cover personal interactions, what to do with your hands, how to embellish, and more. Beginners welcome.

name: Kumihimo Basics
description_book: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk & string provided; take your work home with you.

name: It's Not All Gothic to Me
description_book: A beautiful scroll marries the right calligraphic hand with its illumination. Learn which hand best suits the illumination for any scroll assignment.
description_web: This class is intended to help scribes, especially beginners, choose the appropriate calligraphic hand to go with various styles of illumination. We'll look at the history and characteristics of different hands as well as some illumination styles and then try matching some hands with examples of illumination.

name: Care and Feeding of your Fire
description_book: Hands-on class on the proper construction, lighting and maintenance of fires for various purposes.
description_web:
Hands-on class on the proper construction, lighting and maintenance of fires for various purposes. We will work on fuel types, kindling, types of fires and how to use starting techniques like firebows and flint & steel. Discussion and construction of different fire arrangements with a focus on their purpose.

Children are welcome if under the supervision of a parent.

name: Middle Kingdom Chronicler Training
description_book: Fulfills the requirement for training in order to become a warranted Chronicler of the Middle Kingdom.
description_web: Class covers issues like copyright, image usage in SCA-related publications.  This class will fulfill the requirement for formal training to become a warranted chronicler in the Middle Kingdom, but it is open to anyone interested in publications.

name: SCA Court: Audience, Crowns and Behind the Scenes
description_book: A duchess and a long-time retainer/court junkie will teach why court is *not* boring and how people make it happen.
description_web: A duchess and a long-time retainer/court junkie will demystify court by telling you how to watch from the audience, what to look for and what goes on to make a court go. (Hint: It's like a graceful swan gliding across a lake while there is frenzied kicking beneath the surfaces.)

name: Keeping Bees in the Knowne World
description_book: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.
description_web: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.

name: Introduction to Medieval Music Notation
description_book: We'll discuss differences with modern notation, then read several examples. Bring melody instruments you play fluently, e.g., recorder, fiddle, voice.
description_web: Reading medieval music in modern notation imposes modern notions of measure, phrasing, and tonality. Reading it in the original notation allows us to get closer to the composer's intentions and the head-space of a medieval performer, and can help achieve those elusive, magical “medieval moments”. We'll start with an overview of differences between modern and medieval notation, and then spend most of the class reading examples. Bring melody instruments you play fluently, such as recorder, gamba, fiddle, voice (if you have good pitch memory), etc. If you have multiple sizes of your instrument, please bring them (e.g., SATB recorders).

name: Basics of Russian Clothing
description_book: Learn the basic structure of Russian garb, including patterns, seam finishes, decorative techniques, embellishments. Handout available.
description_web: Learn the basic structure of Russian garb, including patterns, seam finishes, decorative techniques and embellishments. Handouts are available.

name: *Hakama* Construction
description_book: A brief overview of Japanese pants will be discussed, along with a step-by-step, visual demonstration of their construction.
description_web: A brief overview of Japanese pants will be discussed, along with a step-by-step, visual demonstration of their construction for most of the hour. The extra time is allotted for consultations. Bring along your own materials if you'd like assistance with getting your pattern pieces started. Approximately 3-6 yards (45"-wide minimum) of fabric needed, depending on your height, size and fabric pattern. If you have questions, please contact me at yamamura.kitsune@gmail.com.

name: Divination: Sorcery and Casting of Lots
description_book: Intro to Sorcery aka Sortilege, or interpretation of randomized symbols, such as i Ching, runes, tarot, bibliomancy.
description_web: Intro to Sorcery aka Sortilege, or interpretation of randomized symbols, such as i Ching, runes, tarot, bibliomancy. We will cover everything from flipping a coin to the Church practice of using dice to obtain answers directly from God. Special bonus: latest research on period tarot methods predating the neo-Egyptian occultism of the 18th century.

name: How To Perform *Commedia* Characters
description_book: An introductory-level class covering basic history of *commedia* and stock characters with opportunities to play short scenes to try them out.
description_web: An introductory-level class covering basic history of *Commedia dell' Arte*, the Italian improvisational comic theater, and its stock characters with opportunities to play short scenes to try them out. We will play some theater improv games, so all students will participate! We'll also cover how to make *commedia* happen in the modern SCA. Instructors are from the Atlantian troupe *i Firenzi*.

name: An Organized Tent Is a Happy Tent
description_book: Tips to help your encampment be a happier place. Class is run as a roundtable discussion. Please bring something to sit on.

name: Basic Tablet Weaving
description_book: Learn to warp the loom and weave a basic pattern. Limited number of small looms should be available for use and/or purchase.

name: *Piccolo Passi*: Baby Steps into Italian Dance
description_book: Learn how to apply familiar ECD steps and terms to take the first baby steps towards mastering the elegant (and fun!) dances of 15th-C. Italy.
description_web: Learn how to apply familiar ECD steps and terms to take the first baby steps towards mastering the elegant (and fun!) dances of 15th-century Italy. We will cover period dances *Amoroso*, *Petit Vriens*, and *Rostiboli Gioioso*. Beginners welcome.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* & Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Known World Children's Choir
description_book: The Known World Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.
description_web: The Known World Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.

name: Hafla Songs for All Instruments by Lady Melissa!
description_book: New songs for haflas! Bring your drum, zills, band or orchestra instruments! Sheet music available. *Jemillah, Gul Ali, Al Ataba, Habibi Nourelain*.
description_web: New songs for haflas! *Jemillah* (Armenian), *Gul Ali* (Turkish 9/8), *Habibi Nour El Ain* (Arabic), and *Al Ataba Gazaz* (Arabic). Bring your drum, zills, band or orchestra instruments! Sheet music available to purchase. Let's make beautiful Middle Eastern music together.
fee_itemization: Sheet music and drum rhythm sheets

name: Recipe Redaction
description_book: We will discuss recipe redaction, from identifying ingredients to serving. Focus will be on thinking through the process. We will eat the results!
description_web: We will discuss recipe redaction, from identifying ingredients to cooking times to serving. Focus will be on thinking through the process, using a specific recipe as an example. While only one recipe will be prepared, students are encouraged to bring recipes of their own to work with.

instructor: Viscountess Kamiilah al Sudanii um Zoom
name: Intermediate Middle Eastern Dance Combos
description_book: Kamiilah will be teaching some of her favorite combinations of movements, and her own style of lead-and-follow dance! If we have time we will zill!
description_web: Kamiilah is the fearless leader of modern dance troupe RockaBelly, and is ready to share her sassy lead-and-follow combos with all of you! If we have time we will also learn zill patterns specific to the movements.

name: I Can't Believe It's Not Tablet Weaving
description_book: This class looks at an example of how archaeology can be challenged through experimental archaeology.
description_web:
This class looks at an example of how archaeology can be challenged through experimental archaeology. Traditionally it has been thought that tablet-woven edges were a complicated system of using feet, and hands, and tablets to work the weaving into the edges of textiles as they were being woven. This class challenges this theory with a practical demonstration, and hands on, of how a tablet-woven edge can be achieved without tablets, using only needles, and utilizing all those short lengths of yarn left over from weaving that would not have gone to waste in the host cultures we are discussing.

Sorry no class hand-outs, They're too heavy in baggage.

name: Reproducing a Bead - Design, Construction
description_book: How to examine a bead or bead photo and figure out how to reproduce it.
description_web: How to examine a bead or bead photo and figure out how to reproduce it.
fee_itemization:
Copying fee only.
Will also be available for printing at Mystic Mail.

name: Bringing Your Research Into the Real World
description_book: Have you ever wanted to bring your research into the real world? Come find out how from one who has done it.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to bring your research into the real world, but wasn't certain it was 'good enough'? Come find out what it takes to make it in the worlds of academia and independent scholarship from one who has done it.

name: Reformation and Sumptuary Laws
description_book: A look at German sumptuary laws, the effects of the Reformation, and how the people broke the rules.
description_web: A look at German sumptuary laws, the effects of the Reformation, and how the people broke the rules.
fee_itemization: Color printout of pictures and summary

name: Messenger of the Gods
description_book: A chronological history of bees and beekeeping.
description_web: A chronological history of bees and beekeeping.

name: Wildly Weedy Herbs
description_book: Learn about some medieval and Renaissance herbs now growing wild in the U.S. No walking required.
description_web: Interested in learning how to spot some of the herbs known to our medieval and Renaissance forebears that have escaped and become weeds here? Were they weeds at home? How are they/were they used? We'll cover probably 20 herbal invaders. Instructor will strive to bring examples of most if not all plants to handle.

name: Commedia dell'Arte: Characters, History, Relevance
description_book: An introduction to the late-period Italian theater, with overview of the history, characters, and basic plots.
description_web: An introduction to the *Commedia dell'Arte*, a form of late-period Italian theater, with overview of the history, characters, and basic plots. The goal is to increase understanding and enjoyment  of the *Commedia* by modern viewers.

name: *Itamae*: Samurai Chef
description_book: An introduction to the food, food culture, cookery, rituals of the meal, and the culinary calendar of pre-modern Japan.
description_web: What did *Pimiko, Shotoku-taishi*, the Shining *Genji*, *Dogen*, and *Hideyoshi* eat? An introduction to the food, food culture, cookery, rituals of the meal, and the culinary calendar of pre-modern Japan.

name: *Assai Contrapassare*
description_book: There are at least 6 known choreographies for the tune Contrapasso, all of which almost fit the same music. We'll start with *in due* and learn 2 more
description_web: There are at least 6 known choreographies for the tune *Contrapasso*, all of which almost fit the same music. We'll begin by learning (or reviewing) *Contrapasso en due*, and then we'll learn two variants danced in a circle from Caroso, including the one illustrated in the lovely rose hey woodcut.

name: *Xiang-qi* for Beginners (Chinese Chess)
description_book: A 90-minute class in how to play *Xiang-qi* (Chinese chess). History, rules, strategy and tactics; enough time left for students to play afterwards.
description_web: A 90-minute class in how to play *Xiang-qi* (Chinese chess). History, rules, strategy and tactics; enough time left for students to play afterwards.

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Known World Youth Choir
description_book: The Known World Youth Choir is open to youth age 12-18 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.
description_web: The Known World Youth Choir is open to youth age 12-18 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.

name: Renaissance Title-Page Borders
description_book: A look at decorated book title-pages of the 15-16th centuries, focusing on black and white linework. Class consists of hands-on layout and design.

name: Documenting Names & Armory Submissions
description_book: How to build good documentation for names and armory in SCA heraldic registration.
description_web: It is important to clearly document all elements of any name submitted in the SCA. It is equally important to show supporting documentation for first-time registrations of charges, designs that follow culturally specific patterns, use of restricted charges or proof of previously forbidden charges. We'll talk about what the Colleges look for, what sources are best and which to avoid, how to handle submission forms to your best advantage and how to build a (hopefully) convincing argument for your or your client's desired name or armory.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: The Medieval Enthusiast: What to See in Italy
description_book: A tourist itinerary of medieval attractions, based on extensive personal experience, starting with Venice, Florence, and Rome, and going on.
description_web: Medieval Italy is sadly neglected by tourism bureaus that emphasize classical and Renaissance attractions. This class will highlight some of Italy's many medieval glories, financed by a golden age of profiteering from the crusades and crusaders.

name: Building a Spring Pole Lathe
description_book: Learn how to make your own break-down spring pole lathe with materials that you can get at any home center.
description_web: Learn how to make your own break-down spring pole lathe. By using materials that you can get at any home center, you will soon be turning out bowls, plates, chairs, etc.

name: Basic Silversmithing
description_book: Make a period-looking pendant using cabochon semi-precious stone and sterling sheet & wire. Process includes forming, silver soldering and finishing.
description_web: Students will make a pendant using cabochon semi-precious stones which would have been available in period, and sterling silver sheet and wire. The processes will include forming, silver soldering and finishing.
fee_itemization:
Silver sheet and wire  $25
Semiprecious Stone  $10
Expendable Materials  $5

name: Help Me, Tempus, You’re My Only Hope!
description_book: 2 hours with Tempus, anything sewing. Trouble-shooting, problem-solving, garb problems diagnosed and solutions proffered. Maybe learn to sew...
description_web:
(Garb Troubleshooting/Q&A Workshop)
This is a trouble-shooting and problem-solving class - garb problems diagnosed and solutions proffered. Bring to the class garb that went “wrong” or garb that didn’t “work” for you. We'll talk; it can be fixed. If you don’t have the garb here, bring your questions; we’ll do our best to solve your garb troubles. We’ll talk about gussets and how to use your seam ripper, too. This class can go on longer if needed. Also, this class will be offered next year.

name: Baltic Wire Weaving
description_book: Beginner, hands-on introduction to Baltic wire weaving techniques for making jewelry and trim. Brief discussion of history and artifacts included.
description_web: This will be a hands-on introduction to Baltic wire weaving techniques for making jewelry and trim. There will be a discussion of the history of wire woven chains as well as examples of different patterns and historical finds.
fee_itemization: Materials fee includes dowel and enough wire to finish your project

name: Backstage at the Globe
description_book: Explore England’s most famous theater from a back stage perspective.  How were shows produced, and just where do we get the meaning of box office?
description_web: Join Master Lorcan Dracontius, Managing Housekeeper for KWP, as he dons the guise of an every day apprentice from Cheapside, stepping back in time, to enjoy an afternoon’s entertainment at the theater across the Thames. Once there, explore England’s most famous theater from a back stage perspective.  Yes, we’ll cover what happens on stage, but we’ll also go behind the scenes to discover how they really got those shows up and running.

name: Henna Body Art for Beginners
description_book: A historical look at henna including regional patterns, then practical instruction, before students create their own natural henna body art.
fee_itemization: $5 per henna cone provided to students. I sell mundanely at this rate.

name: Thorsberg Trousers: Pants That Last!
description_book: Tired of repairing pants that rip in unmentionable places? Then you’ll love these pants based on trousers from an Iron Age burial!
description_web: Tired of repairing pants that rip in unmentionable places? Then you’ll love these pants based on trousers from an Iron Age burial! Learn what you’ll need to make them yourself: fabrics, seams, pattern, and construction.

name: Making Better T-Tunics
description_book: Now that you have made your first t-tunic, learn some pointers for making the next one better.
description_web: Now that you have made your first t-tunic, learn some pointers for making the next one better.

name: Norse Apron Dress
description_book: How to pattern and construct a Norse apron dress. If possible bring 2 yards of fabric, scissors, and fabric pen, though not necessary for the class.
description_web: How to pattern and construct a Norse apron dress. If possible bring 2 yards of fabric, scissors, and fabric pen, though not necessary for the class.

name: Beginner Dance: English Country Dance
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then teach simple English country dances.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then teach simple English country dances. No partner necessary.

name: *Chorulus Pennsicus*
description_book: A limited voice choir by audition only that will rehearse and perform at War. Attend first session if interested. Listeners are welcome.
description_web: A limited voice choir by audition only that will rehearse and perform at War. Attend first session if interested. Listeners are welcome. Music will be available in advance from the KWChoir yahoo group's page.

name: Old World in the Real World
description_book: "No. Set. List." Keeping your haflas/shows open and fresh. Playing together as a group. Some “new” old songs and a little *maqam* review.
description_web: Add some “new” old songs to your repertoire! We'll review some of the *maqams* (modes/scales) used in Middle Eastern music and learn some great songs. The second part of class will be “No. Set. List.” playing together as a group and keeping your shows fresh and open. Perfect for any level and whatever instrument you play. Sheet music will be provided.

name: Care & Feeding of a *Commedia* Troupe in the SCA
description_book: Ever watched a *Commedia dell'Arte* show, laughed, and wanted to do that, too? Come learn about creating and running your own troupe in the SCA!
description_web: Ever watched a *Commedia dell'Arte* show, laughed yourself silly, and said, "Hey, I wanna do that, too?" If you find yourself far from any existing troupe, consider creating your own. Learn from some *commedia* players who did just that on how to research the art form, find some co-conspirators, and how to make your own troupe live and thrive in the Society!

name: Heraldic Flag Design
description_book: Learn about the various types of heraldic flags that existed in period, their design and application. Then design your own!
description_web: What does one do with those fantastic animals, interesting designs and brilliant colors needed for a good heraldic design? And where does one apply said design? Before heraldry ever appeared on shield and surcoat, those heraldic designs fluttered over the heads of kings and peasants, like majestic birds, in the form of banners, pennons, standards and gonfalons. Learn about the various types of heraldic flags that existed in period, their design and application. Then design your own!

name: Piracy in the SCA Era
description_book: The history of piracy, what pirates did and didn't do, wore and didn't wear, and what they were really like.
description_web: This class will go into the history of piracy, what pirates did and didn't do, wore and didn't wear and what they were really like.

name: Conversational Russian
description_book: The class will cover the Russian alphabet and basic modern day Russian conversational phrases, words and phrases more related to the SCA.
description_web: The class will cover the Russian alphabet and basic modern day Russian conversational phrases, responses and questions. After that we will go over words and phrases more related to the SCA, which can be used to flavor one’s persona. There will be time reserved at the end of the class for questions.

name: My Saxony Journey
description_book: Discoveries and trials of recreating a Cranach Saxony gown.
description_web: Discoveries and trials of recreating a Cranach Saxony gown. This class will discuss the experimental archaeological experience of creating a Saxony gown.  I will present my process, decision-making, successes, failures, and continuing questions.

name: Introduction to Elizabethan Vocal Music
description_book: Live performance examples of single-voice music.

name: Hand-Sewing
description_book: Instead of talking about final touches, use hand-sewn seams, hems, and facings to give your garment the perfect *first* touches.

name: Meeting for Youth Officers, Youth, and Families
description_book: Society Deputy for Family and Youth Programs meeting with parents, youth, & youth officers to talk about plans for the future and to answer questions.
description_web: A meeting with the Society Special Deputy for Family and Youth Programs for parents, children, youth, teens, local groups' youth officers, seneschals and the populace to answer your questions about Society policies regarding minors, paperwork, and youth projects. We want to hear your ideas, concerns, and suggestions. We will also be talking about plans for the future. Everyone is welcome!

name: Arrow-Making Assembly - Beginners
description_book: Taught by L.Aethelwulf. (GDH) You have the materials, let's put them all together.  How to attach nocks, fletches and arrowheads to the shaft.

name: FAP: German Medieval Dagger
description_book: Freelance Academy Press presents basic overview of German medieval dagger techniques.
description_web: Freelance Academy Press presents basic overview of German medieval dagger techniques.

name: A Walkabout of the Poisons at Pennsic
description_book: Wandering throughout Pennsic identifying poisonous plants.

name: Beginner Dance: 15th-C English Dance (Gresley)
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Class starts with the basics of walking and rhythm, then introduces fun, simple dances from the War of the Roses.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with the very basics of walking and rhythm, and then introduces you to fun, simple dances from the time of the War of the Roses.

name: Chess, Chess, Chess
description_book: A description of three forms of chess that co-existed in Germany.
description_web: *Das Schach- oder König-Spiel* describes three forms of chess that co-existed in Germany. We'll discuss the rules of all three versions, followed by an opportunity to play any of them.

name: Advanced *Repoussé* & Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block working, forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block working, forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.

name: Recorder Jam Session
description_book: Do you play the recorder? Would you like to play with others in a group setting? Read through music? Come join us. All ages welcome.
description_web: Do you play the recorder? Would you like to play with others in a group setting? Read through Renaissance literature? Come join us. In the 90-minute session we will start with beginner/easy reading and then move towards harder music. If you're a youth player, then come at the beginning. If you're more advanced, then come halfway through. Bring your instrument or use one of ours.
fee_itemization: There will be soprano recorders available at $6.00 each.

name: Æthelmearc Scribes Get-Together
description_book: An afternoon to meet your fellow scribes and enjoy some light refreshment. Bring your portfolio and share your work.
description_web: An afternoon to meet your fellow scribes and enjoy some light refreshment. Bring your portfolio and share your work.

name: Basic Middle Eastern Percussion.
description_book: Come learn the basics of Middle Eastern rhythms and counting. This class covers the basic foundation rhythms of North Africa and Central Asia.
description_web: Come learn the basics of Middle Eastern rhythms and counting. This class will cover the basic foundation rhythms of North Africa and Central Asia, as well as how to interweave these with the common Western and South African rhythms commonly heard at most SCA drum circles. Basic frame drum and riq.

name: Food Safety for the SCA Kitchen
description_book: A look at food safety and some of the unique kitchen situations we encounter in the SCA.
description_web: A look at food safety and some of the unique kitchen situations we encounter in the SCA.

name: So You Want to Be a (Book) Herald? Part II–Armory
description_book: An introduction to armory in the SCA. Covers the basics of heraldic design and SCA rules. Part I is not a prerequisite.
description_web: Interested in heraldry? Want to be involved with device or name submissions? This three-part class introduces the basics of book heraldry for the non-(book) herald. Part II covers the basics of armory, the SCA rules governing the design of devices, and the basics of conflict-checking. The three parts of the course are not prerequisites for each other.

name: thing.pennsicuniversity.org Hiss & Purr
description_book: Instructors, come say what you liked, disliked, and would like to see in this system for next year.

name: Medieval and Renaissance Medical Terminology
description_book: Don't know a *ventose* from a *spatulum mondani*? Want to know the difference between quinsy and hydrocele? This is an introduction to medical terms.

name: Recreating a 14th-Century Child's Hat
description_book: This class discusses the reconstruction of the Norlund No. 86 extant child's hat. Pattern and instructions will be provided.
description_web: This class will discuss the reconstruction of the Norlund No. 86 extant child's hat. I will present my findings based on my replication experience. Pattern and instructions will be provided.

name: Youth Pilgrim's Bags
description_book: Make a youth pilgrim's bag out of felt. All materials provided to the first 15 along with instruction.
description_web: Make a youth pilgrim's bag out of felt. All material provided to the first 15 along with instruction. This is open to all youth 8-14 years old, with a responsible adult.

name: Telling Stories as Your Persona
description_book: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.
description_web: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.

name: Demystifying Chinese: Written and Spoken
description_book: Learn basic Chinese scripts, characters, and their origins. Great for those interested in calligraphy.

name: 5 Easy Steps to Writing Documentation for A&S Comp
description_book: For those who have never written documentation to get a start on the process, and to improve the skills of those who have.
description_web:
Many of us haven’t even written a book report, let alone a research paper, since high school. But don’t worry, you can write documentation for your entries with a little bit of guidance and a simple and easy-to-understand approach. This class is geared to help those who have never written documentation to get a start on the process, and to help those who have written documentation to improve their skills.
Handouts will be provided free of charge which will cover the "5 Steps to Writing Your Documentation", how to cite your sources and the use of the Internet (good and bad) for research. We will be also looking at examples of documentation from artisans around the Knowne World.

name: Sewing Flat-Felled Seams
description_book: Flat-felling is a sewing technique that keeps your seam allowances from fraying, makes your garments hang better, and can even make them last longer.

name: Middle Eastern Music and Dance
description_book: A time for people of all skill levels to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. All instruments are welcome, and loaner drums are available!
description_web: A time for people interested in Middle Eastern music and dance to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. We will be providing instruction appropriate to the interest of the attendees, from beginning Middle Eastern drum and belly dance to teaching songs in which everyone can participate. All skill levels and instruments are welcome, and drums are available for borrowing!

name: Beginning *Bassadanza*
description_book: Learn the basics of this graceful style of dance from 15th-C. Italy. The class focus is more on how to dance than on learning a particular dance.

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a trim strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a trim strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: *Malfoof* Boot Camp
description_book: This is an ALL-level class that will focus on stamina and speed using the *malfoof* rhythm including variation and fills.
description_web: This is an ALL-level class that will focus on stamina and speed using the *malfoof* rhythm including variation and fills. How fast can you go? How long can you go? We will start slow and gradually build.

name: Double-Reed Musical Instruments - Loud and Soft
description_book: Learn a little about the crumhorn, cornamuse, kortholt, shawm and *rauschpiefe*.
description_web: Have you ever wondered about period woodwinds other than then recorders? Double-reed instruments come in several flavors: loud or soft, windcapped or open reeds. What is better: a natural or synthetic reed? Learn a little about the care and feeding of the crumhorn, cornamuse, kortholt, shawm and *rauschpiefe*.

name: Institutional SCAbominations
description_book: What aspects of the SCA's structure do we just get **wrong** in relation to how it really was in period? Can we do it better or are we stuck?
description_web: What aspects of the SCA's structure do we just get **wrong** in relation to how it really was in period? Did knights wear white belts? What's a shire, really? And what do you **really** call a former king? Can we do it better or are we stuck?

name: Target Arrows with Medieval Features
description_book: Making faux-medieval target arrows for light sport bows to shoot in SCA tournaments.
description_web: How to build simple target arrows with typical medieval features for SCA tournament shooting. The arrows use simple techniques and readily available materials. The goal is more realism, but as simply and cheaply as possible. The class is NOT hands-on, but examples of my arrows will be available for examination. Some experience in arrow building is recommended, but beginners are welcome, too.

name: Persian Plants
description_book: Find out what plants grew in ancient Iran. Good for those interested in cooking, gardening, herbalism, or illumination.
description_web: Want to know what to plant in your Persian garden? Find out what plants grew in ancient Iran. Good for those interested in cooking, gardening, herbalism, miniature painting, or envisioning the period landscape. The class will draw from modern taxonomy, period illustrations, and period cooking. In addition, the class will cover which plants are available to plant in your garden, and which ones should be avoided.
fee_itemization: Two dollars covers a color handout.

name: Tips and Tricks for Local Exchequers
description_book: Does the job of exchequer seem scary? Let's talk about ways to make the job easier with ideas on managing group accounts and finances.
description_web: Does the job of local exchequer seem daunting? Come on over and let's talk about ways to make the job easier. We'll go over some ideas to help manage your local group accounts and finances. Question-and-answer time for quarterly reports and any other issues that you may be having.

name: Being Your Persona
description_book: How to maintain the illusion, at an event, that you are a period person interacting with other period people.
description_web: How to maintain the illusion, at an event, that you are a period person interacting with other period people.

name: Bardic Collegium: Meet-and-Greet and Ask Dr Apollo
description_book: The annual meet-and-greet and roundtable Congress, a general discussion of issues of current interest to the Known World bardic community.
description_web: The annual meet-and-greet and roundtable Congress, a general discussion of issues of current interest to the Known World bardic community. Please stop by to reacquaint yourself with your fellows gathered at Pennsic and join our panel in a discussion of problems and opportunities. Have a specific question about a problem your bardic community is experiencing? Bring it. Our advice is Olympian.

name: *Renga*: Linked Poetry, Part 2
description_book: Part 2: A writing practicum.
description_web: Part 2: A writing practicum.

name: FAP: German Medieval Longsword
description_book: Freelance Academy Press presents basic overview of German medieval longsword techniques.
description_web: Freelance Academy Press presents basic overview of German medieval longsword techniques.

name: Unusual English Country Dances
description_book: Not all English country dances follow "the usual pattern". This class will cover some Playford dances with unique features.
description_web: Not all English country dances follow "the usual pattern". This class will cover some Playford dances with unique features. Possible dances include *Confesse, Argeers, Saint Martins, Lord of Carnavan's Jegge,* and *Saturday Night and Sunday Morn.*

name: Beyond *Dum Tek Ka*: Advanced Drumming Techniques
description_book: Whether a *doumbek* cowboy, *djembe* jammer, or a casual musician, there's something in this class for you. Learn more than the traditional sounds.
description_web: Sounds to be covered include slides, snaps, bends, kicks, and more. This is for any kind of drum but applies mostly to *doumbeks* and *djembes*. This class is for all skill levels; bring a drum and enjoy.

name: Scribal Efficiency
description_book: Tips, tricks, and esoteric ways to become more efficient in the scribal arts. A general working knowledge about the scribal arts is recommended.
description_web: Taught by a professional stained glass artist by day, scribal geek by night.  Come learn some new tips, tricks, and esoteric bits on how to become a more efficient scribe. This class is geared towards folks with a general working knowledge about the role that the scribe plays in the SCA, and is suitable for both calligraphers and illuminators.  Calligraphers should bring a ruler and pencil.
fee_itemization: pay for printing costs of handout.

name: Pilgrim's Bags
description_book: History on pilgrim's bags and info on how to make a cloth or leather bag. Free up your hands by wearing a pilgrim's bag instead carrying a basket.
description_web: Ever thought about wearing a pilgrim's bag instead of carrying a bulky basket?  Free up your hands and keep your modern items out of sight. Learn about the history of pilgrim's bags; get instructions on how to make a cloth or leather bag. If you made one last year, bring it for a show-and-tell.

name: Embroidery of the 14th Century
description_book: Embroidery techniques of the 14th century with an emphasis on *opus anglicanum* and pouches. Other class by instructor will cover pouch construction.
description_web: Class will cover embroidery techniques of the 14th century with an emphasis on *opus anglicanum* and pouches. Basic stitches will not be covered in class, but will be included in handout. Goldwork will be covered. Other class by instructor will cover pouch construction.

name: *Cloisonné* Enameling
description_book: Introduction to the technique, tools, and materials of *cloisonné* enamel. Kits are available for students to create a small piece.
description_web: Students will be introduced to the technique, tools, and materials of *cloisonné* enamel. Kits are available for students to create a small piece of their own. You may - and are encouraged - to bring wire working tools such as pliers and cutters.
fee_itemization: Kit Includes handout, blank disk to apply enamels, cloisonne' wire and use of instructors enamel colors and kiln to fire.

name: Viking Age Tablet Weaving: The Evidence
description_book: A survey of the major finds of tablet weaving from Norse sites like Birka, Oseberg, Mammen, Elisenhof, Evebo, Snartemo, and Eura. 40-page handout.
description_web: A brief survey of the major finds of tablet weaving from Norse and neighboring sites, including Birka, Oseberg, Mammen, Elisenhof, Evebo, Snartemo, Eura and others. 40-page handout is available.

name: Knowne Worlde Seneschal Q&A
description_book: This is a Q&A session for all Seneschals to attend with the Society Seneschal.
