description_web: This is a Q&A session for all Seneschals to attend with the Society Seneschal.

name: Make Your Own Bobbin Lace Pillow and Bead Bobbins
description_book: How to make a lace pillow and bead bobbins from materials you have at home.  Bobbin materials supplied.
description_web: How I made my own cookie pillows, roller pillow, block pillow and bobbins.  Many  bobbins can be made from everyday materials you have at home.  I will share my designs for the pillows I find the easiest to work with, my $5 pillow stand idea and instructions on how I made my pillows and bobbins.  Participants will be able to make their own bobbins that can be picked up the following day.
fee_itemization: Supplies to make your own bobbins.  Each participant will make and be able to pick up 10 of their own hand created bobbins the following day

name: Annual Slavic Interest Group Meeting
description_book: Feel free to bring projects, books, questions, anything you'd like to chat about with other Slavophiles.
description_web: Feel free to bring projects, books, questions, anything you'd like to chat about with other Slavophiles.

name: Ball Prep
description_book: Want to dance at the ball, but have no or little idea how? This is the class for you! All steps will be taught, along with etiquette & survival tips.

name: 14th-Century Pouch Construction
description_book: Make a 14th-C pouch. Rectangular pouches will be the focus, but other shapes will be discussed. Kit will be available to make your own.
description_web: Make a 14th-C pouch. Rectangular pouches will be the focus, but other shapes will be discussed. Kit will be available to make your own. Class will build on "Embroidery of the 14th Century" class, but attendance at the other class is not necessary.

name: Gender Roles in Anglo-Saxon England
description_book: What do we know about the male/female/gay gender roles in Anglo-Saxon England?
description_web: In anthropology, sex is biological, but gender describes culturally-based roles. What differences did gender make for Anglo-Saxon men and women? What do we know about homosexuality in this culture?

name: *Muhekian* - The Taste of Tea
description_book: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothing with white socks or tabi, and bring a fan if you have one.
description_web: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothing with white socks or tabi, and bring a fan if you have one. Please do not wear any jewelry or weapons in the tea room.
fee_itemization: cost of tea and sweets - 12 per sitting.

name: Youth Combat Open Field Activites
description_book: Open practice and games for youth fighters. Please check the on-line description or at the Youth Combat list field for more information.

name: A Tour of Pictland
description_book: A tour of Pictish Scotland (500-800 CE), including some of the most notable stones and archaeological sites. Come travel the Pictish Trail with us!
description_web: A tour of Pictish Scotland (500-800  CE), including some of the most notable stones and archaeological sites. This will be an audio-visual presentation featuring many slides from the teacher’s travels in Scotland, including Pictish stones and structures still in situ as well as stones and artifacts now found in museums. Come travel the Pictish Trail with us!

name: Medieval Oil Lamps
description_book: Oils were used to light lamps by all cultures throughout the Middle Ages. Learn how easy, inexpensive, and best of all, *safe* oil lamps are!
description_web: Oils were used to light lamps by all cultures throughout the Middle Ages. Learn how easy, inexpensive, compact and, best of all, *safe* oil lamps still are! Learn how to camp with just one bottle of cooking oil. New this year, a brief mention of 'fat' lamps will be included.
fee_itemization: copying cost for handout and wick kit materials.

name: English Ball
description_book: Come dance your favorite English dances. From beginners to advanced, all are welcome as we dance the night away in true English fashion.
description_web: Come dance your favorite English dances. From beginners to advanced, all are welcome as we dance the night away in true English fashion.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: A general, multi-level yoga class to address the needs of the Pennsic attendee. Please dress for modesty, and bring a mat/towel or similar.
description_web: A general, multi-level yoga class to address the needs of the Pennsic attendee. Please dress for modesty, and bring a mat/towel or similar. Children responsible enough to follow along are welcome.

name: Wearing a Lady's Head Cloth Based on Dublin Finds
description_book: What did a Norse lady use to cover her head? Experiment with various methods based on the finds from Viking Age Dublin. Examples/patterns on hand.
description_web: If you ever wondered just what a Norse lady used to cover her head, then come and experiment with various methods based on the finds from Viking Age Dublin, Ireland. Several examples on hand along with patterns to recreate them.

name: Let's Be Frank: Improving your Carolingian Persona
description_book: Tips on making and acquiring the appropriate items to portray a Carolingian Frank. Even Charlemagne himself will be envious after you take this class.
description_web: Tips on making and acquiring the appropriate items for a Carolingian Frankish persona. Focuses on clothing (both male and female), but also includes accessories, weapons, and armor. Even Charlemagne himself will be envious after you take this class.

name: Beginning Bead-Making
description_book: Interested in learning the art of glass bead-making? Must wear closed-toed shoes, long sleeves and pants/dress.
description_web: Interested in learning the art of glass bead making? Come join us! Instruction will be given the first hour of class with guided practice; the second hour is for you to practice the skills that you have learned. Students will be able to take home any beads they make during class! Must wear closed-toed shoes, long sleeves and pants or dress. Students not wearing the proper attire will be turned away. Sorry, we are dealing with hot glass, people, and it is hot!!!
fee_itemization: Glass rods, propane, mandrels, hot head torches, bead release.

name: *Cholis*: Yes, They Are Period; You Can Make One!
description_book: Drawing on historic artwork, this class will provide an overview of *cholis* followed by pattern construction demonstrations for two different styles.
description_web: Drawing on historic artwork, this class will provide an overview of a selection of women's *choli*/upper body garments, covering a broad range of times and places within medieval India. Documentation gained from historic artwork will be discussed followed by a demonstration of pattern construction to ensure a well-fitting and comfortable garment.

name: Medieval Genealogy
description_book: This class continues a series on medieval genealogy, specifically focusing on creating a medieval-style family history.
description_web: In an continuing effort to foster an understanding of genealogy as it relates to the study of the medieval period, this class is being offered to those interested in their own family history. Specifically, the subject of family history books and genealogies as recorded in the medieval period will be covered. Some prior basic understanding of family research will be helpful.

name: Post-Viking Runic Perpetual Calendars
description_book: Discussion of the parchment and stave styles of post-Viking runic perpetual calendars. Markings indicate days of the week, feast days & Metonic cycle.
description_web: Runes continued to be used after the end of the Viking Era. This class will look at the runic perpetual calendars of the Middle Ages. Discussion will include the various ways of indicating the feast and vigil days as well as the Metonic cycle (Golden numbers). Will include discussion of both parchment and stave styles.

name: Pennsic Pile Roundtable
description_book: The Pennsic Pile is the common book of dance music used by SCA dance musicians at Pennsic and beyond. What do you like? What needs to be changed?
description_web: The Pennsic Pile is the name given to the common book of music used by dance musicians at Pennsic and many other places in the SCA. Join us as we discuss the future of the Pennsic Pile. Some questions we might discuss: What should the purpose of the Pile be? What do you like? What needs to be changed? Are there dances or specific arrangements you would like to see included? What can go?

name: Beginning Illumination: Loving the Dot
description_book: Let me show you that illumination doesn't have to be a daunting as it seems. Learn about layout, design elements and, yes, dots, Dots, *DOTS*!
description_web: So you've seen those beautiful manuscripts and thought you'd love to learn how to create one on your own, but surely they are too daunting! Well, I'd like to show you how to visually break down complicated scroll designs into more manageable and doable elements. You'll even try your hand at a few of them! Materials available for the fee, or bring your own.
fee_itemization: Unless you bring your own painting materials, you can get a kit with brushes, paper, and a small bit of gouache.  If you don't use the kit, a few dollars donation for the paper and paint you will use would be helpful.

name: East Kingdom Equestrian College
description_book: East Kingdom equestrians will meet to discuss updates to the handbook.
description_web: This will be the second of two scheduled meetings to discuss updates to our handbook to bring it in line with current Society rules. If you cannot make the meeting, please feel free to email Sylvia with your comments and suggestions.

name: Fingerloop Braiding for Beginners
description_book: A hands-on class learning a 5-loop braiding technique. Useful as decoration or cording. With slight variation it can be made into lanyard for tokens.

name: Teaching in the SCA
description_book: Want to share what you know and feel good about it afterwards? Covers planning, preparation, presentation, problems, publicity, and "post-mortem”.
description_web: Nervous about teaching? Want to share what you know and feel good about it afterwards? Covers planning, preparation, presentation, problems, publicity, and "post-mortem". For those who would like to improve their classes, as well as those who have never taught but want to. Instructor has 25+ years of classroom experience.

name: AEthelmearc Exchequers' Roundtable
description_book: Meeting for AEthelmearc Exchequers and anyone interested in the office. We will also be discussing the PA Subsidiary during this meeting.
description_web: Meeting for AEthelmearc Exchequers and anyone interested in the office. We will also be discussing the PA Subsidiary during this meeting.

name: Learn to Shoot a Crossbow
description_book: Taught by Forester Joshua Frost. Starts in Archery tent. Covers equipment, usage, practice on range.
description_web: Taught Forester Joshua Frost, Master Crossbowman. Covers parts, construction, inspection, distance, usage, aiming. Starts in the Archery Class tent, then moves to the Novelty Range.

name: Fabric 101
description_book: Overview of period-appropriate fabrics, fabric use, fabric types; identifying fabric using a burn test or chemical test. Hands-on.

name: Beginning Archery - 14 and Under
description_book: Taught by Forester Captain Liam. Learn the how to shoot, etiquette, and parts of the bow and arrow. For ages 2-14 years only. Meet at Family Range.
description_web: For beginners who are between ages 2 to 14. This class will be offered twice on the Family Range on Monday and Tuesday from 9 to 11 am.  Learn how to shoot, rules of the range, etiquette of the range, parts of the bow and arrows.  Bring your own bows and arrows. Some loaners are available for this class. Taught by Forester Captain Liam.

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: How Hot Is It?
description_book: A hands-on lab experience where we explore the actual temperatures various cooking methods produce.
description_web: A hands-on lab experience where we explore the actual temperatures various cooking methods produce. Discussion and experimentation to teach ourselves how to gauge temperature without using modern thermometers and measuring devices.

name: Beginning Bobbin Lace
description_book: Three-day class for a total of 9 hours. Learn the basic movements and make a basic project. Start a period pattern.
description_web: This is a three-day class for a total of 9 hours of bobbin lace! First Day: Students will learn the basic movements of bobbin lace and begin a project. Second Day: Students will finish the project and learn some simple grounds. Third Day: Students will begin a period pattern from *The Nuew Modelbuch*.
fee_itemization: $30 – One-time fee for all three days. Includes pillow with cover, bobbin holder, 10 pair of bobbins, pins, handout, patterns

name: Designing Armory from Period Examples
description_book: Want to have a device that might have existed in the Middle Ages? This class will help you design period-style arms by looking at period examples.
description_web: Thinking about a device but don't really know what you want? Want to have something that might have existed in the Middle Ages? This class will tell you how to design core-style arms by looking at period examples (many of which are online) and borrowing ideas, all within the standards of the Society.

name: Italian Painted Books
description_book: Discussion of the "tavoletta di biccherna", painted account books from Sienna, including history, structure, and decoration. Instructions included.
description_web: The "tavoletta di biccherna" are wood-board account books from Sienna, Italy, decorated with painted scenes and heraldry. We'll review the historical context, structure, and decoration of these unique books. Handout contains photos of extant covers and complete instructions for making your own book.

name: Breastfeeding Support  Group
description_book: Are you pregnant or nursing & would like support? Please come. Nursing kids, IBCLC, La Leche Leaders, LCs, Counselors. Late is ok.
description_web: Breast-feeders, unite. Come join us If you are pregnant or nursing (any age child) or if you are a support person or educator. You are welcome to come, hang out and learn about breastfeeding and overcoming issues. Sometimes we all need help when we are working through issues like heat, growth spurts, teething, first foods and weaning. This is a casual group. If you have learned something about breastfeeding, and you think it would benefit others, please feel free to share it. If you are an IBCLC, LC, Support Counselor, Educator, La Leche League leader or associate, please come and provide your support.

name: Medieval Horse Equipment
description_book: Explore the variety of equipment used on horses in the medieval period, with an emphasis on research from period sources.
description_web: This class will explore the variety of equipment used on horses in the medieval period, with an emphasis on research from period sources. The discussion will focus on sources available for the researcher interested in making historically accurate equipment or  the scholar seeking information on the subject.

name: The Fairy Tale and Legend Workshop
description_book: Will review period instances and sources of fairy tales and legends, and show how to re-construct tales which could have been told in period.
description_web: In this class, we will go briefly over the history and definitions of fairy tales and legends, instances of fairy tales in period, how to look for period sources of both, and how to identify and use motifs to construct/reconstruct tales which could have been told/recorded in period. The participants in the workshop will construct a fairy tale and a legend.

name: Beginning Kumihimo
description_book: Part 1: Learn the basics of Japanese braiding using the modern foam disk. Students will learn a round, square and flat braid.
description_web: Part 1: Learn the basics of Japanese braiding using the modern foam disk. Students will learn a round, square and flat braid. Uses for, history and names of braids will be discussed. Students may bring own equipment if desired.
fee_itemization: total class is 10.00 if just handout 3.00

name: Medieval French Poetry
description_book: An overview of medieval French lyric and narrative poetry, including a discussion of form and subject matter.
description_web: An overview of medieval French lyric and narrative poetry, including a discussion of form and subject matter, as well as craft concerns, while trying to use these forms in English. Intended for both the reader and the writer of poetry.

name: Introduction to Spinning Poi
description_book: In this one-hour workshop you will learn some of the basic poi movements and terminology necessary to get you started.
description_web: In this one-hour workshop you will learn some of the basic poi movements and terminology necessary to get you started. Poi spinning is a great low-impact workout that will help you to improve your coordination and give your fitness routine some "flare"! After paying for their first class, students are welcome to return to subsequent classes free of charge!
fee_itemization: $20.00 Material Fee covers handout, poi, and refreshments

name: Intro to *Temari* - Japanese Embroidery Balls
description_book: Temari balls are wrapped, stitched, and woven into beautiful, colorful patterns that are impressive out of all proportion with how easy they are.
description_web: *Temari* dates to about 800 CE. They are based on simple geometry (almost no math needed) and wrapped, stitched, or woven to form patterns over the whole ball. This is a great art for the impatient, as each stitch visibly develops the pattern, and you can easily pick it up or put it down at any time. Best of all, they are impressive out of all proportion with how easy they are! The class will cover basic construction and marking and students will leave with one ball well underway.
fee_itemization: materials to complete one ball, plus enough to begin several more

name: Coptic/Greek Book Binding
description_book: New this year, wood-covered book with exposed stitching in 6th-12th-C style.  Day-long class, with handout and sample to take home.
description_web: New this year! Coptic/Greek book binding that was popular from the 6th to the 12th centuries in the Middle East and Europe. Students will make their own sample book in this day-long class. No prior knowledge necessary, but will make it easier to do. All materials and tools provided by the instructor.
fee_itemization: Fee includes wood covers, paper for blank book, needles & thread to sew with, and a detailed handout.

name: Beginning Reed Basket Class
description_book: Learn the fundamentals of making a reed basket; make and take a small basket utilizing a wooden base technique.
description_web: Students will learn the fundamentals of making a reed basket. Individuals will make and take a small basket utilizing a wooden base technique.

name: Happy Japanese Games
description_book: Three leisure games of Japan will be discussed. Reproductions of each game will be available to play for the duration of class.
description_web: Three leisure games of Japan will be discussed. Reproductions of each game will be available to play for duration of class. May not be appropriate for small children; some game pieces can be a choking hazard.

name: Forging Fire Steels
description_book: This class will show how to forge and heat treat several different types of fire steels for starting fires with flint and steel.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching.
description_web: During this ten-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and mundanely. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: Known World Choir Rehearsal
description_book: Join the oldest Pennsic Choir as we rehearse in preparation for a concert Aug 1. We will perform some music in tribute to Owain Phyfe.
description_web: The Known World Choir, along with the Children's and Youth Choirs, the Debatable Choir, Chorulus Pennsicus, and other guests will present a concert of medieval and Renaissance choral literature. As part of their repertoire, the Known World Choir will perform some songs in tribute to Owain Phyfe.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes & hat; leave from Univ. Point. **We are seeking teachers to help us continue this Pennsic tradition!**
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. **We are seeking teachers to help us continue this tradition, one of Pennsic's two longest-running classes!**

name: GKS 1005: The *Flateyjarbók*
description_book: An overview and introduction to manuscript # GKS 1005 - The *Flateyjarbók* - one of the most exquisite of the Icelandic manuscripts.
description_web: An overview and introduction to manuscript # GKS 1005 - The *Flateyjarbók* - one of the most exquisite of the Icelandic manuscripts. We will look at the book, its contents, and its illustrations. This class is a precursor to a more detailed class which will be offered next year.

name: Writing Mongolian Script
description_book: Opportunity to practice Classical and pre-Classical Mongol script. Some SCA titles will be practiced in Mongolian script.
description_web: Opportunity to practice Classical and pre-Classical Mongolian script. Some SCA titles will be practiced in Mongolian script.

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day.
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. 
Day 1- Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum
Day 2- Chiftitelli, Masmoudi
Day 3- Ayub, Malfouf
Day 4- Kashlimah and other strange stuff

name: Running an In Persona and/or Authentic Encampment
description_book: An open discussion of how to run and participate in an "in persona" and/or authentic encampment, for those who have done it or might like to try.

name: *Rað Rett Runar*: Runes for Your Persona
description_book: Learn about the variations in runic alphabets from Novgorod to Greenland, from 500 to 1400. Find the *futhark* that fits your persona!
description_web: Runic alphabets varied from 500 to 1400, from wood to paper, from Kiev to Greenland. Come learn about the evolution from the 24-rune to 16-rune alphabets, short twig versus long twig, "staveless" variants, and abbreviations.  Leave the *Elder Futhark* behind, and find the *futhark* that fits your persona.

name: Beyond the Rod: Beads from Other Glass Sources
description_book: Learn to make beads using materials other than glass rod. Eye protection required; safety glasses are fine. Advanced class. Adults only.
description_web: Learn to make beads using materials other than glass rod: stained glass sheet strips, pieces, cullet (chunks), and smalti (tesserae or mosiac pieces). Learn to break up chunks for frit, and how to make a bead with it. This is an advanced class so lampworking knowledge is vital. Eye protection required; safety glasses are fine. Sleeves must be tight or tied up, no open-toed shoes, and hair must be short or tied back; natural fiber clothing recommended.

name: Mythbusting Period Piracy
description_book: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined.
description_web: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined. Common myths and mistakes about piracy in the SCA period will be highlighted.

name: Building a Shaving Horse
description_book: This class will show various examples and construction techniques that will enable you to make a solid, long-lasting shaving bench.
description_web: If you are trying to make a chair, bow or barrel, a shaving horse is an essential tool. I have found over the years that horses can vary from being great to bordering on the dangerous. This class will show various examples and construction techniques that will enable you to make a solid, long-lasting bench. This class is also helpful for people who just want to build a simple camp bench.

name: Youth Class: Poetry for Performance
description_book: Learn how to write a short poem to perform at bardic circles and competitions.
description_web: This class will look at rhyming, epigrams, and non-rhyming poetry. We will write some short, amusing poems that you can perform at bardic circles, in competitions or just for fun. This class is geared for children but aspiring poets of all ages are welcome. All youth require a responsible adult to be present.

name: *Memento Mori*
description_book: *Memento Mori*, the cult of a good death was intrinsic to the Spaniards. Examine its history, its effect on daily life, and Phillip II as an exemplar.
description_web: *Memento Mori*, the Spanish attitude toward death in the 16th century, focused on leading a good life and having a holy death. *Ars Moriendi* was a manual for preparing for this good, holy death. The death of Phillip II was considered an exemplar of the good death.

name: 12th-Century Mitten Stitch from Oslo
description_book: Another needle-binding stitch from an extant mitten. A hands-on class with materials and tools available for loan and purchase or bring your own.
description_web: Another needle-binding stitch useful for sturdy and warm clothing from an extant mitten dated to the 12th century. The class is hands-on. Yarn and needles are available both for loan and for purchase. Free handout. Handouts for previous stitches will also be available.
fee_itemization: $5 for the needle if you keep it. Borrowing is for free.

name: Ninja: Truth from Shadows
description_book: Dare you look into the shadows of history to find the truth? Come to discover both the legends and real history of Japan's famed assassins.
description_web: Dare you look into the shadows of history to find the truth? Come to discuss and discover the legends and real history of Japan's famed spies and assassins. This class will deconstruct the romanticized image of the Ninja and discuss the actual history of the world's most famous spies.

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Performing Arts Pavilion on Thursday afternoon of War Week. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.”

name: Fletching: Beginners
description_book: Taught by Lord Dearg (Midrealm).

name: Low, Slow, and Flirtatious: *Gioliva*
description_book: *Gioliva*: a *bassadanza* tale of courtship and window-shopping. Footwork to be taught, historical-cultural tidbits added for flavor; intermediate.

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a trim strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a trim strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: Beginning Illumination
description_book: You've got a blank piece of paper, so now what? This class will help you get started with illumination.
description_web: Scared of that blank piece of paper? Unsure where to start? This class will guide you though finding inspiration and using that to start a scroll blank.

name: Pennsic Food Lab
description_book: Semi-permanent cooking lab where we will use non-modern materials and techniques (pottery, spit roasting, etc.).
description_web: Semi-permanent cooking lab where we will use non-modern materials and techniques (pottery, spit roasting, etc.). The purpose of this class will be to provide cooks with the infrastructure and tools to try medieval cooking techniques by eliminating modern conveniences and equipment. Medieval pottery will be available to work in on a limited, pre-arranged basis. A basic larder will be available, but cooks are encouraged to come with recipes and ingredients that they would like to try. This is a hands-on play session in a laboratory style environment. Children are welcome if accompanied by an adult.
fee_itemization: Fee will cover fuel and basic larder ingredients.

name: Known World Celebration of Hats: A Hatter's Tea
description_book: Known World hat enthusiasts are cordially invited to join us for a tea & cookies reception. A chance to share your hats, ideas and creativity.
description_web: Hat enthusiasts of the Known World are cordially invited to join us for a tea & cookies reception Wear the hat creation you are most proud of and bring pictures of the rest and share your ideas and creativity.

name: Arts Patronage in the Renaissance Court
description_book: A description of the historical relationship between artist and patron, from musicians in the Tudor courts to the visual arts in Italy.

name: 12th-Century Women's Clothing
description_book: An overview of 12th-C women's clothing, including the elusive bliaut.
description_web: An overview of 12th-C women's clothing, including the elusive bliaut. This class examines period sources outside of the Chartres Portal Sculpture box to explore how women's clothing was made in the 12th century.

instructor: THL Isabelle de Montreuil sur Mer
name: How to Teach at a University or Schola
description_book: Looking to turn your passion into a class? Come learn from experienced teachers how to teach at events and draw in students with similar interests!
description_web: Looking to turn your passion into a class? Come learn from experienced teachers how to teach at events and draw in students with similar interests! This class will feature a panel of experienced teachers to share their tips and tricks on lesson plans, event selection, and engaging the audience when teaching a class. There will be time at the end for questions and answers, and experienced teachers are encouraged to attend as well to share what tips they may have.

name: Pastries and Cookies from the 1549 *Banchetti*
description_book: Cheese pastry stars, rich raisin pastries, and sugar and cinnamon cookies from the 1549 Italian cookbook *Banchetti*, by Cristoforo di Messisbugo.

name: Variations on a Theme II: *l'Homme Armé*
description_book: Play polyphonic settings of one of the Greatest Hits of the 15th century, which became the basis for over 40 Masses. For recorders and strings.
description_web: Fifteenth-century Franco-Flemish *chansons* were frequently based on "pop tunes" of the day. We will play polyphonic settings of one of the Greatest Hits of the 15th century as realized by some of the greatest composers, with an emphasis on Mass settings. For recorders, viols and other period soft instruments.

name: Beginning Bottom-Whorl Drop Spindle
description_book: Create unique yarns on the bottom-whorl drop spindle. Spinning, plying, and helpful process tips will be discussed.
description_web: Create unique yarns on the bottom-whorl drop spindle. Spinning, plying, and helpful process tips will be discussed. Use 'student spindles' or bring your own. For older children (age 12 and up with parent) and adults.

name: SCA and the ADA
description_book: How does the ADA (Americans with Disabilities Act) apply to the SCA?  What to do and how to do it as well as what not to do.
description_web: How does the ADA (Americans with Disabilities Act) apply to the SCA?  What to do and how to do it as well as what not to do. If you are autocrating an event, or just wondering what your options are under the ADA, you can find the answers here.

name: Divination: Omens, Portents, Astrology
description_book: Divination using omens, signs, and portents found in nature, with emphasis on the queen of the divinatory arts: astrology.
description_web: Divination using omens, signs, and portents found in nature, with emphasis on the queen of the divinatory arts: astrology.

name: Iron Commedia: Creating a New 16th-Century Play
description_book: Join actors from your favorite improvisational *Commedia dell'Arte* troupes to craft, cast, perform, & premier a brand-new play in just one afternoon!
description_web: If you've ever laughed at the zany antics of improvisational *Commedia dell'Arte*, join members from your favorite troupes to craft, cast, and perform a brand new *commedia* play in just one afternoon with its world premier at at Pennsic! Peace Week's Iron *Commedia* will premier during the *Commedia* Experience Expo on the Middle Friday, and War Week's Iron *Commedia* will premier 5:00 pm on the same day at the PAP! Put a mask on; see what happens!

name: Intro to Mimed Bransles
description_book: An introductory look at mimed bransles including favorites such as *Washerwoman's, Peas, Hermits, Clogs, Horses, & Montarde.*
description_web: An introductory look at a collection of Arbeau's mimed bransles from *Orchésographie* including favorites such as Washerwoman’s ( *B. les Lavandieres*), Peas ( *B. de Pois*), Hermits ( *B. des Hermites*), Clogs ( *B. des Sabots*), Horses ( *B. des Chevaux*), and Montarde ( *B. de la Montarde*).

name: Beginning *Repoussé* & Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Known World Children's Choir
description_book: The Known World Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.
description_web: The Known World Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.

instructor: Viscountess Kamiilah al Sudanii um Zoom
name: Intermediate Middle Eastern Dance Combos
description_book: Kamiilah will be teaching some of her favorite combinations of movements, and her own style of lead-and-follow dance! If we have time we will zill!
description_web: Kamiilah is the fearless leader of modern dance troupe RockaBelly, and is ready to share her sassy lead-and-follow combos with all of you! If we have time we will also learn zill patterns specific to the movements.

name: Choosing An SCA Registerable Name
description_book: What will work and what likely won't when choosing an SCA name the College will register.
description_web: Names are important. They are often the first thing other people have to form an opinion of us. We can invest a lot of time and emotion in coming up with a name. However, if it doesn't follow reasonable historical practice or general SCA standards, it won't be registered. In this class we'll discuss what the SCA requires in a name, what was generally historically done, and how to avoid heartache over your desired name.

name: Mead Begins with Bees
description_book: Class covers site selection, reference material sources, basic equipment needed to set up an apiary, all before you get your bees.

name: Theories on the Pictish Symbol Stones
description_book: A roundtable discussion on theories surrounding the meanings of the Pictish symbol stones. Bring research and theories or just come to listen.
description_web: The Pictish symbol stones may contain information about Pictish marriages, land ownership, dates of certain occurrences, and now the theory that it may be an actual language. We will have a brief history of the stones and then a roundtable discussion about them. Bring your research and your theories or just come to listen.

name: Cartridge Pleating for Voluminous Skirting
description_book: Hands-on creating and attaching voluminous skirting to *gamurra* bodices or other period clothing requiring cartridge pleating.

instructor: THL Isabelle de Montreuil sur Mer
name: What Can Your University Do for You?
description_book: Do you have suggestions for the East Kingdom University? Come join a roundtable discussion on what you’d like to see in the EKU.
description_web: Do you have suggestions for the East Kingdom University? Are you interested in helping out with the East Kingdom University?  Come join a roundtable discussion on what you’d like to see in the EKU! We will discuss potential event ideas, as well as ways you'd like to see the East Kingdom University become involved beyond University Events. Gentles from other Kingdoms are also welcome to attend to discuss what makes the University in your Kingdom great, or gather information on how to expand your local university.

name: Viking Ornamentation: Viking Treasure Necklace
description_book: Participants review historical evidence, then create their own Viking-era treasure necklace.
description_web: Participants review historical evidence, then create their own Viking-era treasure necklace. You may wish to bring one focal bead, medallion, or Thor's hammer. Small site tokens also work well. **Or** just come string beads with Brigitta! For older children (age 12 and up with parent) and adults.

name: But Mom, I Don't Want to Sing in English
description_book: Period music for solo performers, or for the crazy singing in Latin around your campfire. We will review the main sources for songs, and sing a few.
description_web: Period music for solo performers, or for that crazy singing in Latin around your campfire. We will review the main sources for songs ( *Carmina Burana*, *Cantigas de Santa Maria*, *Llibre Vermell de Montserrat*, etc), sing a few, and discuss helpful hints to your success. Meant not just for those of bardic inclination, but for anyone wanting to learn period songs.

name: Intermediate Sprang: Holes & Patterns
description_book: Learn to make simple patterns of fixed holes in sprang. Must already know basic sprang warping and twists.
fee_itemization:
20 page handout
yarn, sticks, needle
frames available or bring your own.

name: Cooking from Period Sources
description_book: How to start with a recipe that was written in period and end up with a dish that is consistent with that recipe and tastes good.
description_web: How to start with a recipe that was written in period and end up with a dish that is consistent with that recipe and tastes good. Also a discussion of available sources for recipes.

name: Rethinking SCA Events
description_book: Let's take a strategic look at SCA events to identify how we can create new opportunities at events to adapt to current trends and membership needs.
description_web: It is important to take a critical look at how we run SCA events to make sure that they are not only reflecting the mission of the SCA in general, but the needs and desires of our local and regional groups. This class will take a strategic look at SCA events to identify how we can create new opportunities in our event structures to adapt to current trends and membership needs.

name: "But I Can't Read That!" Using Non-English Sources
description_book: A class on tools for doing research in foreign languages. Focus will be primarily on alphabetic rather than pictographic languages.
description_web: This class will be taught jointly with Lady Judith bas Rabbi Mendel. If you have ever been frustrated by finding that the perfect reference to document your project is in a language you don't know, this class is for you. We'll be talking about using online translation web sites, dictionaries, and many other tools that can help you to understand and use foreign language resources. While we will briefly touch on pictographic languages like Chinese and Japanese, our focus will be on languages written with alphabets.

name: *Shukyo*: Samurai Religion
description_book: An introduction to pre-modern Japanese religious and magical beliefs and practices.
description_web: An introduction to pre-modern Japanese religious and magical beliefs and practices.

name: A Playford Scramble: Three Dances to Move You
description_book: Be prepared to ask "Who's my partner, and where are we going?" in this exploration of direction-changing, partner-changing, and progression dances.
description_web: Be prepared to ask "Who's my partner, and where are we going?" in this exploration of direction-changing, partner-changing, and progression dances. Some familiarity with basic English Country dance is helpful but not necessary. Halfe Hannikin, Maiden Lane, and Cuckolds All A Row will be taught.

name: The Game of Tarot
description_book: A simple trick-taking card game played with a Tarot deck.
description_web: A simple trick-taking card game played with a Tarot deck.

name: Known World Youth Choir
description_book: The Known World Youth Choir is open to youth age 12-18 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.
description_web: The Known World Youth Choir is open to youth age 12-18 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.

name: Writing Between the Lines: Ames Lettering Guide
description_book: Hands-on class for beginning and intermediate calligraphers on using the Ames Lettering Guide to improve your scribal technique and scroll layout.
description_web: Are your miniscules misconstrued? Do your descenders dangle? Do you struggle with getting the words to line up straight across the paper? Are you ready to go beyond light table calligraphy? This is a hands-on class for beginning and intermediate calligraphers on using the Ames Lettering Guide to improve your scribal technique and scroll layout.
fee_itemization: Ames Lettering Guide, hard lead pencil, practice paper

name: Animal Beads Theory
description_book: How to make animals of glass. Planning a design, making the right stringers and deciding in what order to do things.
description_web: How to make animals of glass. Planning a design, making the right stringers and deciding in what order to do things. We discuss the pros and cons of different shapes, and I share some tips and tricks about making different shapes with very basic tools. It´s good to bring pen and paper to be able to draw ideas.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Court, Improv, and a Deck of Cards
description_book: Baronial or Royal Court as improv theatre; using a deck of index cards and some preparation to make it all run smoothly.
description_web: Court is both a planned experience and improv theatre all at once. This class will discuss one method of putting together Court - either Baronial or Royal - from an Eastern point of view, using a deck of index cards and a bit of preparation. We will discuss how to address the needs of your nobles, the protocol of who stands where in the Procession, how to move people around the stage, ways to lay out the court docket, and how to adapt to changes in the middle of Court..

name: Meet the Board and Corporate Officers
description_book: Members of the Board of Directors and Corporate Staff answer your Society-level questions. All are welcome.
description_web: Have questions about life at the Society level? Wonder what it would be like to hold such a position? Members of the Board of Directors and Corporate Staff will be available to answer these questions and more. All are welcome.

name: Venetian Patrician Women's Dress - 1540 to 1600
description_book: This is a discussion group about patrician women's dress of the mid- to late-16th-C Venice.
description_web:
We will chat about things that make up the dress of the patrician women of the mid- to late-cinquacento Venice. Feel free to offer your opinions.  
http://oonaghsown.blogspot.com.au/2013/04/venice-patrician-society-in-renaissance.html
http://webspace.webring.com/people/lo/oonaghsown/Academic.html
http://webspace.webring.com/people/lo/oonaghsown/venetian_dress.htm
http://webspace.webring.com/people/lo/oonaghsown/Technically_Naked/

name: Women's Fashion of the French Renaissance
description_book: Come learn how French women's fashion evolved during the 16th century and the influences that caused this evolution.
description_web: Sixteenth-century fashion...that's what ladies wore at Queen Elizabeth's court, right? Well, not if you were at the French Court! Come see what French ladies were wearing during this time. Learn how French women's fashion evolved during the 16th century and the influences that caused this evolution.

name: Period Islamic Cooking
description_book: A description of a wide range of recipes from period Islamic cookbooks, along with a discussion of the available sources.

name: 16th-C  English Monochrome Embroidery: Blackwork
description_book: This class will focus on Elizabethan "blackwork" embroidery. This is *not* a how-to class; it is a lecture/discussion.
description_web: This class will focus on Elizabethan "blackwork" embroidery. This is *not* a how-to class; it is a lecture/discussion. We will examine extant examples and discover what late-16th English monochrome embroidery really is and, perhaps more importantly, what it is not. Fee applies if keeping handout; handouts available for class use and electronically.
fee_itemization: Handout available electronically; if keeping hard copy, donation of $4 is requested.

name: Beginning Viking Wire Weaving
description_book: Students will learn to make intricate chains in the manner of the Vikings and other cultures, without need for heat or complicated tools.
description_web: This class will teach beginning students to make intricate chains in the manner of the Vikings and other ancient cultures, without the need for heat or complicated tools. With the techniques presented, you will learn to create items like the ones found in Viking burials and treasure hoards across the Nordic countries dating from the 9th century to the late 12th century. Wire chains made in this fashion have also been discovered in the British Isles (875 AD) and in the Roman, Greek and Byzantine civilizations from the 4th century BC to the 1st century AD. Timeless items can be created that are still beautiful and wearable today. If you have needle-nose pliers and wire cutters, please bring them. If you need glasses for close or small work, please bring them. The fee for the class includes the materials needed to complete the leather cord necklace. To view this unique jewelry, please visit www.AncientWire.com/book.htm

name: Arrow Tuning
description_book: How to tune your arrows so they are all even with spline and weight. Taught by Lord Richard (Midlands, MK).

name: Katana for SCA Combat
description_book: This is a non-armored class to show how Japanese single sword can be used in SCA armored combat.
description_web: This is a non-armored class to show how Japanese single sword can be used in SCA armored combat. Topics such as defense, attack, movement and proper thought will be covered.

name: Beginner Dance: Absolute Beginner Dance
description_book: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We’ll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the ball!
description_web: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We’ll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the ball! No partners required.

name: Tarot and other Period Card Games
description_book: Games Tent staff teach a variety of period card games, then we play. Games may include "The Game of Tarot", "Losing Lodum", "Laugh and Lie Down".
description_web: Games Tent staff teach a variety of period card games. Games taught may include "The Game of Tarot", "Losing Lodum", "Laugh and Lie Down". Time for play will follow.

name: Dance of the Drum
description_book: This class focuses on blending and weaving various rhythms into a musical whole by learning to listen and, just as important, how NOT to listen.
description_web: The key to drumming and truly understanding the rhythms involved is to Have Fun! This is what separates the technically skilled musicians and artists from the great ones, the ones who can move you in ways you didn't think possible because they are having fun and letting go of ego. This class focuses on blending and weaving various rhythms into a musical whole by learning to listen and, just as important, how NOT to listen. Dancers, drummers, singers and musical instruments welcome.

name: The SCA's Greatest Hits
description_book: An overview of some of the most popular songs and singers in the SCA available on CD or as downloads. There will be recorded music and information.
description_web: An overview of some of the most popular songs and singers in the SCA available on CD or as downloads. Artists will incude Heather Dale, John Inchingham, Hector of the Black Height, Ken Theriot, Lisa Theriot, Lorelei Skye, Efenwealt Whystle, Baldwin of Erebor, Aneleda Falconbridge and a host of Calontiri. There will be others, too. (Two hours, but you'll get a lot if you can just stay one hour.)

name: Where Have All the Microtones Gone?
description_book: We're going to take songs you already know and help you get the microtones into them. Come to class with a lot of patience and desire for E-half-flat.

name: Animal Beads Practice
description_book: Making animal-shaped beads of glass, from dragons to sheep. This is an advanced class; feel free to bring tools you feel comfortable with.
description_web: Making animal-shaped beads of glass, from dragons to sheep, using and pulling different kind of stringers. Forming glass with gravity and tools. This is an advanced class. Feel free to bring tools you feel comfortable with, preferably a pair of tweezers and something pointy!

name: From Text to Voice
description_book: Converting traditional tales from text to oral form and why there's a difference.
description_web: Traditional stories from around the world have been recorded in writing, but the forms used by writers differ from those we use orally. This class addresses reasons why writers' versions vary from both the oral forms and each other, and how to give them voice. Students will have opportunity to retell stories during class; books will be available for reference but you are welcome and encouraged to bring a story you'd like to play with.

name: Building Scrolls Without a Book of Hours
description_book: What? No Book of Hours? Yes! Learn how to use period artwork to build scrolls and break into a new area of creativity.

name: Beginning *Naalbinding*, and How to Make a Mitten
description_book: Learn how to do the basic Oslo stitch, increasing and decreasing stitches. Then put it all together and learn to make a mitten.
description_web: There are many different *naalbinding* stitches. The Oslo stitch is a common one used to make mittens. Come learn to do the stitch, and then put it all together and make a mitten.
fee_itemization: The handout is 10 pages, and includes some color pictures. The kit includes a naalbinding needle and wool yarn ball.

instructor: Lady Angharad verch Glyndwr O Llang
name: Basic Jewelry-Making, or How to Float a Pearl
description_book: Basics on design/recreation of jewelry including closures, spacing, double/triple strands, scalloping, extra adornments, fixing broken items.
description_web: Basics on design or recreation of jewelry including closures, spacing, double/triple strands, achieving scalloping, adding extra adornments, fixing a broken item, making a floating bead necklace, dropping a knot where you want it.
fee_itemization: handout, kit with wire, string, beads, trinkets, closures

name: Russian Hats and Headdresses
description_book: A look at the different types of hats seen in Russia in SCA period, including construction techniques in period, and how to recreate them.
description_web: Come and learn about the wide variety of elaborate hats worn by both women and men in Russia during the medieval era. We'll look at the different styles and terminology, plus discuss construction techniques in period, and how to recreate these pieces.

name: Horn Carving
description_book: We will discuss horn variety, selection, stripping, layout, carving and treating your horn. **Some hands-on**; bring tools!!!
description_web: We will discuss horn variety, selection, stripping, layout, carving and treating your horn. We will have some hands-on for those interested; please bring a very sturdy, short, sharp, carving blade. I do not have horns available; however, I will have practice pieces there for you to play with. You may purchase horns on site, but after the class you will have a better idea of what to look for. Primarily Norse-style work.

name: History of Drinking: Common Medieval Drinks
description_book: History of drinks and how they affected society & culture. Includes samples & recipes of common drinks found in the Middle Age & SCA. Over 21 only.
description_web: A look at the history of drinks, especially those in the between 3rd-16th centuries and how they affected society and culture. Class will include samples (and recipes) of the most common drinks found in the Middle Ages (and in the SCA). No instruction on brewing provided. Over 21 only.

name: Feast Planning: Learn to Love Your Lists
description_book: How do you turn a menu into a feast? Planning is the key to a great experience for everyone involved. We will walk through a feast from start to end.
description_web: How do you turn a menu into a feast? Planning is the key to keeping your sanity, creating an excellent reputation for reliability, generating buzz for your event, and having a great time doing it. This class will give you the right questions to ask, and tools and techniques to help you keep your cool.

name: Introduction to Target Archery
description_book: The first steps. No loaner gear; must bring own gear, however multiple people may share, or come as you are to observe and learn.
description_web: A class for those that are interested in target archery but don't know where to get started. Bow safety, line etiquette and the steps to the first shots. This class will be held on the archery range. There is no loaner gear available. You may attend without gear to learn and observe, but if you want to shoot you must bring gear. However, multiple people can share gear, provided it is appropriate in size and weight for all.

name: Beginner Dance: 16th-Century Italian Dance
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps & patterns and then learn a simple, late 16th-C Italian dance, *Fiamma d'Amore*.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class starts with basic steps and patterns and then teaches a simple, late 16th-C Italian dance, *Fiamma d'Amore*.

name: Card Games
description_book: This class will review the card games previously taught and let you practice playing them with an instructor's assistance.
description_web: This class will review the card games previously taught and let you practice playing them with an instructor's assistance.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: The continuation of the work begun in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.

name: Needle-Woven Pouch
description_book: A simple needle-weaving method and loom for creating a woven pouch or bag.
description_web: A simple needle-weaving method and loom for creating a woven pouch or bag. Loom & string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Advanced Doumbek: Turkish Split Finger
description_book: Want to increase your speed, volume, and ability while using less energy? Then this class is for you. Straight from Istanbul, split finger!
description_web: This class will focus on development and strengthening of the split hand technique and its applications. Come prepared to play.

name: The Compleat Cook - and Other Pet Peeves
description_book: A participatory discussion about feasts and food with possible rants about things that go wrong, hosted by an opinionated Laurel.

name: So You Want to Be a (Book) Herald? Part III-Names
description_book: An introduction to name registration in the SCA. Covers the basics of researching a name and SCA rules. Parts I and II are not prerequisites.
description_web: Interested in heraldry? Want to be involved with device or name submissions?  This three-part class introduces the basics of book heraldry for the non-(book) herald. Part III covers the basics of names, the SCA rules governing name construction, and basic name research. The three parts of the course are not prerequisites for each other.

name: Ditch that Dome!
description_book: How to shop for a period pavilion: practical considerations and planning tips. Spend your money wisely & end up a happy camper.
description_web: Tired of hiding your home-away-from-home behind decorative walls or other peoples' pavilions? Ready to move up to canvas and wood, or looking to downsize from that polefarm? Before you plunk down your cash or invest copious hours in project time, let one OCD tent-shopper share what she learned after making her first tent and buying her second tent. Practical considerations and planning tips covering types of tents, ease of transport and assembly, make-vs-buy, what you'll use it for, and how big your tent should be. Tents appropriate for your persona will be very briefly touched on, but this is mostly a nuts & bolts brain dump of assessing options and determining feasibility of portable structures.

name: Bardic Collegium: The Crowd-Sourcing Muse Workshop
description_book: Bring a story, song or other bardic piece that you're having trouble completing. Our panel of bards will act as your collective muse.
description_web: You're stuck. It's a great piece, or it could be. You've got an ending but no beginning, a beginning but no end, or a missing middle. Or you don't know where to take the plot or the imagery. Or maybe it's just an idea and you have no idea what form (song? story? poem? or what kind of song, story or poem?) it should take. The bards of the Known World will gather to be your collective muse and brainstorm with you.

name: Babies at Pennsic: A Discussion
description_book: How to deal with babies and small children at Pennsic: a discussion by and for those who have done it, are doing it, or will do it.

name: Care and Feeding of Your Army/Fighter
description_book: The army is more than just those on the field. It is also the staff that supports them. We will talk about how to support them all.
description_web: The army is more than just those on the field. It is also the staff that supports them. We will discuss things to do and items to bring to help support your army at large or your fighter.

name: Archaeology of a Byzantine Shipwreck
description_book: A Byzantine cargo ship sank off the coast of Yassi Ada (Turkey) in circa AD 626. Excavation strategy, cargo and ship construction will be discussed.
description_web: Description and discussion of the Yassi Ada shipwreck that sank in circa AD 626 off the coast of Turkey. Cargo & ship construction will be discussed. Cargo included a large number of storage jars, kitchen cook pots, coins, iron tools, etc.
fee_itemization: Photocopies of the diagnostic artifacts discussed in class.

name: Fight with All Your Strength: Explosive Strength
description_book: Fine-tune strength for high-speed power. Plyometrics for the lower body, trunk and upper body are covered as well as sandbag exercises, shot put, etc.
description_web: This class builds on the previous strength classes to fine-tune strength for high-speed power. Plyometrics for the lower body, trunk and upper body are covered as well as sandbag exercises, shot put and javelin. A limited number of participants will also be able to get hands-on instruction. Learn more at http://fightwithallyourstrength.blogspot.com/

name: Viking Age Feast Gear: The Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of feast gear and cookware options from among the archaeological finds of the Old Norse World. 43-page handout is available.
description_web: A survey of feast gear and cookware options from among the archaeological finds of the Old Norse World. We will look at items from Birka, Gotland, Oseberg, and other sites. 43-page handout is available.

name: Pennsic Homes, Part 2: Tour
description_book: A tour of  Pennsic Homes, followed by a group discussion/meet & greet at a lovely private camp. Follow up to slideshow class. Bring your Pennsic map.
description_web: A tour of some of the Pennsic Homes, followed by a group discussion/meet & greet at a lovely private camp. Follow up to slideshow class on Thursday. Please bring your Pennsic booklet/map to mark down locations that you can visit that we didn't see.

name: Middle Eastern Music and Dance
description_book: A time for people of all skill levels to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. All instruments are welcome, and loaner drums are available!
description_web: A time for people interested in Middle Eastern music and dance to come together to learn, share, play, and dance. We will be providing instruction appropriate to the interest of the attendees, from beginning Middle Eastern drum and belly dance to teaching songs in which everyone can participate. All skill levels and instruments are welcome, and drums are available for borrowing!

name: *Amoroso* by the Book
description_book: *Amoroso* is a fun dance from 15th-C. Italy that appears in two manuscripts. Learn both versions as well as the common SCA version.

name: Pennsic Dance Band Practice
description_book: Attention, musicians: Come learn the tunes for the Grand Ball at Pennsic! Music will be provided. All instruments and skill levels are welcome.
description_web: The Grand Ball at Pennsic needs musicians! Come learn the tunes for the dances that will be in the ball. Music will be provided. Players of all instruments at any skill level are welcome.

name: Come and Get Your Fill
description_book: Take your doumbek rhythms to the next level! This class focuses on playing "Fills" and filled versions of popular Middle Eastern rhythms.
description_web:
Take your darbuka/doumbek rhythms to the next level! This intermediate class will help you begin to play filled versions of popular Middle Eastern rhythms. Then you will learn to play fills in between phrases/patterns to help you add even more style and texture to your playing.

Knowledge of basic Middle Eastern rhythms (i.e., *maqsoum*, *malfuf*, *ayoub*, *saidi*) and intermediate darbuka playing experience/technique are strongly recommended.

name: Stringer, Twisties and Frit - Oh My!
description_book: Hands-on class: How make stringer, twisties and frit to use on glass beads. Must have taken at least a basic class on bead making.
description_web: Hand- on class: How make stringer, twisties and frit to use on glass beads. We will start with a basic one-color stringer and progress into multicolored and complex stringer. Student *must* have taken at least a basic class on bead making or have experience with hot glass.

name: History and Techniques of Drawn-thread Work
description_book: Covers the history and techniques of drawn thread work, or *Punto Turati*. Students will create a sample piece including each technique.
description_web: This class will cover the history of drawn thread work, or *Punto Turati*, as well as the techniques involved in both the creation of the base fabric and the period stitches used for the final design. Students will create a sample piece to demonstrate each technique.

name: Medieval Business Practices
description_book: Explore the roots of modern business and the source behind the business records we frequently use in our research.
description_web: We're told that modern accounting practices started in the 13th century, and a lot of modern businesses have their roots in the Middle Ages. We use business records in research all the time. Are you curious to learn more about how business was done in the Middle Ages? So am I, so I decided to research it. Come see what I've learned!

name: Interrogating Your Museum
description_book: It's time to get more out of your museum. Find out what to ask, who to ask, and what to do with the answers once you have them.

name: The Fundamentals of Roman Dress
description_book: A seminar designed to enlighten aspiring patricians and plebeians alike on the traditional garments of Rome, their embellishments, and more.
description_web: Toga Party? Not quite! This is a seminar designed to enlighten aspiring patricians and plebeians alike on the traditional garments of Rome, their embellishments, and how not to look like you're simply wearing a bed sheet (most of them aren't long enough anyway.) Who was actually permitted to wear the toga? What's the different between a strophium and stola? How about an ecclesiastical pallium?! Come down and find out!

name: Butter 101
description_book: Learn to make butter, learn some basic history and chemistry of butter, and bring home some butter to your encampment! It's very easy!

name: Pennsic Without a Cooler
description_book: How to feed yourself period food at long camping events without the use of a cooler.

name: Knit Tech: Pattern Development
description_book: Those darned medieval knitters didn’t leave us written patterns! We will explore developing your own pattern to reproduce an extant item.
description_web: Those darned medieval knitters didn’t leave us written patterns for their pieces! We will explore how to go about developing your own pattern to reproduce an extant item, including the maths. Some understanding of knitting techniques and historical pieces is assumed, but all levels are welcome, including non-knitters with interest in the subject.

name: Writing for the Compleat Anachronist
description_book: How to write and submit a publication for the CA.

name: FAP: The Short Spear of *Fiore dei Liberi*
description_book: Freelance Academy Press presents a foundation for medieval polearm combat.
description_web:
Freelance Academy Press presents a foundation for medieval polearm combat.
Equipment: 6 - 7.5' Spear/polearm/staff, fencing mask or helmet.

name: Gresley Favourites
description_book: A selection of our favourite 15th-century English dances from the Gresley manuscript.
description_web: A selection of our favourite 15th-century English dances from the Gresley manuscript. These are dances for pairs and trios, and are easy to pick up for beginners.

instructor: Lady Nina Amaya of Bright Hills
name: Enchant with Your Dance
description_book: All levels. How to be an enchanting and memorable performer. Breath, movement, stillness, emotion, weight, tension... Use your moves for best effect!
description_web: For all levels - how to be an enchanting and memorable performer. Exercises in breath, movement, stillness, emotion, weight, tension... Use the moves you know to best effect. Write a visual poem in dance!

name: The Life of a Trade Bead
description_book: Discussion of the creation of a trade bead, where it may have traveled, and what it may have been used for. Handout supplied.

name: Brewing and Experimental Archaeology
description_book: Lessons learned from experimental archaeology with wine and beer will be discussed and tasted. Brave adults (over 21) only.
description_web: Lessons learned from experimental archaeology with wine and beer will be discussed and tasted. The discovery and excavation of a monastic winery at the archaeological site of Tell Tuneinir will be discussed including artifacts and inscriptions. Brewing examples with include a variety of herbed beers as well as wines (quince, herbed red wine, and poignant mead). Brave adults (over 21) only.

name: Guild of St. Severus (EK Knitters' Guild)
description_book: Welcome, knitters! Bring a project or a friend (or both) and join us to chat about knitting during SCA period.
description_web: Welcome, knitters! Bring a project or a friend (or both) and join us to chat about knitting during SCA period. Knitters of all levels and locations welcome!

name: Ball Prep
description_book: Want to dance at the ball, but have no or little idea how? This is the class for you! All steps will be taught, along with etiquette & survival tips.

name: Arts and Sciences 50 Challenge Social
description_book: Challengers old and new gather to chat, put faces to names, show off projects, and get excited about our A&S journeys in supportive, fun environment.

name: SCA Librarians' Roundtable
description_book: A gathering for librarians, library fans and bibliophiles. First half hour to be devoted to swapping research tips.
description_web: A gathering for librarians, library fans and bibliophiles. First half hour to be devoted to swapping research tips.

name: The Ancient Celtic Field Sport of Hurling
description_book: Hands-on class on the Celtic game of hurling: history, rules, drills. One-hr scrimmage depending on avail. loaner equip. A contact sport. 18 or older.
description_web: Hands-on class on the Celtic game of hurling: history, rules, drills. One-hour scrimmage depending on available loaner equipment. A contact sport. 18 years old or older only. BYO pads, cup, hockey helmet, etc., at own discretion. Bring your own water/sports drink. Hurley stick/ball available for purchase.

name: Youth Combat Open Field Activites
description_book: Open practice and games for youth fighters. Please check the on-line description or at the Youth Combat list field for more information.

name: Medieval Jewellery Slide Show
description_book: Photos from my collection and from museum study collections. Many new slides this year, and the usual biased instructor.

name: Clan Blue Feather Ball & Fashion Cotillion
description_book: Join Clan Blue Feather for the annual Ball & Fashion Cotillion. Food, fun, dancing, music, free raffle & prizes. Wear what makes you look your best!
description_web: Join Clan Blue Feather once again for their annual Ball & Fashion Cotillion. Food, fun, dancing, music, costumes, revelry, a free raffle and special prizes for the most fabulous garb. Remember, you don't have to wear your best garb; just wear what makes *you* look your best!

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: A general, multi-level yoga class to address the needs of the Pennsic attendee. Please dress for modesty, and bring a mat/towel or similar.
description_web: A general, multi-level yoga class to address the needs of the Pennsic attendee. Please dress for modesty, and bring a mat/towel or similar. Children responsible enough to follow along are welcome.

name: Chirurgeon Orientation
description_book: Orientation for those wishing to volunteer at First Aid Point at Pennsic.

name: Introduction to Mounted Archery
description_book: This is an introductory class on mounted archery. Covers the basics of the activity, how to get involved, equipment commonly used and training.
description_web: One of the fastest growing areas of equestrian activity in the SCA, archery from horseback, has been practiced since ancient times. This is an introductory class to the equestrian activity referred to in the SCA as Mounted Archery. It covers the basics of the activity, how to get involved, equipment commonly used and training the horse and archer. No experience necessary, but a familiarity with your own Kingdom's rules for this activity will be helpful as any rules covered will be specific to AEthelmearc.

name: The Scottish Great Kilt as SCA Garb
description_book: History of the Great Kilt. How to make and wear a kilt, proper accessories, etc.

name: 16th-Century Lady's Overdress
description_book: Overview of the doublet overdress common in Europe for women. Who wore it, where did it start, and why was it popular. Pattern and construction tips.
description_web: This is an overview of the doublet-style overdress common throughout Europe for women. Who wore it, types of fabric, where did this start, and why was it popular. Includes directions towards pattern(ing), and construction techniques tips.

name: Arrow Makers' Guild: Build Your Own Arrows
description_book: Build SCA wooden arrows for target shooting. Apply fletching, taper ends and put on points. Make self-nock or use plastic.
description_web: Build SCA wooden arrows for target shooting. Apply fletching, taper ends and put on points. Make self-nock or use plastic.
fee_itemization:
Wooden shaft
Feathers
Glue
Nocks
Points

name: Bread, Milk, Eggs: A Period Perspective
description_book: "The Essentials", viewed from medieval dietary perspective; how staples were acquired in various times and places.

name: Make a 14th-Century-Style Linen Hood
description_book: In three hours, you will have a fitted 14th-century-style linen hood.  Hands-on. Everything you need is in the kit.
description_web: The goal at the end of this class is to have a mid-14th-C-style hood completed (or almost completed). I will walk you through the hand-sewing of this fitted accessory (including doing a fitting for you to make sure your hood will fit *you*). Class includes instructions on how to make wad buttons (so your buttons will match your hood) - OR you may choose to purchase buttons from the many merchants at Pennsic. If you purchase buttons, please buy them before class and bring them with you. This way, you can make sure your buttonholes will be the correct size.
fee_itemization: 2-3 yards of linen, sewing thread, DMC thread, needles, pins, small scissors, seam ripper, chalk, handouts, ruler, paper to make a pattern

name: FAP: German Medieval Sword and Buckler
description_book: Freelance Academy Press presents use of the sword and buckler in German medieval combat.
description_web: Freelance Academy Press presents use of the sword and buckler in German medieval combat.

name: Intro to Egyptian-Style Group Improvisation
description_book: Learn basic Egyptian group improv dance with beledi-style combinations.
description_web: Rajni is a Certified Level 1 Tribal Odyssey dance leader, a group improvisational style developed by Kawakib of Fredericksburg, VA. In the words of Kawakib: “Tribal Odyssey uses natural posture and both sides of the body in combinations based primarily on Egyptian beledi-style movement. It's versatile enough to adapt to any size group.” Class will repeat to allow for several days of practice with a group, and will incorporate recorded Middle Eastern drumming as well as live music/ drumming as available. Learn moves that you and your dance friends can use at Pennsic haflas this year!

name: Bellatrix System: Wraps
description_book: A bio-mechanically safe "wrap", and complementary techniques. Unarmored class appropriate for all levels of proficiency.
description_web: The class teaches the Bellatrix version of the "wrap", which provides powerful wraps from various angles, while maintaining bio-mechanical safety. The class will touch on several techniques that appear to be a wrap until late in the swing. The class is appropriate for authorized fighters at all levels of proficiency. The class is taught unarmored. Students must bring a sword and a shield.

name: Fore-edge Decoration
description_book: Historical styles of decoration on the page edges of closed books, including discussion of preparing book edges for treatment.
description_web: Overview of styles of fore-edge decoration throughout period, including discussion of preparation, materials, and techniques.

name: A Tale of Two Tarts!
description_book: How apple pie changed over time. Comparing and contrasting 14th-C and 16th-C English apple pies.
description_web: A Tale of Two Tarts! How apple pie changed over time. Comparing and contrasting 14th-century and 16th-century English apple pies, discussing how the crust and contents changed due to the change in culture.

name: A Step Further From Fantasy
description_book: Overview of some basic women's garb of the Middle East + discussion of items worn by others at War. Includes ideas for making garb you possess.

name: Intermediate Bobbin Lace
description_book: Learn patterns from *Le Pompe* with new techniques. Bring 8 pairs of bobbins wound with Gutermann silk or an equivalent thread.
description_web: Learn patterns from *Le Pompe* with new techniques (picots, sewings, windmill crossings). Bring 8 pairs of bobbins wound with Gutermann silk or an equivalent thread.

name: Renaissance Musical Instruments
description_book: Intro to musical instruments played in Renaissance Europe, illustrated by woodcuts and recordings. First session: winds. Second session: strings.
description_web: We will go on a tour of the instruments played in late Renaissance Europe, illustrated by woodcuts from Praetorius' *Syntagma Musicum* (1614-1620), and listen to many examples. The first session will focus on wind instruments and the second session will focus on stringed instruments.

name: *Reich* & Pike: Military History of *Landsknechte*
description_book: Learn why the formidable and flamboyant *Landsknechte* of the 15th and 16th centuries become so rightly feared across Europe.
description_web: Learn why the formidable and flamboyant *Landsknechte* of the 15th and 16th centuries become so rightly feared across Europe.

name: Sharpening and Using Woodworking Tools
description_book: Have you had terrible luck with planes and chisels? This class will help you learn to sharpen, tune and use these tools.

name: Introduction to Spinning Poi
description_book: In this one-hour workshop you will learn some of the basic poi movements and terminology necessary to get you started.
description_web: In this one-hour workshop you will learn some of the basic poi movements and terminology necessary to get you started. Poi spinning is a great low-impact workout that will help you to improve your coordination and give your fitness routine some "flare"! After paying for their first class, students are welcome to return to subsequent classes free of charge!
fee_itemization: $20.00 Material Fee covers handout, poi, and refreshments

name: *RunValdr*
description_book: System for using runes for healing and "magic."
