description_web: In period runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to heal even at distance, to awaken inanimate objects, to stop migraines, and more.

name: Losing "Loadum"
description_book: A late-Renaissance trick-avoiding card game.
description_web: A late-Renaissance trick-avoiding card game.

name: Armor Extrication: Train the Trainer
description_book: Directed to those who want to teach armor extrication. Individuals wishing to teach these techniques outside the SCA are welcome.

name: Bling on a Budget
description_book: How to use glass jewels, beads, and metal to add dignity and ostentation to garb without going broke.
description_web: How to use glass jewels, beads, and metal to add dignity and ostentation to garb without going broke. From minor flourishes to full-bore excess, planning and execution covered by instructor with 25+ years experience working with these forms of embellishment. Supplies available for purchase; prices vary depending on patterns chosen. No purchase necessary.
fee_itemization: Fee depends on choices made. No purchase necessary.

name: Natural Hair Dye: Henna and Beyond
description_book: Learn how to use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever.
description_web: Learn how to use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever. We'll focus on henna but explore other herbs to color and protect hair naturally without dangerous chemicals. Some supplies will be available at the class.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching.
description_web: During this ten-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and mundanely. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. The focus is on comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.

name: Known World Choir Rehearsal
description_book: Join the oldest Pennsic Choir as we rehearse in preparation for a concert Aug 1. We will perform some music in tribute to Owain Phyfe.
description_web: The Known World Choir, along with the Children's and Youth Choirs, the Debatable Choir, Chorulus Pennsicus, and other guests will present a concert of medieval and Renaissance choral literature. As part of their repertoire, the Known World Choir will perform some songs in tribute to Owain Phyfe.

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Warp a loom, weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes & hat; leave from Univ. Point. **We are seeking teachers to help us continue this Pennsic tradition!**
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. **We are seeking teachers to help us continue this tradition, one of Pennsic's two longest-running classes!**

name: How to Draw Manuscript Flora
description_book: If you passed kindergarten art class, you can draw a 14th-C French scroll.
description_web: If you passed kindergarten art class, you can draw a 14th-century French scroll. This class will break down the elements and have you leaving confident and ready to illuminate.

name: I Spy: Calligraphy
description_book: Want your calligraphy look more “medieval"? Letters don't look quite right? Learn how to analyze calligraphy and take your letters to the next level.
description_web: Searching for ways to make your calligraphy look more “medieval"? Not sure why your letters don't look quite right? This class will show you how to analyze calligraphy and take your letters to the next level. We will apply what we've discovered by learning a late-period Italian script, Rotunda, one of the scripts used in *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*. Some calligraphy experience is helpful.

name: Bellatrix System: Teardrop Return
description_book: A very powerful sword technique, providing very rapid, powerful combinations. Unarmored class; appropriate for all levels of proficiency.
description_web: The class teaches the Teardrop Return, one of the essential and most powerful offensive techniques of the Bellatrix method of fighting with sword and shield. It provides the fighter with the ability to use very rapid combinations of full-force strikes. The class is appropriate for authorized fighters at all levels of proficiency. The class is taught unarmored. Students must bring a sword and a shield.

name: Tribal Odyssey Intermediate Combinations
description_book: More funky, flowing combos for duets or large group tribal improv (lead and follow) with Atesh of Orluk (Anthea/Kawakib). Finger cymbals optional.
description_web: Slow and fast tribal combinations with finger cymbals! Suitable for any level.

name: Confections and the Banquet
description_book: What was a "banquet"? What was served and where? Includes sugar work, recipes.
description_web: The Elizabethan "banquet" was what we call "dessert". Learn what confections were served and where. See examples of sugar work. Handouts can be available electronically.

name: Fae Mythology
description_book: This class will go into fae creatures and the history of fae mythology from the British Isles and beyond, from the time of Pro-Celts to modern era.
description_web: This class will go into fae creatures and the history of fae mythology from the British Isles and beyond, from the time of Pro-Celts to modern era.

name: Baby Carrier Survival Guide
description_book: Babywearing 101 to advanced. Help in using any carrier, history, safety and more. Lots of hands-on & trouble-shooting. Bring baby. Latecomers welcome.
description_web: Babywearing 101 to advanced. Do you want to use a carrier at Pennsic but just can't "get" it? We have learned over time that holding your baby is good for them - and you. We have also experienced a baby that wants to be in arms most of the time. A quality carrier or a simple piece of cloth can give you that extra pair of hands you always think about. We will talk about historical carriers, extreme temperature baby-wearing, and how women managed in the hot fields world-wide and wore their baby. Expect lots of hands-on. You will learn new baby-wearing skills. Bring your carrier. I will be able to trouble shoot with you and show you how to be more comfortable with it. If your baby is fussy in a carrier, we can work together and see if there is a way he/she DOES like to be worn. While I will discuss historical carriers, trouble-shooting and getting everyone comfortable with a carrier is the focus of this class.This class was slotted for 2 hours, you can come any time even if the class is going on. Bring a flash drive to download my information.

name: Leather Case/Book for Sharp Pointy Things
description_book: Guys-This class is for you, too! Yes, you'll use needles and thread, but you'll have a small leather case to store pins & needles in your kit-safely!
description_web: Guys - This class is for you, too! Yes, you'll use needles and thread, but in one hour you'll have a small leather case that rolls up neatly to safely store pins & pre-threaded needles in your kit for those times you need to pin or sew up a pesky tear. Please note we will be using sharp pointy things and leather punches. Basic sewing skills are helpful.
fee_itemization:
Leather Cover, Waxed Cotton Thread
***Donated by me: Fabric pages and thread to use in class, plus a threaded sewing needle and safety pin to get you started.

name: Folk Tunes of the Elizabethan Era
description_book: Learn to sing a few songs and rounds from the Elizabethan era, some broadside ballads and some tunes collected by Thomas Ravenscroft.

name: Beaded Kumihimo
description_book: Part 4: Students will learn how to make modern jewelry from an ancient technique. Students will make a beaded bracelet to take home.
description_web: Part 4: Students will learn how to make modern jewelry from an ancient technique. Students will make a beaded bracelet to take home. It is recommended to bring your own magnification for work if needed. Teacher will have limited number of magnifiers for use.

name: Intoduction to Labyrinths
description_book: Labyrinths wend through all of period. Learn the basic types and how to draw them. Explore their change over time. Taught by ”The Chalk Labyrinth Guy”
description_web: It matters not if you are Tudor or Turk, Norseman or Nepalese, Breton or Borgia, labyrinths are a part of your world. Topics covered are "What *is* a labyrinth?" ; categories and types; how to draw one; and a whirlwind tour of labyrinths in period. From storytelling devices to dancing floors, from monster trap to heavenly road the labyrinth has meant many things to many peoples. Brought to you by "That Chalk Labyrinth Guy."

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Performing Arts Pavilion on Thursday afternoon of War Week. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.”

name: Armor Extrication
description_book: Learn how to remove armor without injuring yourself, the fighter, or their armor and when to use it (splinting/support).
description_web: Learn how to remove armor without injuring yourself, the fighter, or their armor and when to use it (splinting/support). Covers the assorted types of armor used in all adult and youth SCA martial activities. While the class is directed toward first aid providers, it is useful knowledge for anyone who may be assisting armored individuals. The logic presented here can also be applied to complex garb. This class will be part class room and part walking tour of the combat areas. Volunteers will provide you the opportunity get hands-on practice during the class.

name: The Wayward Nun: *Pizochara*
description_book: An intermediate-level allegorical dance of the less official happenings in monastic communities. Steps will be reviewed.

name: Care and Feeding of your Fire
description_book: Hands-on class on the proper construction, lighting and maintenance of fires for various purposes.
description_web:
Hands-on class on the proper construction, lighting and maintenance of fires for various purposes. We will work on fuel types, kindling, types of fires and how to use starting techniques like firebows and flint & steel. Discussion and construction of different fire arrangements with a focus on their purpose.

Children are welcome if under the supervision of a parent.

name: Bellatrix System: Single-Hip Return
description_book: Very powerful sword technique; allows combinations with full-force strikes on each count; unarmored class for all levels of proficiency.
description_web: The class teaches the Single-Hip Return, one of the essential and most powerful offensive techniques of the Bellatrix method of fighting with sword and shield. It allows the fighter to use combinations, with full-force strikes on each count, instead of every other count. The class is appropriate for authorized fighters at all levels of proficiency. The class is taught unarmored. Students must bring a sword and a shield.

name: Heraldic Customer Service
description_book: How to be a better local officer/consultation herald with a few relatively painless changes.
description_web: So you went to the bathroom during the bizmeet and now you're the herald. Or maybe you've been your group's herald since Cariadoc was a bootblack and there's no one to take over the office. Come learn some ways to be a better officer and serve your group without letting the heraldry go by the wayside.

name: Blackwork Embroidery: Make-and-Take Pincushion
description_book: Learn basic blackwork embroidery stitches while creating a period-style pincushion. Bring scissors.
description_web: Ever been curious about the stunningly detailed blackwork embroidery popular during the later periods? In this class you will learn the basic techniques of blackwork, including the Holbein (double running) stitch and backstitch. Includes tips on preparing your ground cloth, starting and stopping stitches, and using beeswax to strengthen and aid stitching. No embroidery experience necessary! Participants will receive a “make-and-take” blackwork kit that includes everything you need to make a small pincushion with a blackworked embroidery cover (thread, needle, cloth, wax, and instructional booklet). Please bring a pair of scissors and magnifying glasses if you have any difficulties seeing up close. (I will have a couple of these on hand if necessary, too.)
fee_itemization: Box ($2), cloth and stuffing ($1.50), needle (.50), wax (.50), silk thread (.50).

name: Period Bread
description_book: Learn about bread and bread making in Europe in SCA periods.
description_web: Bread and bread making in Europe throughout SCA periods. Includes discussion of replicating period flours and breads.

name: Divination: Scrying and Intuition
description_book: Divination via access to your subconscious intuition. Scrying & vision-seeking plus physical ideomotor systems such as pendulums and dowsing.
description_web: Divination via access to your subconscious intuition. Scrying & vision-seeking plus physical ideomotor systems such as pendulums and dowsing. How to hack your own nervous system to access information you didn't even know you had.

name: Contact Juggling
description_book: Learn the art of contact juggling from a professional juggler.

name: Dancing at the Villa: *La Marchesana* and *Spero*
description_book: Come learn these two fun and flirty 15th-C Italian dances in the perfect Pennsic location: Casa Bardicci.

name: A Ball in the Style of Ulm
description_book: Her Majesty, Queen Eridani of Trimaris, invites you to a midday entertainment. The ball will be in the Ulm style, with couples choosing the dances
description_web: Her Majesty, Queen Eridani Aureus of Trimaris, invites you to a midday entertainment. The ball will be like one held in 1503 in the city of Ulm, with couples choosing the dances, starting with the highest ranking guests and going all the way down the line. As at any good party, refreshments will be served.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* & Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Beginning Belly Dancing
description_book: Very basic steps and movements of belly dancing.

name: Known World Children's Choir
description_book: The Known World Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.
description_web: The Known World Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.

name: Mini-Bardic Madness
description_book: If you can't come to Bardic Madness, it can come to you. The challenges for one Fyt of Madness are at http://tilted-windmill.com/mini_madness.html
description_web: Heard about Bardic Madness, but been unable to attend? Now's your chance.  We will be answering one Fyt of Madness at Pennsic. The challenges for it can be found at http://tilted-windmill.com/mini_madness.html. This is an excellent opportunity for new and experienced performers alike. Gentles wishing to participate as a supportive audience are most welcome to attend.

name: Recipe Redaction
description_book: We will discuss recipe redaction, from identifying ingredients to serving. Focus will be on thinking through the process. We will eat the results!
description_web: We will discuss recipe redaction, from identifying ingredients to cooking times to serving. Focus will be on thinking through the process, using a specific recipe as an example. While only one recipe will be prepared, students are encouraged to bring recipes of their own to work with.

name: Piracy in the SCA Era
description_book: The history of piracy, what pirates did and didn't do, wore and didn't wear, and what they were really like.
description_web: This class will go into the history of piracy, what pirates did and didn't do, wore and didn't wear and what they were really like.

name: The Humoral Doctrine
description_book: The instructor will explain the origins and structure of the prevailing doctrine of health in the medieval and Renaissance period.

name: Norse Apron Dress
description_book: How to pattern and construct a Norse apron dress. If possible bring 2 yards of fabric, scissors, and fabric pen, though not necessary for the class.
description_web: How to pattern and construct a Norse apron dress. If possible bring 2 yards of fabric, scissors, and fabric pen, though not necessary for the class.

name: Retaining the Unretainable
description_book: This class is for anyone who will be retaining or would like to learn more about retaining at the Baronial level or retaining in general.
description_web: This class is for anyone who will be retaining or would like to learn more about retaining at the Baronial level or retaining in general. The how-to's and a brief history of retaining will be covered. Basically, the nuts and bolts of how and why we retain.

name: Flemish Stringmaking for Your Recurve or Long Bow
description_book: Learn to make your own Flemish string for your bow.
description_web: Learn to make your own Flemish string for your bow.
fee_itemization:
Dacron B50 string material
nylon center serving
Nock point

name: Beginning Coiled Basket-Making
description_book: Learn to make a small basket utilizing traditional coiling techniques. Student will be provided all materials. Beginner-level skill.
description_web: Learn to make a small basket utilizing traditional coiling techniques with period materials. Student will be provided all materials to make a small basket. Beginner-level skill.

name: Rethinking SCA Events
description_book: Let's take a strategic look at SCA events to identify how we can create new opportunities at events to adapt to current trends and membership needs.
description_web: It is important to take a critical look at how we run SCA events to make sure that they are not only reflecting the mission of the SCA in general, but the needs and desires of our local and regional groups. This class will take a strategic look at SCA events to identify how we can create new opportunities in our event structures to adapt to current trends and membership needs.

name: Circa 1200
description_book: Glimpse the realities of daily life for *most* of the folk who lived in medieval England around the year 1200.
description_web: Meet Gawaine and Hedwiga, free peasants living in rural Yorkshire, England. Visit the "archeological evidence" of their home and belongings and converse with them about their hopes, dreams, and fears. This presentation is designed for school children and adults. You'll only need to bring your imagination.

name: The Astrolabe in Theory and Practice
description_book: This class will discuss the history and theory of the astrolabe and provide extensive, hands-on practical experience.
description_web: This class will discuss the history and theory of the astrolabe and provide extensive, hands-on practical experience. Details at http://astrolabeproject.com
fee_itemization: Fee covers part of the cost of a large (50+ page) handout.

name: Getting Medieval with the Rapier
description_book: A hands-on introduction to the cut-and-thrust rapier system from Joachim Meyer's 1570 manual. Bring protective gear and a rapier if you have them.

name: Dancing at the Villa: 16th-Century Dance Games
description_book: We'll learn two dance games from *La Caccia d'Amore*, one involving a chase, and the other involving poaching!

name: *Igaku*: Samurai Medicine
description_book: An introduction to pre-modern Japanese medicine and health thought and practices.
description_web: An introduction to pre-modern Japanese medicine and health thought and practices.

name: Board Games
description_book: This class will review board games previously taught and provide opportunities to practice with a knowledgeable instructor's assistance.

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. No fee. String provided.

name: Known World Youth Choir
description_book: The Known World Youth Choir is open to youth age 12-18 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.
description_web: The Known World Youth Choir is open to youth age 12-18 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.

name: Scribal Bootcamp
description_book: Hands-on instruction & practice making an SCA-style scroll start to finish, working closely with an experienced scribe from concept to completion.
description_web: Hands-on instruction & practice making an SCA-style scroll start to finish, working closely with an experienced scribe from concept and wording to calligraphy, drawing & painting, to completion. This is a class for beginners with some small experience to intermediate scribes looking to improve their skills at putting pencil, paint and ink to paper. Class size will be limited! Please sign up at AEthelmearc hospitality the morning of class.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Intermediate/Advanced Turkish Romany Dance
description_book: Grooving to the 9/8, adv footwork, pelvic movements, style and accents for Romany dance. We'll put it all in combos and dance! Basic class encouraged!
description_web: We're gonna groove to the 9/8! This class is an extension of my Turkish Romany Basics class!  We'll break down and drill the footwork involved in Romany style dance, add basic and layered pelvic movements and accent gestures, then work them all into combos. Knowledge of 9/8 rhythm is encouraged but not required.  Some handouts and music will be available to purchase. Bring your notebooks and dancing feet!

name: Pennsic Runestone Memorial Discussion
description_book: A discussion of the Pennsic Runestone Memorial Community Project - the concept, design, location and efforts needed to bring this project to light.
description_web: A discussion of the Pennsic Runestone Community Project - We will be discussing the concept behind this 9-ton memorial stone that will be carved by you. Most importantly, we will be discussing the funds and what all is needed to bring this project to completion. Those interested in the project as a curiosity are welcome as well as volunteers, donors and anyone who feels moved to be involved. We will discuss the design and the location of this memorial and the park that will evolve around it for memorial services, contemplation or a quiet read.  At the end of the discussion we will take a walk up to the area that has been granted us by the Coopers to carve and erect this memorial stone.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Traditional Norwegian Brewing
description_book: Ale and beer...the joy of life! We will trace the evolution and brewing techniques used in rural Norway from the earliest records. Recipes included.
description_web: Ale and beer: the joy of life! If one has bread, one also has beer, rich in vitamin B. We will explore the entire process from malting the grain to taking the first sip. Recipes, folklore, the tools used, brewing charms, and more will also be presented.

name: Basic Silversmithing
description_book: Make a period-looking pendant using cabochon semi-precious stone and sterling sheet & wire. Process includes forming, silver soldering and finishing.
description_web: Students will make a pendant using cabochon semi-precious stones which would have been available in period, and sterling silver sheet and wire. The processes will include forming, silver soldering and finishing.
fee_itemization:
Silver sheet and wire  $25
Semiprecious Stone  $10
Expendable Materials  $5

name: Dealing with Medical Devices & Garb Roundtable
description_book: Dealing with medical devices and garb, such as (not limited to) cochlear implants, insulin pumps, CPAP. Share your knowledge with others.
description_web: Dealing with medical devices and garb, such as (not limited to) cochlear implants, insulin pumps, CPAP machines and camping. Share your knowledge with others.  Have problems finding hats to fit over CIs? What alternatives/help are out there to integrate garb with the modern, medically-necessary device?  Share experiences.

name: Medieval Sewing: Part 1
description_book: Come learn the techniques used to sew all varieties of clothing. No previous experience needed! Please bring scissors if you have them.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to know how medieval clothing was actually constructed? Learn the techniques used to sew all varieties of clothing. This class focuses on the 14-15th centuries, but the methods are applicable to other periods as well.   This class is hands-on and no previous sewing experience is needed!  We will be using modern materials to master the techniques. See Part 2 of this class for sewing with medieval materials. Please bring scissors if you have them.

name: Wire-Wrapped Jewelry
description_book: Learn the basics of wire-wrapped jewelry and make a bracelet or medallion hanger.
description_web: Learn the basics of wire-wrapped jewelry and make a bracelet or medallion hanger. Please bring tools, wire and beads if you have them. There will be some tools available to borrow and some to purchase at cost.

name: Basics of Russian Clothing
description_book: Learn the basic structure of Russian garb, including patterns, seam finishes, decorative techniques, embellishments. Handout available.
description_web: Learn the basic structure of Russian garb, including patterns, seam finishes, decorative techniques and embellishments. Handouts are available.

name: Bellatrix System: Great Weapons
description_book: Bellatrix techniques for great weapons; for use against all weapons and at all ranges, as well as techniques for different physical capabilities.
description_web: Learn the Bellatrix system for the use of great sword and glaive, focusing on the close-in techniques against other great-weapons, and against sword and shield. Modify these techniques for different physical capabilities. It will also cover fighting at medium and long range. The class can be taught armored, unarmored, or with helms and gauntlets. Participation in the exercises will vary, depending. At a minimum, students must have gloves and a great sword, long bastard sword, or pole weapon. Some students should bring swords and shields for use in training.

name: Dancing at the Villa: *Cascarde*
description_book: Come and enjoy two *Cascarde*, fun and lively 16th-C Italian dances from Caroso. This class will include *Alta Regina* and *La Castellana*.

name: Beginner Dance: The Inns of Court (Old Measures)
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Class will start with the basic steps and patterns for simple middle class dances from Elizabethan England.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps & patterns, and then teach simple middle class dances from Elizabethan England.

name: Period Board Games
description_book: Games Tent staff will teach a variety of period board games. Students will then have time to play them.
description_web: Games' tent staff will teach a variety of easy-to-learn period board games from various cultures. Students will then have a chance to play them.

name: *Chorulus Pennsicus*
description_book: A limited voice choir by audition only that will rehearse and perform at War. Attend first session if interested. Listeners are welcome.
description_web: A limited voice choir by audition only that will rehearse and perform at War. Attend first session if interested. Listeners are welcome. Music will be available in advance from the KWChoir yahoo group's page.

name: Intermediate  Doumbek  2
description_book: More Intermediate topics from 9/8 to soloing to technique. Also playing with punch and power.

name: ASHI First Aid & CPR Challenges
description_book: For current ASHI First Aid and CPR card holders whose cards expire soon and wish to challenge the written test and skills demonstration.
description_web: For current ASHI First Aid and CPR card holders whose cards expire soon and wish to challenge the written test and skills demonstration. Textbooks are available for review prior to taking the challenge.
fee_itemization: $15 per certification.  Extra charge for textbook if you wish to keep it.

name: Coronation Ceremonies from Period Sources
description_book: Methods for creating more authentically-based coronation ceremonies using period sources.
description_web: Methods for creating more authentically-based coronation ceremonies using period sources, illustrated by several examples that the instructor has recently produced in the East and AEthelmearc with great success. Will cover secularization, music, ritual objects, geographical and temporal differences.

name: 12th-Century Mitten Stitch from Oslo
description_book: Another needle-binding stitch from an extant mitten. A hands-on class with materials and tools available for loan and purchase or bring your own.
description_web: Another needle-binding stitch useful for sturdy and warm clothing from an extant mitten dated to the 12th century. The class is hands-on. Yarn and needles are available both for loan and for purchase. Free handout. Handouts for previous stitches will also be available.
fee_itemization: $5 for the needle if you keep it. Borrowing is for free.

instructor: Lady Angharad verch Glyndwr O Llang
name: Basic Bookbinding
description_book: Basic binding of books, history, hands-on, practical application. Learn different stitches and page attachment; leave with a small bound book.
description_web: Basic binding of books, a bit of history, hands-on, and practical application. Participants will learn different types of stitching and page attachment, plus covers, and will leave with a small bound book and/or a girdlebook cover.

name: Reproducing a Bead - Design, Construction
description_book: How to examine a bead or bead photo and figure out how to reproduce it.
description_web: How to examine a bead or bead photo and figure out how to reproduce it.
fee_itemization:
Copying fee only.
Will also be available for printing at Mystic Mail.

name: Embroidery for Children and the Young at Heart
description_book: Children learned to embroider at a young age in the Middle Ages. Children as young as four can manage nice freehand embroidery.
fee_itemization: Favor blank, small hoop, needle, embroidery floss.

name: Building a Bardic Book
description_book: For new bards or performers in search of new performance material: tips and advice from a librarian. Emphasis on pre-1600 music/poetry/story.
description_web: For new or aspiring bards, or performers in search of more performance material: tips and advice from a bard (mundanely a librarian) on sources for music and more. Emphasis on pre-1600 music (plus some poetry/story) but we'll also make forays into "traditional" songs, SCA songs, and resources for those who need words for their music, or music for their words.

name: *Cuirboulli*: Water-Hardened Leather Armor
description_book: How to make armor from vegetable-tanned leather, using hot water.
description_web: How to make armor from vegetable-tanned leather, using hot water.

name: Blockprinting
description_book: European-style blockprinting for artwork on paper, and clothing and cloth decoration. This hands-on class will include block carving and printing.
description_web: European-style blockprinting on paper and fabric using wood blocks. Historically used for artwork as well as clothing and cloth decoration. This hands-on class will focus on historical techniques and include block carving and printing.

name: The Varangian Guards of Byzantium
description_book: A short history on the Varangian Guard in the Byzantine Empire from inception through the 4th Crusade.
description_web: The Varangian Guard are considered to be one of the most revered representations of foreign mercenaries serving under the Byzantine Empire. Primarily consisting of Norsemen and other Northern Europeans, the guard was sworn to protect the emperor and the imperial family while also participating on the front lines of pivotal battles. Here we will give a narrative history of the guard, their origins, primary source material, and if they actually did survive the Sack of Constantinople in 1204.

name: Beginning Viking Wire Weaving
description_book: Students will learn to make intricate chains in the manner of the Vikings and other cultures, without need for heat or complicated tools.
description_web: This class will teach beginning students to make intricate chains in the manner of the Vikings and other ancient cultures, without the need for heat or complicated tools. With the techniques presented, you will learn to create items like the ones found in Viking burials and treasure hoards across the Nordic countries dating from the 9th century to the late 12th century. Wire chains made in this fashion have also been discovered in the British Isles (875 AD) and in the Roman, Greek and Byzantine civilizations from the 4th century BC to the 1st century AD. Timeless items can be created that are still beautiful and wearable today. If you have needle-nose pliers and wire cutters, please bring them. If you need glasses for close or small work, please bring them. The fee for the class includes the materials needed to complete the leather cord necklace. To view this unique jewelry, please visit www.AncientWire.com/book.htm

name: A  Cross-Curricular Study of *Commedia dell' Arte*
description_book: This class will analyze *commedia dell' arte* in scope with other performing arts of the Renaissance such as courtly dance, theater, and bardic arts.
description_web: Have you ever wondered how *commedia dell' arte* affected or influenced other performing arts of the Renaissance? Caroso, an Italian dance master, and other artisans alluded to *commedia dell' arte*. This class will feature related research and roundtable discussion about *commedia dell' arte* in scope with other performing arts of the Renaissance.

name: FAP: German Medieval *Messer*
description_book: Freelance Academy Press presents German medieval *Messer*.
description_web: Freelance Academy Press presents German medieval *Messer*.

name: Dancing at the Villa: *Chigi* Dances
description_book: Come learn two dances from an early source of 16th-century Italian dances: the *Chigi* manuscripts! For all levels of dancers.
description_web: Come learn two dances from an early source of 16th-century Italian dances: the *Chigi* manuscripts! For all levels of dancers. Dances: *Rose E Viole, Spagnioletta*.

name: Beginner Dance: Bransles
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then introduce you to fun bransles from 16th-C France.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then introduce you to fun bransles from 16th-C France.

name: Laugh and Lie Down
description_book: A 16th-century card game. Fun and easy for children and adults.
description_web: A 16th-century card game. Fun and easy for children and adults.

name: Advanced *Repoussé* & Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block working, forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block working, forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.

name: Vocal Techniques for Singers, Bards & Storytellers
description_book: Learn proper breathing, vocal exercises, projection techniques, and how to care for your voice.
description_web: Learn proper breathing, vocal exercises, projection techniques, and how to care for your voice. Singing and public speaking involve your whole body - learn to do it the right way so you can do it for a lifetime!

name: Kumihimo Basics
description_book: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: Kumihimo: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk & string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Known World MoAS Meeting
description_book: All MoAS of the Known World, please attend if you are able so we can meet each other, chat, and talk about issues and best practices.
description_web: All MoAS of the Known World, please attend if you are able so we can meet each other, chat, and talk about issues and best practices.  Anyone else who is interested may also attend.

name: East Kingdom Exchequers Roundtable
description_book: This is an opportunity for Eastern Exchequers to meet, discuss concerns or issues and ask questions. Training will be available.
description_web: This will be an opportunity for Exchequers of the East to meet each other, discuss concerns or issues and ask questions. Training will be available, if the need arises.

name: Bardic Collegium: Competition and Challenges
description_book: Competition and challenges are a fact of SCA life. We'll discuss formal A&S faires and structured challenges and competitions.
description_web: We spend most of our effort at the Collegium making nice, friendly places for bards to sing "Kumbaya" together. But competition and challenges are a fact of SCA life. So let's discuss formal A&S faires and structured challenges and competitions - how to run them, how to participate in them.

name: Viking Age Furniture: The Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of the major finds of Viking Age furniture, with help to interpret the finds to make accurate reproductions. 45-page handout.
description_web: A brief survey of the major finds of Viking Age furniture, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make reasonably accurate reproductions. We will cover digs at Norse sites such as Oseberg, Birka, Dublin, Hedeby, Staraya Ladoga, etc. In addition, we will look at artifacts from neighboring areas. There will be a 45-page handout available.

name: Period Jewelry You Can Make
description_book: A class on how to make simple period jewelry.

name: The Turkish Bath
description_book: Pennsic is our vacation; why not pamper ourselves? Learn about the history of the Turkish bath, try beauty treatments & desserts. Bring a towel.
description_web: Pennsic is our vacation, so why not pamper ourselves? Come learn about the history of the Turkish bath, try out some beauty treatments & sample Turkish desserts. Please bring a towel. For privacy, this is open to self-identified women & girls only.
fee_itemization: Henna, beauty supplies, desserts and tea.

name: Dancing at the Villa: *Anello* and *Amoroso*
description_book: Join us at the marvelous Casa Bardicci to learn two simple and elegant 15th-C Italian dances: *Anello* and *Amoroso*.
description_web: Join us at the marvelous Casa Bardicci to learn two simple and elegant 15th-century Italian dances: *Anello* and *Amoroso*.

name: Cascarde *Chiara Stella*
description_book: *Chiara Stella* is a fun and lively dance from Fabritio Caroso. Students should be familiar with 16th-C Italian dance steps.

name: Arabic Folk Songs
description_book: Learn some songs from Arabic-speaking countries, including lyrics, pronunciation, meaning, melody and rhythm.
description_web: Learn songs of various regions of the Arab world. All aspects of the songs will be covered, including lyrics, pronunciation, meaning, melody and rhythm. Open to singers (these are folk songs - anyone can sing them!), melody musicians and drummers who understand volume control. Quarter-tone alert: some of the songs will include quarter-tones. In order to be able to play these tunes, you will need to have an instrument capable of playing quarter-tones, such as *oud*, violin, *ney*, or the vocal cords you were born with.

name: Choral Conducting
description_book: Hands-on training in conducting patterns, cueing, finding & fixing errors, and choral leadership. You will sing & direct with teacher mentoring.
description_web: Taught by a past Pennsic Choir director and current director of the Debatable Choir, this class covers conducting patterns, cueing, finding and fixing errors, and choral leadership. Participants will sing and direct the other students in a choral piece, with assistance and advice from the instructor.

name: Beginner Russian Calligraphy
description_book: The basics of medieval Russian calligraphy. Learn the basics of writing the Old Church Slavonic alphabet.
description_web: The basics of medieval Russian calligraphy. Learn the basics of writing the Old Church Slavonic alphabet. There will also be a hand-out for Russian-style English alphabet. The hands-on portion of the class is limited to 15 people.

name: Why Knot Know Your Knots?
description_book: Do you know your knots? Come learn some of the basics that will make your life so much easier - in camp at Pennsic, at home, or anywhere!
description_web: Do you know your knots? Come learn some of the basics that will make your life so much easier - in camp at Pennsic, at home, or anywhere! We'll take it slow, and learn the bowline, sheet bend, constrictor, clove hitch, and some others, depending on time. I'll bring ropes for everyone (limited to 30), and we'll get all tied up! You'll leave with some great skills, and enjoy life-long use of ropes and knots. Join us!

name: Orgainizing a Successful Feast
description_book: Successful feasts start with planning. How to set-up and organize a feast, lessons learned from a State Dinner, followed by round-table discussion.
description_web: Successful feasts start with planning. How to set-up and organize a feast. Instructor will give lessons learned from many feasts, including State Dinner at Pennsic, followed by round-table discussion of what students have seen that works/doesn't work.

name: Yes, Virginia, You CAN Build a Yurt
description_book: Yurts are 18 shades of groovy, but quite expensive. The charming and talented Majester Alchamar will teach you how to build your own. You can do this.
description_web: If you're reading this, you probably already know what a yurt is: round, Mongolian-based tents that have no poles, guy lines, and no corners. But in addition to being 18 different shades of groovy, they cost a fair penny to buy. What if I told you that you could trade a bunch of the cash outlay for elbow grease instead? It's true, and I invite to join the class to see how it's done. We'll touch on tools, materials, and techniques, using advanced technical terms like "... and remember, don't bleed on the saw". With a decade-and-a-half of yurt-building experience, I'll be your instructor and comic relief. I'm charming, talented, and incredibly handsome. And humble. But seriously, c'mon down, we'll have some fun expanding our list of Things We Can Do.
fee_itemization: The hand-out is just over 20 pages. It costs at least that much to print the things. It might have gone up since last year. But I plan to make free e-mail copies available to those who'd prefer it.

name: Jewish Heraldry and Onomastics
description_book: How to create a period Jewish name and/or device. Covers forms used in different languages plus Jewish symbols used in period heraldry.
description_web: How to create a period Jewish name and/or device. The class will cover forms used in different languages plus Jewish symbols used in period heraldry. The class will cover the evolution of Jewish names over time (and place), as well as Jewish canting arms.

name: Medicine Before a Provable Germ Theory
description_book: Learn about the correlation between medicine and disease in late-period England.
description_web: People in late-period England viewed medicine in much the same way as people do today: full of complex theories, new and different types of medication, and sub-specialties that may or may not have actually been helpful. While we can either go to the pharmacist or take over-the-counter medicine, they were able to go to the apothecary or make their own. Come learn a quick overview of late-period English medicine.

name: Dealing with Difficult People
description_book: This class will help you deal with the difficult people you meet in the SCA.
description_web: Learn to deal successfully with difficult people. Sometimes there are difficult people in the SCA, and this class is designed to give you the tools to not only manage, but to be successful in your interactions with even the most difficult people you have to interact with. The instructor is a licensed independent therapist who works with a wide variety of clients including teaching anger management and parenting skills.

name: Viking Knot Ring
description_book: Learn to make a Viking knot ring. If you have your own ring mandrel & pliers, please bring them.
description_web: Learn to make a Viking knot ring. There are several different types of knot rings throughout history. The one this class will focus on has been dated to the 9th - 11th century and comes from the Viking culture. If you have your own ring mandrel, chain nose, needle-nose pliers or round-nose pliers, please bring them. If you need glasses for close or small work, please bring them. An image of the ring can be found at www.ancientwire.com/AncientWireII.htm.

name: German Combatives: Wrestling Techniques
description_book: Learn leg-hooks, hip-throws, locks, and winds from Ott, Lew, and von Auerswald. Falling down will be optional, but recommended (dress appropriately).

name: Unusual English Country Dances
description_book: Not all English country dances follow "the usual pattern". This class will cover some Playford dances with unique features.
description_web: Not all English country dances follow "the usual pattern". This class will cover some Playford dances with unique features. Possible dances include *Confesse, Argeers, Saint Martins, Lord of Carnavan's Jegge,* and *Saturday Night and Sunday Morn.*

name: The Cornett and the Serpent - Renaissance Brass?
description_book: Made of wood, played with a brass type mouth piece and fingered like a recorder.  A hands-on discussion about the cornett and serpent.
description_web: Once a favorite of composers and now obscure, the cornett is a musical instrument with a trumpet-type mouth piece that is made of wood and fingered like a recorder. The larger serpent, which filled the need for bass instrument, is a late-period ancestor of the modern tuba. Are they brass or woodwind? Join in for a hands-on discussion about these instruments, information on where to buy, and how to play.

name: Introduction to Whisky
description_book: History, ingredients, distilling process, how to taste whisky, applicable laws, and nomenclature. Limited tasting samples provided. Over 21 only.
description_web: A beginner-level course covering the history of whisky, ingredients, the whisky-making process, how to taste whisky, laws governing whisky, and nomenclature. A Q&A session is a provided at the end of class. Samples for the tasting are provided free of charge. Over 21 only.

name: Introduction to Beginning Period Cookery
description_book: Want to cook in period but don’t know where to start? No problem! For beginners who want a quick intro to some basics of modern period cookery.
description_web: Want to cook in period, but don’t know where to start? Your apartment doesn't have a handy open fireplace? No idea what an “eyroun” is or where to buy one?  No problem! This class is designed for those beginners who have never cooked a period recipe before but want a quick introduction into some of the basics of modern period cookery.

name: Anglo-Saxon Coinage
description_book: What coins were used in Anglo-Saxon England from 600-1066?
description_web: What's in your pouch? What coins were used in Anglo-Saxon England and areas with which they traded? We'll cover from the Migration period to the Norman Conquest. We'll also talk about moniers.

name: EKBG Panel and Meet and Greet
description_book: Members of the East Kingdom Brewers' Guild may sign up for panel slots with the Guildmistress. Others are welcome to visit and share their potables!
description_web: Members of the East Kingdom Brewers' Guild may sign up for panel slots with the Guildmistress. Others are welcome to visit and share their potables! Panel opportunities are contingent on availability of those trained and eligible to do the paneling. More panel opportunities may be scheduled and would be held in a private camp (Thanet House). If those opportunities become available, they will be advertised on the EKBrewers Yahoo Group. Meet and greets will happen even if panels are not available.

name: 5 Easy Steps to Writing Documentation for A&S Comp
description_book: For those who have never written documentation to get a start on the process, and to improve the skills of those who have.
description_web:
Many of us haven’t even written a book report, let alone a research paper, since high school. But don’t worry, you can write documentation for your entries with a little bit of guidance and a simple and easy-to-understand approach. This class is geared to help those who have never written documentation to get a start on the process, and to help those who have written documentation to improve their skills.
Handouts will be provided free of charge which will cover the "5 Steps to Writing Your Documentation", how to cite your sources and the use of the Internet (good and bad) for research. We will be also looking at examples of documentation from artisans around the Knowne World.

name: Ball Prep
description_book: Want to dance at the ball, but have no or little idea how? This is the class for you! All steps will be taught, along with etiquette & survival tips.

name: *Muhekian* - The Taste of Tea
description_book: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothing with white socks or tabi, and bring a fan if you have one.
description_web: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothing with white socks or tabi, and bring a fan if you have one. Please do not wear any jewelry or weapons in the tea room.
fee_itemization: cost of tea and sweets - 12 per sitting.

name: Period Lamp and Blowpipe Soldering, plus Welding
description_book: Braze and weld with lamp and blowpipe on charcoal blocks.
description_web: Braze and weld with lamp and blowpipe on charcoal blocks.

name: Youth Combat Open Field Activites
description_book: Open practice and games for youth fighters. Please check the on-line description or at the Youth Combat list field for more information.

name: A Ball in the Style of Henri III, 1584-1585
description_book: Come experience a ball based on one given by Henri III of France in the late 16th century. The event will feature numerous improvisational dances.
description_web: Come experience a ball based on one given by Henri III of France in the late 16th century. The event will feature numerous improvisational dances, such as the pavan, allemand, galliard, lavolta, and bransle. The ball will also include Mistress Felice's annual galliard competition, with prizes for the winners, and will end relatively early to allow for additional open dancing.

name: Bellyoff with Ishtar
description_book: Middle Eastern Dancers - Show everyone that you have the moves to make the Knowne Worlde take notice! Pick an Ishtar song from the basket and dance!
description_web: Middle Eastern Dancers - Show everyone that you have the moves to make the Knowne Worlde take notice! Pick an Ishtar song from the basket and dance! Songs will be chosen at random and performance can be solo or group. Sign-up is the night of the Bellyoff. Show up, draw a song and dance!

name: Open Dancing
description_book: Join us after the ball for dancing by request.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: A general, multi-level yoga class to address the needs of the Pennsic attendee. Please dress for modesty, and bring a mat/towel or similar.
description_web: A general, multi-level yoga class to address the needs of the Pennsic attendee. Please dress for modesty, and bring a mat/towel or similar. Children responsible enough to follow along are welcome.

name: Building a Spring Pole Lathe
description_book: Learn how to make your own break-down spring pole lathe with materials that you can get at any home center.
description_web: Learn how to make your own break-down spring pole lathe. By using materials that you can get at any home center, you will soon be turning out bowls, plates, chairs, etc.

name: Lucet: Beyond Square Cord
description_book: You can make good square cord; what's next? Flat and multi-color cords. Bring your lucet. (We can slip a cord off and put it back on after class.)
description_web: You’re comfortable making square cord; what's next? We'll work on flat and multi-color cords. Please bring your lucet. We'll also demonstrate how to slip a cord off, and put it back on after class.
fee_itemization: (3) colors of floss on cards, and handout

name: Medicine, Physick, and Surgery
description_book: An overview of medicine as practiced by Doctors, Surgeons, and Apothecaries.
description_web: An overview of the three "official" branches of healthcare (Physicians, Surgeons, Apothecaries), with a look at other trades such as midwife, herbalist, etcetera.

name: If Looks Could Kill - Evil Eye Amulets
description_book: Discussion of the history of the "Evil Eye" and the amulets used in the SCA time period.
description_web: In-depth discussion of the history of the "Evil Eye". What is it and how it influenced people in the ancient world. Discussion of the amulets used for protection through many cultures and time periods to modern day.

name: Viking Navigation
description_book: This class will present at least two of the methods of direction-finding seen in the Viking TV series.
description_web: The methods of navigation employed by the Viking navigators are currently unverifiable by archeological evidence. However, the search for answers goes on. This class will present the arguments for at least two methods of direction-finding by experts in the field. The published findings of Soren Thirslund from the Danish National Maritime Museum and Leif Karlsen, a retired merchant marine navigator will be presented. Both of these gentlemen’s published findings are internationally recognized and available from the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde Denmark. Hands-on demonstrations and primary source documentation of these authors’ navigation theories.

name: Planning a Fiber-to-Garment Project
description_book: Project planning. Discuss how to construct a hand spun, handwoven garment. The steps, tools, and **math** involved. Bring ideas and projects!
description_web: Project planning class. We will be discussing how to construct a hand spun, handwoven garment. The steps, tools, and **math** involved. Bring ideas, projects, drafts, etc.

name: Medieval Gardens: Basic Resources
description_book: Basic design of pre-1600 gardens, with a review of the resources for finding out more.
description_web: This class will introduce the basic types of documented pre-1600 gardens, with some attention to layouts, design, and plants. The instructor will bring and discuss a variety of information resources for researching and planning medieval & Renaissance gardens. Come look at the pretty pictures.  Can't make the whole two hours? Joining the class in progress is encouraged.
fee_itemization: Handout will include printed resources and color pictures.

name: Travel and Trade in Anglo-Saxon England
description_book: Where did the Anglo-Saxons travel, how and why?
description_web: What forms of transportation were used during the Anglo-Saxon period? Where did they go? Why? How? How far? The Crusades were in part to protect pilgrimage routes. When did they start to go to the Holy Land, and where else did they go?

name: Flemish String-Making
description_book: Taught by Rask, Viking Archery. Please bring your own bow string. Some string is available.

name: Pike Drills in Period
description_book: You will be drilled mercilessly until proficient at the press of pike. Bring a 10-foot pike or SCA spear. Some loaners will be available.
description_web: You’ve joined a Landsknecht *Faehnlein* and now must become proficient at the press of pike. Hauptman Maximilian will drill you mercilessly until he deems you ready. Bring a 10-foot pike (SCA-legal spears are good). Some loaners will be available. Six-person minimum required.

name: Intro to Egyptian-Style Group Improvisation
description_book: Learn basic Egyptian group improv dance with beledi-style combinations.
description_web: Rajni is a Certified Level 1 Tribal Odyssey dance leader, a group improvisational style developed by Kawakib of Fredericksburg, VA. In the words of Kawakib: “Tribal Odyssey uses natural posture and both sides of the body in combinations based primarily on Egyptian beledi-style movement. It's versatile enough to adapt to any size group.” Class will repeat to allow for several days of practice with a group, and will incorporate recorded Middle Eastern drumming as well as live music/ drumming as available. Learn moves that you and your dance friends can use at Pennsic haflas this year!

name: How Hot Is It?
description_book: A hands-on lab experience where we explore the actual temperatures various cooking methods produce.
description_web: A hands-on lab experience where we explore the actual temperatures various cooking methods produce. Discussion and experimentation to teach ourselves how to gauge temperature without using modern thermometers and measuring devices.

name: Baltic Wire Weaving
description_book: Beginner, hands-on introduction to Baltic wire weaving techniques for making jewelry and trim. Brief discussion of history and artifacts included.
description_web: This will be a hands-on introduction to Baltic wire weaving techniques for making jewelry and trim. There will be a discussion of the history of wire woven chains as well as examples of different patterns and historical finds.
fee_itemization: Materials fee includes dowel and enough wire to finish your project

name: How to Create a Period Feast
description_book: Come and talk about how to create a feast that period people might have eaten.
description_web: Come and talk about how to create a feast that period people might have eaten.

name: Livery Collars
description_book: An exploration of this elite accessory, with a focus on earlier examples and historical significance, plus a discussion of how to adapt to SCA use.

name: *Marudai* for Beginners (Also *Kumihimo*)
description_book: Part 6: *Kumihimo* on a *marudai* stand for beginners. Learn to braid beginning patterns on the traditional Japanese stand.
description_web: Part 6: *Kumihimo* on a *marudai* stand for beginners. Learn to braid beginning patterns on the traditional Japanese stand.
fee_itemization:
5.00 for class and handout
3.0 for handout only

name: Bow-Making - Self Bows
description_book: Taught by Foresters Gladius & Merlinus, 10 am-2 pm. Demo with hands-on instruction.

name: Gathering of the Louds
description_book: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Players of loud Renaissance instruments  gather just for fun to play poly-choral music. Come and be heard.
description_web: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Players of loud Renaissance instruments  gather just for fun to play poly-choral music. Not sure what these instruments are? Come listen or try one. Bring a music stand and clothespins.

name: Introduction to *Go*
description_book: A basic introduction to the Japanese game of *Go*.
description_web: A basic introduction to the Japanese game of *Go*.

name: Beyond Lucet Basics
description_book: Variations, Loops, and Monkey Wrenches.
description_web: Starts with a basic refresher class for everyone. We then proceed to Variations, Loops, and Monkey Wrenches. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. String provided.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes & hat; leave from Univ. Point. **We are seeking teachers to help us continue this Pennsic tradition!**
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. **We are seeking teachers to help us continue this tradition, one of Pennsic's two longest-running classes!**

name: Skully Bits: Skulls and Skeletons in Prayer Beads
description_book: Lecture class on the use of skulls and skeletons in western European paternosters in the SCA period.
description_web: Lecture class on the use of skulls and skeletons in western European paternosters in the SCA period.

name: The Champagne Fairs
description_book: A history of the great Champagne Fairs of Northern France and their impact on Europe's culture and economics.
description_web: A history of the great Champagne Fairs of Northern France. The fairs were six-to-eight-week-long international trade fairs, rather than small market fairs. They played a major role in the flow of goods and ideas and laid the foundation for international banking and finance as we know it today.

name: Deconstruction of Period Glass Beads
description_book: Hands-on class designed to show construction techniques of period glass beads using clay instead of glass.
description_web: Hands-on course using clay/playdough to demonstrate complex techniques that are sometimes difficult for a beginning glassworker to understand. Twisted and complex mosaic cane discussion and discussion of complex period beads.

name: Ballads and Balladmongers
description_book: Thanks to technology, balladmongers took the "singing for your supper" in a very new direction. An overview of late period techniques and resources.
description_web: The Balladmongers were a special breed that took advantage of new technology and embarassing situations to create a whole new genre. An overview of the peformance techniques, categories and resources in late period.

name: Advanced Labyrinths
description_book: A more in-depth look into the symbolism and use of the labyrinth in specific cultures (to be determined by participants)
description_web: A more in-depth look at the symbolism and use of the labyrinth in certain cultures. Participants will help guide the discussion with their questions.

name: Fool School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Performing Arts Pavilion on Thursday afternoon of War Week. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.”

name: *Spagniolette* by Request
description_book: There are now 7 known choreographies of the 16th-C Italian dance *Spagnioletta*.  Come learn any of them, by request.

name: Pennsic Food Lab
description_book: Semi-permanent cooking lab where we will use non-modern materials and techniques (pottery, spit roasting, etc.).
description_web: Semi-permanent cooking lab where we will use non-modern materials and techniques (pottery, spit roasting, etc.). The purpose of this class will be to provide cooks with the infrastructure and tools to try medieval cooking techniques by eliminating modern conveniences and equipment. Medieval pottery will be available to work in on a limited, pre-arranged basis. A basic larder will be available, but cooks are encouraged to come with recipes and ingredients that they would like to try. This is a hands-on play session in a laboratory style environment. Children are welcome if accompanied by an adult.
fee_itemization: Fee will cover fuel and basic larder ingredients.

name: Pagan Beliefs in Ancient Russia
description_book: This is a brief reconstruction of ancient Russian mythology, based on archaeological and folkloric evidence.
description_web: Slavic mythology is a difficult subject. The historical evidence is fragmented, with many conflicting sources and multiple later literary inventions. This is a brief reconstruction of ancient Russian mythology, based on archaeological and folkloric evidence.

name: Bringing Your Research Into the Real World
description_book: Have you ever wanted to bring your research into the real world? Come find out how from one who has done it.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to bring your research into the real world, but wasn't certain it was 'good enough'? Come find out what it takes to make it in the worlds of academia and independent scholarship from one who has done it.

name: Beginning *Pysanky*
description_book: Students will learn the history of the *pysanka*, and have the opportunity to create one of their own.
description_web: Students will learn the history of the *pysanka*, as well as the techniques involved, and have the opportunity to create one of their own. The class is listed as 3 hours to allow plenty of time for writing the shells; it doesn't usually take that long.
fee_itemization: $5 overall, $2 if you just want the handout (but it IS a hands-on class ...)

name: Late Period Cross Sititch and Variations
description_book: Examines how cross stitch was used, alone and with other stitches, plus a brief look at long-armed cross and reversible cross stitch.
description_web: Examines examples of extant pieces and images, as well as how cross stitch was used, alone and with other stitches, plus a brief look at long-armed cross and reversible cross stitch.

name: Basic Ka-Kha-Ga-Gha
description_book: Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *devanagari* script used by Hindi, Sanskrit and other Indic languages.
description_web:
Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *devanagari* script used by Hindi and other North Indic languages (including Sanskrit, post-period). While the focus of this class is on Hindi usage, the characters and pronunciation are nearly identical for the others. There will be examples in Hindi. Please bring a writing utensil which makes a dark, easily-visible line. This is not a calligraphy class.
1st hour: Basic characters and pronunciation
2nd hour:  Vowel and half-letters forms; more if time and student interest allow.

name: Kingdom Youth Officers, Deputies & Y&F Council
description_book: Society Deputy for Family & Youth Programs meeting with Kingdom Youth Officers, Kingdom Youth Officer Deputies, and Youth and Family Council members
description_web: Society Deputy for Family & Youth Programs meeting with Kingdom Youth Officers, Kingdom Youth Officer Deputies, and Youth and Family Council members.

name: Easy ECD for All Experience Levels
description_book: Not only for beginners; for anyone who would like to learn more in depth. Includes *Gathering Peascods, Half Hannikin, Sellenger's Round, Black Nag.*
description_web: Not only a beginner class, this is for anyone who would like to learn English Country Dance as reconstructed directly from Playford, and not necessarily as done in current tradition. Includes *Gathering Peascods, Half Hannikin, Sellenger's Round, Jenny Pluck Pears, Black Nag.*

name: Beginning *Repoussé* & Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; will make a copper foil rose.

name: Beginning Belly Dancing
description_book: Very basic steps and movements of belly dancing.

name: Mini-Bardic Madness
description_book: If you can't come to Bardic Madness, it can come to you. The challenges for one Fyt of Madness are at http://tilted-windmill.com/mini_madness.html
description_web: Heard about Bardic Madness, but been unable to attend? Now's your chance.  We will be answering one Fyt of Madness at Pennsic. The challenges for it can be found at http://tilted-windmill.com/mini_madness.html. This is an excellent opportunity for new and experienced performers alike. Gentles wishing to participate as a supportive audience are most welcome to attend.

name: Known World Children's Choir
description_book: The Known World Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.
description_web: The Known World Children's Choir is open to children up to age 11 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.

name: Known World Choir Rehearsal
description_book: Join the oldest Pennsic Choir as we rehearse in preparation for a concert Aug 1. We will perform some music in tribute to Owain Phyfe.
description_web: The Known World Choir, along with the Children's and Youth Choirs, the Debatable Choir, Chorulus Pennsicus, and other guests will present a concert of medieval and Renaissance choral literature. As part of their repertoire, the Known World Choir will perform some songs in tribute to Owain Phyfe.

name: Known World Youth Choir
description_book: The Known World Youth Choir is open to youth age 12-18 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.
description_web: The Known World Youth Choir is open to youth age 12-18 who love to sing and want to perform with the Known World Choir and Friends concert.

name: Beyond the T-tunic: The Bocksten Cote and Hood
description_book: Covers the history, cut, fitting, and trims and fabrics to use for the Bocksten Cote & Hood. Each student *should bring a tape measure*.
description_web: The one-piece cut for the t-tunic that we so often introduce newcomers to cannot be easily documented, either in the archaeological finds, or in the artistic remains from the Dark Ages. One cut that was commonly found, however, is typified by the Bocksten Bog find in Sweden. This class covers the history, cut, fitting, and appropriate trims and fabrics to use for this garment. Each student will leave with a pattern for a Bocksten Cote that has been individually adapted to their measurements. Also included is a discussion of the hood found nearby, and a reconstruction of a hood pattern possibly in use at that time. Students *should bring a tape measure* to class.

name: Feasts are More than Cooking
description_book: A discussion of the many things needed for a successful feast that are not in the kitchen.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Traditional Norse Medical Herbalism
description_book: Collecting, storing, and techniques of herbal preparations, some dating back to saga times.
description_web: Medicine in Norway was surprisingly sophisticated back into saga times, compared with the Continent. We will look at the herbs/roots/barks/berries/fungi, etc., used in traditional healing, including preparation and administration of salves, syrups, teas & washes, poultices, and lots more.

name: Thomas Aquinas: The Dumb Ox, The Angelic Doctor
description_book: Aquinas sought to reconcile Aristotle and church doctrine, including the relationship between reason and faith, and the concept of the just war.
description_web: In the 13th century Thomas Aquinas sought to reconcile the writings of Aristotle with the doctrines of the church, carrying scholasticism to its ultimate conclusions. His ideas continue to influence both philosophy and theology to this day. We will review the events of his life and briefly explore some of his most important ideas, including his arguments for the existence of God, the relationship between reason and faith, and the concept of the just war.

name: Bellatrix System: Two Sword
description_book: The techniques and strategy of the Bellatrix system of fighting with the two-sword style. Unarmored class. Appropriate for all levels of proficiency.
description_web: The class teaches the techniques and strategy of the Bellatrix system of fighting with the two-sword style. The class is appropriate for authorized fighters at all levels of proficiency. The class is taught unarmored. Students must bring two swords, and preferably a shield.

name: *Kodo Nyumon*: The Sound of Incense
description_book: Enjoy “listening” to the scent of aromatic wood. An introduction to the Japanese art and appreciation of incense.
description_web: Experience the dalliance of *Heian* courtiers. Participate in an incense ceremony. Enjoy “listening” to the scent of aromatic wood. An introduction to the art and appreciation of incense. Incense appreciation is deeply rooted in *Heian* court culture and is associated with *Genji Monogatari*.

name: Advanced 15th-Century Dance: *Fia Guilemina*
description_book: The most complicated, yet elegant, 15th-C couple's dance of which we know. You and your partner will impress both the crowd and yourselves.

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a trim strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a trim strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: Scribal Bootcamp
description_book: Hands-on instruction & practice making an SCA-style scroll start to finish, working closely with an experienced scribe from concept to completion.
description_web: Hands-on instruction & practice making an SCA-style scroll start to finish, working closely with an experienced scribe from concept and wording to calligraphy, drawing & painting, to completion. This is a class for beginners with some small experience to intermediate scribes looking to improve their skills at putting pencil, paint and ink to paper. Class size will be limited! Please sign up at AEthelmearc hospitality the morning of class.

name: Cadels for the Intermediate Calligrapher
description_book: Learn how to make a cadel using your own calligraphy supplies. Students should have a working knowledge of gothic and secretary hands.
description_web: Cadels, also called cadeaux, are those beautiful built-up decorative letters found in numerous sources (both illuminated manuscripts and in documents) across later periods and in different western cultures. This class will cover a hands-on lesson in creating a single cadel, with discussion on sources and techniques. Experience in gothic and secretary or batarde hands are required. Some materials may be available, but students should bring their own supplies and tools, including paper.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Advanced Bellydance Layers, Combos, and MORE
description_book: Experience strongly recommended. Learn crisp combos and layers, transitions & more. Learn to make your own. Prepare to think & sweat.
description_web: This class is geared for those with at least 3 years' solid bellydance experience. All (ages 14 and up) are welcome, but it will be complicated and fast-paced. Shaheen of Fata Morgana Bellydance takes you through her unique folkloric tribal fusion drills for isolation, sharp combos, clear layers, smooth transitions and awesome traveling steps. Learn some of her favorite combos and, even better, learn how to create your own. The second class will briefly go over what was learned in the first and add new material. Bring water, hip scarf, and notebook; prepare to think and sweat. Visit www.ShaheenAlikhanBellydance.com or find her on Facebook to keep in touch.

name: Evolution of Black Powder Arms from 1320-1600
description_book: History and development of black powder arms from 1320-1600. This is a NON-shooting, lecture/discussion class covering period firearm technology.
description_web: History and development of black powder arms from 1320-1600. This is a NON-shooting, lecture/discussion class covering period firearm technology.

name: Medieval Sewing: Part 2
description_book: Did you take Medieval Sewing: Part 1 and hunger for more? This is the class for you! We'll construct an item using medieval materials and techniques.
description_web: Are you familiar with hand sewing, but interested in sewing with medieval materials? Did you take Medieval Sewing: Part 1 and hunger for more? This is the class for you! We will construct a pouch using fabrics, threads, and techniques available in the medieval period. The techniques focus on the 14-15th centuries, but they are applicable to other periods as well. Basic knowledge of hand-sewing is recommended or take Part 1 of this class for all you need to know! Please bring scissors if you have them.
fee_itemization: Fabric, threads, and tools needed for sewing a pouch.

name: Care and Feeding of Your Army/Fighter
description_book: The army is more than just those on the field. It is also the staff that supports them. We will talk about how to support them all.
description_web: The army is more than just those on the field. It is also the staff that supports them. We will discuss things to do and items to bring to help support your army at large or your fighter.

name: How to Build a Germanic Lyre
description_book: A description of how to build an early period musical instrument.

name: Bellatrix Techniques
description_book: Fundamental & advanced Bellatrix techniques of armored sword and shield fighting. Unarmored class appropriate for all levels of proficiency.
description_web:
This class teaches fundamental and advanced techniques of the Bellatrix system of armored sword and shield fighting. It is appropriate for all levels of proficiency. Technique is one of the main pillars of successful fighting.
